Name: a
Description: 1 a pron. stem: asyá gen. sg. m., asmai dat., asmin loc.

Name: aṁśú
Description: 4 aṁśú m. 'filament esp. of soma-plant' RV., 'thread, minute particle, ray'.

Name: áṁsiya
Description: 7 áṁsiya-, áṁsya 'belonging to the shoulder' RV., '*made of or shaped like the shoulder-blade'. [áṁsa-]

Name: akarmán
Description: 9a †akarmán- 'not working, not performing good works' RV. [kárman-¹: √kr̥]

Name: akkā
Description: 16 akkā 'mother' Kāś. [← Drav. Burrow, BSOAS 12, 365: Tam. akkai 'elder sister']

Name: *akkʰa
Description: 17 *akkha 'sacking, bag, net'. [Perh. conn. Sk. ákṣi-, if Pa. akkhika- n. 'mesh of a net' < '*having eyes']

Name: akrōdʰa
Description: 19 akrōdha m. 'freedom from anger', cf. akrōdhamáya- 'free from anger' ŚBr. [krṓdha-]

Name: ákṣa
Description: 21 ákṣa¹ m. 'axle' RV., 'collar-bone' ŚBr., 'temporal bone' Yājñ., akṣaka- m.n. 'collar-bone' Suśr. [Perh. conn. ákṣu-]

Name: akṣá
Description: 22 akṣá² m. 'a die for gambling' RV., 'the tree Elaeocarpus ganitrus' Suśr., 'its seed (of which rosaries were made and which were used for dice)'.

Name: akṣa
Description: 23 akṣa-³ n. 'eye' lex. [-akṣá- in cmpd. for ákṣi- Pāṇ.]

Name: akṣa
Description: 24 akṣa-⁴ n. 'blue vitriol' lex. [Cf. Av. axšaēna- 'dark-coloured', Yid. axšin 'blue' Horn NPE 109, Morgenstierne IIFL ii 195, W. S. Allen The Classical Quarterly xli 88 note 1]

Name: ákṣata
Description: 28 ákṣata 'unhurt' RV., 'not crushed' ĀśvGr̥., m. pl. 'uncrushed barley' Kālid. [kṣatá-¹]

Name: akṣadʰur
Description: 31 akṣadhur f. 'pin or pole of axle'. [ákṣa-¹, dhúr-]

Name: akṣamālā
Description: 35 akṣamālā f. 'string of rosary beads' lex., cf. akṣamālin- m. 'name of Śiva' MBh. [akṣá-², mālā-]

Name: akṣayatr̩tīyā
Description: 37 akṣayatr̥tīyā f. 'festival on third day of bright half of Vaiśākha (which secured permanence for actions then initiated)'. [akṣaya-, tr̥tī́ya-¹]

Name: akṣára
Description: 38 akṣára 'indestructible', n. 'word, syllable' RV., 'letter of the devanāgarī syllabary'

Name: akṣavāṭa
Description: 39 akṣavāṭa-, -pāṭa- m. 'wrestling ground' lex. [lit. 'fence of poles' or 'dicing ground'

Name: akṣibʰruva
Description: 44 akṣibhruva n. 'the eyes and the brows' Pāṇ. [ákṣi-, bhrū́-]

Name: *akṣirujā
Description: 45 *akṣirujā f. 'eye-disease'. [Cf. akṣiruj- f. VarBr̥S., Pa. akkhirōga- m.: ákṣi-, rujā-]

Name: ákṣu
Description: 46 ákṣu m. perh. 'bamboo-pole' AV. (T. Chowdhury JBORS xvii 26.) [Cf. ákṣa-¹, ikṣú-]

Name: akṣōṭa
Description: 48 akṣōṭa m. 'walnut (or pistacio nut ?)' Kālid., 'Aleurites triloba, Croton moluccanum' Suśr., 'a mountain-tree pīlú-¹', lex.; akṣōḍa-, °aka-, ākṣōḍa-, ākhōṭa- lex

Name: akʰila
Description: 48b †akhila- 'complete, whole' Kāv. [Closer to khila-², *khilla- in the (generalized?) sense 'defect' than to khilá-¹, khilyá- in the special sense 'uncultivated, fallow land'

Name: agaru
Description: 49 agaru m.n. 'fragrant Aloe-tree and wood, Aquilaria agallocha' lex., aguru- R. [← Drav. Mayrhofer EWA i 17 with lit.]

Name: agásti
Description: 50 agásti m. 'the tree Agasti grandiflorum' Suśr. [← Drav. Burrow BSOAS 12, 365; Agásti- m. 'nom. prop.' perh. from this, Mayrhofer EWA I 17]

Name: agāra
Description: 52 agāra n. 'house' ĀśvGr̥., āgāra- Mn. [Prob. ← Drav., Mayrhofer EWA i 17 with lit.]

Name: *agāhya
Description: 53 *agāhya 'unfathomable'. [Cf. durgāhya- Suśr. (to be separated fr. agādha- 'deep' R. < '*having no ford'): √gāh]

Name: agni
Description: 56 agni² m. 'name of various plants, Plumbago zeylanica (Suśr.), Semecarpus anacardium, Citrus acida (lex.)'. [Same as agní-¹ ?]

Name: agnika
Description: 57 agnika '*fiery', m. 'the plant Semecarpus anacardium; a partic. scarlet insect' lex., cf. āgnika- 'belonging to the preparation of the sacred fire' KātyŚr. [agní-¹]

Name: agnikārya
Description: 58 agnikārya m. 'kindling the sacred fire with butter' Mn., °rikā- f. lex. [agní-¹, kāryà-]

Name: agnidāha
Description: 59 agnidāha m. 'a fiery glow (in the sky)' Hariv. [Cf. agnídagdha- 'burnt with fire' RV.: agní-¹, dāha-]

Name: agnidʰā́na
Description: 60 agnidhā́na n. 'receptacle for the sacred fire' RV. [agní-¹, dhā́na-]

Name: agnimantʰa
Description: 61 agnimantha 'producing fire by friction', m. 'the tree Premna spinosa' Suśr. [agní-¹, mantha-]

Name: agniṣṭʰá
Description: 65 agniṣṭhá m. 'fire-pan' ĀpŚr., °ṭhā́- f. 'that corner of the Yūpa towards the fire' ŚBr., °ṭhikā- f. 'fire-pan'. [agní-¹, stha-]

Name: agnyagārá
Description: 67 agnyagārá m. 'a house for keeping the sacred fire' ŚBr., agnyā° KātyŚr., *agniyā̆°. [agní-¹, agāra-]

Name: agrapūjā
Description: 76 agrapūjā f. 'highest act of reverence' R. [ágra-, pūjā-]

Name: agrahāyaṇa
Description: 88 agrahāyaṇa m. 'the month November-December (= mārgaśīrṣa-)' lex. [Cf. āgrahāyaṇī- f. 'the full moonday in that month' Pāṇ.: ágra-, hāyaná-]

Name: *agryapaṇa
Description: 98 *agryapaṇa 'chief price or payment in first-fruits.' [agryá-, paṇa-]

Name: aŋká
Description: 100 aṅká m. 'hook' RV., 'hip where children are carried' Br̥ĀrUp., 'curved line, mark, sign' R. [√añc]

Name: aŋkana
Description: 102 aṅkana adj. 'marking' Nir., n. 'branding' Mit. com. [aṅkáyati, aṅká-: √añc]

Name: *aŋku
Description:
107 *aṅku 'hook' in ankuṭa-, aṅkurá-, aṅkuśá-. [Cf. Av. anku- in cmpd. 'hook': √añc]

Name: aŋkuṭa
Description: 108 aṅkuṭa m. 'instrument for moving the bolt or bar of a door' lex. [*aṅku-: √añc]

Name: aŋkōṭa
Description: 113 aṅkōṭa-, aṅkōṭha m. 'the small tree Alangium hexapetalum' lex. 2. aṅkōla-, °aka-. 3. aṅkōlla-. [EWA i 20 with lit.]

Name: *aŋgakr̩ṣṭi
Description: 115 *aṅgakr̥ṣṭi f. 'stretching the body'. [áṅga-¹, kr̥ṣṭí- or poss. *vikr̥ṣṭi-]

Name: aŋgajāta
Description: 116 aṅgajāta 'produced from the body' MW without ref. [áṅga-¹, jātá-]

Name: aŋgada
Description: 117 aṅgada n. 'bracelet on upper arm' R. [← Muṇḍa Kuiper PMWS 124]

Name: aŋgana
Description: 118 aṅgana n. 'act of walking' lex., 'courtyard' R., °aṇa- n. Kālid. [√aṅg]

Name: aŋganā́
Description: 119 aṅganā́ f. 'woman' R., 'beautiful woman' lex. [← Austro-as. Mayrhofer EWA i 20 with lit.]

Name: aŋgarāga
Description: 121 aṅgarāga m. 'application of ointment, cosmetic' R. [áṅga-¹, rā́ga-¹]

Name: áŋgāra
Description: 125 áṅgāra m. n. 'glowing charcoal' RV., °aka- lex. 2. *iṅgāra-, iṅgāla- m. Vāsav. com.

Name: aŋgāraka
Description: 126 aṅgāraka '*red like embers', m. 'charcoal; name of various plants' (aṅgārikā- f. 'stalk of sugar-cane, flower of Butea frondosa'). 2. m. 'the planet Mars'. [áṅgāra-]

Name: aŋgāryā́
Description: 131 aṅgāryā́-, *aṅgāriyā-, f. 'heap of embers'. [Cf. aṅgā- rīya- 'fit for making charcoal', aṅgārikā- f., angāritā- f. 'portable fireplace' lex.: áṅgāra-]

Name: aŋgikā
Description: 132 aṅgikā f. 'woman's bodice'. [áṅga-¹: perh. replacing *aṅgiya-, áṅgya- 'belonging to the limbs' RV.]

Name: aŋgúli
Description: 135 aṅgúli f. 'finger, toe' VS., ŚBr., aṅgúri- f. AV., svaṅgurí- RV. 2. *aṅgūḍi- [2 < *aṅguẓ-ḍi- with *aṅguṣ- in aṅguṣ-ṭhá-, cf. H. Frisk Suffixales -i>th- im Indogermanischen 17.]

Name: aŋguṣṭʰá
Description: 137 aṅguṣṭhá-, °gú° m. 'thumb' ĀśvGr̥., 'big toe' KātyŚr. [aṅgu-ṣ-ṭhá-, cf. *aṅgu-ẓ-ḍi- and aṅgú-li-]

Name: aŋgōñcʰa
Description: 139 aṅgōñcha m., aṅgōñchana- n. 'towel' lex. [Poss. áṅga-¹, uñchá- m. 'gleaning esp. of single grains' (for meaning 'sweeping together, wiping' cf. development of meaning under úñchati and prōñchati). But N. Bi. H. point to MIA. *aṅga-u{ñ}cha- (with aṅgōñcha- as late Sanskritization), poss. a MIA. form with *-vuñcha- anal. replacing puñcha- < prōñcha- (as suggested by Platts UD s.v. and P. Tedesco JAOS 77. 195). In either case loss of second nasal, through dissimilation, was early (contrast úñchati, prōñchati). In any case Bloch LM 286 wrongly < aṅgavastra.]

Name: accʰa
Description: 142 accha¹ 'clear, transparent' Suśr. [Poss. 'shadowless' cf. acchāyá- RV. Neither *r̥kṣa- (Mayrhofer EWA i 22) nor ā̆rca- (P. Tedesco JAOS 77, 197) are phonet. satisfactory.]

Name: accʰidat
Description: 144 acchidat 3 sg. aor. ind. 'has cut' Pāṇ., subj. chidat{i} ŚBr. [√chid]

Name: ajá
Description: 145 ajá m. 'goat', ajā́- f. RV., ajakā-, -ikā- f. 'small or young goat' Pāṇ.

Name: ajakarṇa
Description: 147 ajakarṇa m. 'a goat's ear' KātyŚr., 'the tree Terminalia alata tomentosa' Suśr., °aka- m. 'the tree Shorea robusta' lex. [ajá-, kárṇa-]

Name: ajamōda
Description: 152 ajamōda m.,-ā-, -ikā- f. 'carroway, parsley, Ligusticum ajwaen' Suśr. [Pop. etym. ajá-, mōda-: cf. ajāji-, yavānī-]

Name: ajarā
Description: 153 ajarā f. 'Aloe perfoliata, Argyreia speciosa' lex. [Cf. ajāgara- m. 'Eclipta or Verbesina prostrata']

Name: *ajavāṭa
Description: 154 *ajavāṭa m. 'goat-pen'. [ajá-, vāṭa-¹: with EH. -r- < -ṭ- rather than < -vāra-]

Name: ajavītʰi
Description: 155 ajavīthi f. 'path of the constellation Aries' Yājñ. [ajá-, vīthi-]

Name: ajāji
Description: 156 ajājĭ̄ f. 'Cuminum cyminum, Ficus oppositifolia, Nigella indica' Suśr. [Cf. ajamōda-, yavānī-]

Name: ajína
Description: 158 ajína n. 'skin of esp. the black antelope used by ascetics' AV. [ajá-]

Name: añcala
Description: 168 añcala m.n. 'border or end of a garment' Pañcat. [√añc]

Name: añjalí
Description: 171 añjalí m. 'the hollowed hands placed together' ŚBr.

Name: aṭani
Description: 175 aṭani-, -ī- f. 'notched extremity of a bow'. [i.e. supporter of the string

Name: aṭaruṣa
Description: 176 aṭaruṣa m. 'the shrub Justicia adhatoda' lex., °rūṣaka- m. Suśr.

Name: *aṭṭ
Description: 178 *aṭṭ¹ 'contain, be contained, fit into'. [Poss. < ā́rta-¹ '*brought', cf. ā́-r̥ṇvati 'brings, reaches, obtains' RV., despite ă of P.: √r̥]

Name: aṭṭa
Description: 180 aṭṭa² 'high', m. 'tower, watchtower' Kālid., aṭṭaka- m. 'tower' lex. [Non-aryan Mayrhofer EWA i 25]

Name: *aṭṭakkalā
Description: 183 *aṭṭakkalā 'guess'. [Poss. contains kalā́-: for first part cf. L. aṭṭā-saṭṭā m. 'rough guess' and *aṇṭ-]

Name: aḍḍana
Description: 190 aḍḍana n. 'shield' lex. [Mayrhofer EWA i 25 connects with aṭṭa-²; perh. rather to *aḍḍ- 'obstruct']

Name: *aḍḍi
Description: 191 *aḍḍi 'heel'. 2. *aḍi-. 3. *ēḍḍi-. 4. *ēḍi-. [J. Bloch BSOS v 738 ← Drav., cf. Tam. Kan. aḍi, Tel. aḍugu 'foot, footstep']

Name: áṇu
Description: 192 áṇu¹ m. 'the grain-plant Panicum miliaceum' VS. [Same as aṇu-² ?]

Name: aṇu
Description: 193 aṇu² 'fine, minute' Br̥ĀrUp.; áṇvī- f. 'epithet of the fingers preparing Soma-juice' RV., aṇú 'minutely' ŚBr.

Name: *atiyañcati
Description: 210 *atiyañcati 'pulls across'. [For áti with a verb 'to pull' cf. atikarṣati 'pulls (ploughshare)' Kauś.: √añc]

Name: *ativr̩tta
Description: 213 *ativr̥tta 'passed beyond'. [Cf. ativivartayati 'separates too far' RV.Prāt., ativr̥tti- f. 'excess' Pāṇ.Kāś.: √vr̥t¹]

Name: atiṣṭʰā́
Description: 217 atiṣṭhā́ '*jutting out' (f. 'superiority' ŚBr.) [átitiṣṭhati 'juts out or over' TBr.: √sthā]

Name: *atiṣpʰāyatē
Description: 218 *atiṣphāyatē 'swells, is complete, arrives'. [For semantic development cf. sphā́yatē, *niṣphāyatē, pūryatē, prábhūta-: √sphāy]

Name: atihr̩ta
Description: 219 atihr̥ta 'added to'. [átiharati 'stands out above' ŚBr., Pa. atiharati 'brings over': √hr̥]

Name: attā
Description: 222 attā f. 'mother, mother's sister, elder sister' lex., atti{kā}-, anti{kā}- f. 'elder sister' lex. 2. *addā-. [← Drav. Tam. attai 'aunt, mother-in-law' T. Burrow BSOAS xii 366. Cf. *atta-²]

Name: *atyuṣati
Description: 226a †*atyuṣati 'burns'. 2. †*atyōṣati. 3. †*atyuṣyatē 'is burnt'. [Semant. rather than with Him.I 52 < cūṣati: cf. uṣṇánt- RV., ōṣati Pāṇ., †*atyuṣṇa-, átidahati ŚBr., and †*adhyuṣyatē: √vas³]

Name: *adinna
Description: 235 *adinna 'not given'. [Cf. ádatta- 'not having given' AV., 'not given' Mn.: *dinna-]

Name: adr̩śya
Description: 237 adr̥śya 'not to be seen' TUp. [Cf. adrēśya- s.v. *dēkṣati: dr̥śya-, √dr̥ś]

Name: admasád
Description: 241 admasád m. 'guest at a meal', perh. 'fly' at RV. i 124, 4 K. F. Geldner Vedische Studien ii 179, but disputed by H. Oldenberg Vedaforschung 90. [ádman-, √sad-]

Name: *adyāhnaḣ
Description: 244 *adyāhnaḥ 'this very day'. [Cf. idā́nīm and idā́ áhnaḥ RV.: adyá, áhar-]

Name: *adʰaōṣṭʰa
Description: 245a †*adhaōṣṭha- 'lower lip' (cf. adharauṣṭha- m. n. 'upper and lower lip, the lips' Kālid.) suggested by K. R. Norman (quoted by J. D. Smith Vīsaḷa 335). [adháḥ, ṓṣṭha-]

Name: *ádʰiyardʰa
Description: 256 *ádhiyardha-, ádhyardha- 'one and a half' ŚBr., ádhyardhaka- 'worth one and a half' Pāṇ. [ardhá-²]

Name: *ádʰiyēti
Description: 258 *ádhiyēti 'goes to'. [Cf. ádhyēti 'turns the mind to' RV. and ádhigacchati 'approaches': √i²]

Name: *adʰivāsayati
Description: 260 *adhivāsayati 'causes to remain', adhivāsa- m. 'sitting obstinately before a debtor's door'. [adhivasati 'dwells' Mn., Pk. ahivasaï 'stays': √vas²]

Name: ádʰr̩ta
Description: 270a †ádhr̥ta- 'uncontrolled, restless' TS. (cf. ádhr̥ti- f. 'restlessness' ŚBr., 'discomfort' Suśr., Pk. addhii-, adhii- f. 'inconstancy'). [√dhr̥]

Name: adʰyāpaka
Description: 278 adhyāpaka m. 'teacher' Mn., -adhyāya- (at end of cmpd.) 'reader' Pāṇ. [√i²]

Name: adʰyāyá
Description: 279 adhyāyá m. 'reading' Pāṇ., 'time given to reading' Mn. [√i²]

Name: ánanna
Description: 288 ánanna '*without food' (n. 'rice undeserving of its name' ŚBr.) [ánna-]

Name: ánapēkṣa
Description: 289 ánapēkṣa 'careless' R., ánapēkṣam adv. ŚBr. [apēkṣā- f. 'consideration, expectation' Mn., Pa. apekkhā- f., Pk. avekkhā-, avik° f.: √īkṣ]

Name: anartʰa
Description: 291 anartha 'useless, unfortunate' Mn., m. 'loss, misfortune' R., anarthyá- 'useless' ŚBr. [ártha-]

Name: ánīka
Description: 308 ánīka n. 'face, front, point, edge, row' RV., 'army' Bhag.

Name: *anutr̩tīyam
Description: 318 *anutr̥tīyam 'on the third day'. [For formation cf. anurātram 'in the night' AitBr.: see also s.v. tr̥tī́ya-¹]

Name: anupatati
Description: 323 anupatati 'flies past or after' ĀśvGr̥. [Cf. ánupātayati 'flies along' AV.: √pat]

Name: *anulabdʰa
Description: 334 *anulabdha pp. of ánulabhatē 'takes hold of from behind' ŚBr. [√labh]

Name: *anuvara
Description: 335 *anuvara 'following the bridegroom'. [For formation cf. ánupatha- 'following the road' RV., anupati 'after the husband': vará-²]

Name: anūpá
Description: 343 anūpá m. 'pond' RV., 'watery place' Mn., 'bank of river' lex. [ap-]

Name: anēnás
Description: 346 anēnás 'sinless, blameless', anēḍa-, °ēla-, nēla- 'pure' BHSk., 'stupid' lex. [For MIA. dissimilation ṇ-ṇ to ṇ-ḍ see ajñānin: ḗnas-]

Name: ánta
Description: 347 ánta m. 'end, border, proximity' RV., 'inside' R.; antaká- m. 'border (of a field)' ŚBr.

Name: antaḣpurika
Description: 351 antaḥpurika m. 'harem attendant', °kā- f. 'a woman of the harem' MW. [antaḥpura-]

Name: ántara
Description: 357 ántara¹ 'interior, near' RV., 'neighbouring' ŚBr., n. 'the inside' Mn., °rā́, °rēṇa, °rē 'in the middle'. [ántar]

Name: ántara
Description: 358 ántara² 'different, other' ŚBr. [In some cmpds. difficult to distinguish from ántara-¹: ana-]

Name: antarāla
Description: 367 antarāla n. 'intermediate space' Pāṇ. [ext. with -la- of antarā́ ? No support in NIA. for the -āḷa- proposed by Lüders PhilInd 549]

Name: antarnagara
Description: 372 antarnagara n. 'palace of a king' R. [antár, nágara-]

Name: antiká
Description: 377 antiká 'near', n. 'nearness', °kám, °kḗ 'in the presence of' RV. [ánti 'near' RV.]

Name: antēvāsín
Description: 378 antēvāsín m. 'pupil who dwells near his master' ŚBr. [ánta-, vāsín-³]

Name: andū́
Description: 382 andū́-, °u- f., °ū̆ka- m. 'chain for an elephant's foot' Śiś. [√and]

Name: andʰakāra
Description: 386 andhakāra m.n. 'darkness' R. 2. *andhĭ̄kāra- influenced by andhīkarōti 'makes blind' H. Smith BSL 101, 115. [andhá-, kāra-¹]

Name: *andʰatamisrikā
Description: 387 *andhatamisrikā, andhatamisra- n. 'complete darkness of the soul' VP., °tā° Mn. [Cf. andhatamasá- n. 'thick darkness' Pāṇ., Pa. andhatamō n., Pk. aṁdhatamasa- n.: andhá-, támisrā-]

Name: ánna
Description: 395 ánna n. 'food' RV., 'cooked rice, corn in general' Mn. 2. *anda-² < *adna- with metathesis before assimilation, Morgenstierne NTS ii 242. [√ad]

Name: apakarṣati
Description: 408 apakarṣati 'draws away' MBh. [Cf. apakr̥ṣṭa-, Pa. apakaṭṭha- 'drawn away'; Aś. mi. apakaṭha- 'distant'; replaced by *kaḍḍh- in Pa. apakaḍḍhati, Pk. ōyaḍḍhaï 'drags': √kr̥ṣ]

Name: *apakaṣa
Description: 409 *apakaṣa 'scraper'. [Cf. ápakaṣati 'scrapes off' AV., used in conjunction with takṣ-: √kaṣ]

Name: apakta
Description: 412 apakta 'not cooked'. [Cf. paktí- f. 'cooking, food' RV., pá° VS. and apakva-: √pac]

Name: *apatāna
Description: 423 *apatāna-, apatānaka- m. 'spasmodic contraction of body or stomach' Suśr. [√tan]

Name: *apadāha
Description: 426 *apadāha 'burning'. [Cf. ápadahati 'drives away by burning' RV., 'burns up' MBh.: √dah]

Name: apadʰārayati
Description: 429 apadhārayati '*holds away'. [In BHSk. and Pa. the meaning 'considers' was influenced by avadhārayati: √dhr̥]

Name: apamāna
Description: 433 apamāna m. 'disrespect, disgrace' R. [Cf. avamāna- m. Mn., Pa. ōmāna-, Pk. ōmāṇa-: māna-¹: √man]

Name: ápara
Description: 434 ápara 'posterior' RV., 'different, other' ŚBr. 2. *aparīya- Morgenstierne IIFL iii 3, 187. 3. áparam RV., °rám AV. 'again, moreover'.

Name: aparajá
Description: 435 aparajá 'born later' VS. [Cf. avaraja- 'younger', m. 'younger brother' R.: ápara-, ja-]

Name: apararātrá
Description: 436 apararātrá n. 'latter part of night, end of night' ŚBr. [ápara-, rātra-]

Name: aparaśvas

Name: aparānta

Name: *aparēndra
Description: 444 *aparēndra [ápara- or a-para- 'unrivalled', indrá-] Kal. rumb. warī́n, gen. -dras 'name of a god'.

Name: apaskara
Description: 467 apaskara m. 'faeces' Vet. and avaskara- m. 'faeces', °aka- m. 'an insect originating in faeces' Pāṇ. [√kr̥̄]

Name: apaspʰúra
Description: 468 apasphúra 'jerking'. [Cf. ánapasphura-, ᶜrant- '(of a cow) not refusing to be milked' RV.: √sphur]

Name: apahara
Description: 471 apahara m. 'carrying off' Bhām. [Cf. apahāra- m. 'stealing' R., Pk. avahāra- m.: √hr̥]

Name: apahāsa
Description: 473 apahāsa m. 'mocking laugh' R. [Cf. avahāsa- m. MBh., Pk. ōhāsa- m.: √has]

Name: apāmārgá
Description: 480 apāmārgá m. 'the plant Achyranthes aspera (used in washing linen)' AV. [√mr̥j]

Name: apidʰā́na
Description: 488 apidhā́na n. 'cloth for covering, cover' RV., °nī- f. 'cover' Āp. [√dhā]

Name: apūpá
Description: 491 apūpá m. 'cake of flour' RV. 2. pūpa- m. 'a kind of cake' MBh. 3. pūpalā- f. 'a sweet cake fried with ghee or oil' lex., °lik̇ā- Car., pūpālik̇ā- Suśr. [J. Charpentier, Le Monde Oriental xxvi 112 ← Drav. Tam. appam, &c. cf. also Muṇḍa in Savara p̣upu 'cake, bread, pudding' ← Sk ? Poss. further conn. in pūra-², pauli-]

Name: apūpíya
Description: 492 apūpíya-, °pyà- 'fit for cakes' Pāṇ., n. 'meal' lex., °pī́ya- Pāṇ. [apūpá-]

Name: ápya
Description: 501 ápya 'being in water' RV., or ā́pya- 'living in water, belonging to water' Suśr. [áp-]

Name: apsarás
Description: 502 apsarás f. 'one of the female divinities connected with water' RV. [áp-]

Name: ábrahman
Description: 504 ábrahman 'without Brahman' RV., abráhman- m. 'what is not B.' [bráhman-]

Name: *abʰāriya
Description: 509 *abhāriya 'not to be borne'. [Cf. bhāryà- 'to be borne' TS.: √bhr̥]

Name: abʰíkarōti
Description: 509a †abhíkarōti, abhíkr̥ṇōti 'does on behalf of, effects' RV. AV. 2. †*abhikr̥ta-. [√kr̥]

Name: abʰidʰyā
Description: 519 abhidhyā f. 'wish, covetousness' BHSk. [Cf. abhídhyāyati 'sets one's heart on' TS.: √dhyai.]

Name: *abʰinābʰi
Description: 520 *abhinābhi 'up to the navel' [For abhi- cf. abhijñú 'up to the knee' RV.: nā́bhi-]

Name: abʰiplavá
Description: 521 abhiplavá m. ('a partic. religious ceremony' ŚBr., abhiprava- Kāṭh.) '*overflow, *flood'. [Cf. abhipluta- 'overflowed' MBh.: √plu]

Name: abʰimanyu
Description: 523 abhimanyu m. 'nom. prop. of a son of Arjuna'. [√man]

Name: *abʰimlāyati
Description: 526 *abhimlāyati 'withers'. 2. *abhimlāpayati 'causes to wither'. [Cf. mlā́yati 'withers' ŚBr., caus. mlāpáyati AV., án-abhimlāta-varṇa- 'of unfaded colour' RV.: √mlai]

Name: *abʰiyávaharati
Description: 527 *abhiyávaharati, abhyá° 'throws down (into water)' VS. 2. *abhiyavaharaṇa-, abhyavahá° n. 'throwing down' ŚBr. 3. *abhiyavahāra-, abhya° m. 'taking food' Mn. [√hr̥]

Name: abʰihāra
Description: 534 abhihāra m. 'bringing near' Pat., '*offering'. [Cf. abhíharati 'brings, offers' ŚBr., Pk. ahiharaï 'takes, raises': √hr̥]

Name: abʰukta
Description: 540 abhukta 'not eaten, who has not eaten' (= abhuktavant- MBh.) MW. 2. *abhugna-. [bhuktá-: √bhuj²]

Name: abʰyàsyati
Description: 546 abhyàsyati 'throws on' ŚBr., 'concentrates on, practises' MBh., abhyasatē Mn.; abhyasana- n. 'practice' Mn. 2. *abhíyāsayati. [Cf. Pa. abhyāsa-, abbhāsa- m. 'repetition'; Pk. abbhasaï 'learns': √as²]

Name: abʰrá
Description: 549 abhrá¹ n. (rarely m.) 'cloud, rainy weather' RV. 2. abhríya- 'belonging to the clouds', m.n. 'thundercloud' RV.

Name: ámatra
Description: 555a †ámatra- n. 'large drinking vessel' RV. [IE. *amatro-, cf. malla-³ Burrow Tau vii 156]

Name: amarēśvara
Description: 557 amarēśvara m. 'name of a place in Kashmir' Rājat. [amára-, īśvará-]

Name: amarṣa
Description: 558 amarṣa m. 'non-endurance' Pāṇ., 'impatience, anger' MBh., ām° lex. [Cf. amarṣaṇa- n. 'impatience' MBh., Pa. Pk. amarisaṇa- n.; marṣa- m. 'patience' lex., marṣaṇa- n. MBh.: √mr̥ṣ]

Name: amā́tya
Description: 561 amā́tya m. 'inmate of the same house' RV., 'minister of a king' Mn. [amā́]

Name: amāvāsyaka
Description: 564 amāvāsyaka 'born on a new moon night' Pāṇ. [amāvāsyāˋ-]

Name: amāvāsyā̀
Description: 565 amāvāsyāˋ f. 'the night of the new moon' AV. 2. amā- vāsíyā-. [amāvāsyà-]

Name: ambā́
Description: 574 ambā́ f. 'mother' RV. [Cf. ambī̆́- RV., ámbikā- VS., ambāḍā-, °ālā- Pāṇ., °ālī- TS.]

Name: amlá
Description: 579 amlá 'sour, acid' Mn., m. 'acidity, vinegar, wood sorrel', n. 'sour curds' Suśr., āmla- n. 'sourness' lex.

Name: amlapattra
Description: 581 amlapattra m. 'the plant Oxalis and others' lex. [amlá-, páttra-]

Name: amlavallī
Description: 583 amlavallī f. 'the plant Pythonium bulbiferum Schott'. [amlá-, vallī-]

Name: ayám
Description: 587 ayám nom. sg. m. 'this', f. iyám, acc. m. imám, nom. pl. m. imḗ, f. imā́ḥ

Name: ayaścūrṇa
Description: 589 ayaścūrṇa n. 'powder prepared from iron as a vermifuge' Suśr. [áyas-, cūrṇa-]

Name: ayaskāṇḍa
Description: 591 ayaskāṇḍa m.n. 'a quantity of iron, excellent iron' Pāṇ. gaṇ. [áyas-, kā́ṇḍa-]

Name: ará
Description: 594 ará m. 'spoke of a wheel' RV. 2. āra-² MBh. v.l. [√r̥]

Name: áraṁkarōti
Description: 595 áraṁkarōti, áraṁkr̥ṇōti 'makes ready, serves' RV. 2. áraṁkr̥ta- 'made ready' RV. 3. álaṁkr̥ta- 'adorned' ŚBr. [Cf. álaṁkarōti 'makes ready' ŚBr. 'decorates' R., Pa. id., Pk. alaṁkaraï: áram, √kr̥¹]

Name: aragʰaṭṭa
Description: 596 araghaṭṭa m. 'wheel for raising water' Pañcat., °aka- m. lex. [ará-, *ghaṭṭa-²]

Name: áraṭu
Description: 597 áraṭu m. 'the tree Colosanthes indica' AV., v.l. °ḍu-, aralu- m. Kauś., °uka- m. Suśr., araṭvá- 'made of its wood' RV.

Name: áraṇa

Name: aráṇi

Name: áraṇya
Description: 600 áraṇya n. 'foreign land' RV., 'desert, jungle' AV. 2. araṇyaka- '*wild', n. 'forest' Yājñ. 3. iriṇyà- 'relating to desert' VS., iraṇyà- MaitrS. [áraṇa-]

Name: aratní
Description: 603 aratní m. 'elbow, corner, cubit' RV., f. BhP., °nika- m. Yājñ., ratni- m.f. ĀśvŚr.

Name: ararī
Description: 605 ararī f. 'leaf of a door' lex., °ri- m. Rājat., °ra- m. n. Bhām., arará- n. 'covering, sheath' lex.

Name: arā́ḍa
Description: 607 arā́ḍa-, f. °ḍī́- 'having high horns' MaitrS., arāḍyà- TS.; arāla-¹ 'curved, crooked' R. [Kuiper PMWS 13 < *alāḍa- ← Mu.]

Name: áriṣṭa
Description: 609 áriṣṭa¹ 'unhurt, safe' RV., (euphem.) 'fatal, disastrous' R., m. 'crow' lex. [riṣṭá-¹]

Name: ariṣṭa
Description: 610 ariṣṭa² m. 'soap-nut tree' Yājñ., °taka- m. Mn., riṣṭa-² m. lex. [Poss. same as áriṣṭa-¹]

Name: aruja
Description: 615 aruja 'free from disease' Suśr., 'gay, brisk' R. [Cf. aruj- Suśr.: √ruj]

Name: aruṇá
Description: 616 aruṇá 'red' RV., n. 'red colour' RV., m. 'dawn' Mn., aruṇī́- f. 'red cow, dawn' RV. [aru- ?]

Name: aruṣka
Description: 618 aruṣka 'wound, sore' Car. [Cf. árus- 'wounded, sore' ŚBr., n. 'wound, sore' AV., Pa. aru-, °uka- n., Pk. aruya- n.]

Name: arká
Description: 625 arká² m. 'the plant Calotropis gigantea' ŚBr. [Cf. alarka-² m. Suśr., alāka- m. Car., Pa. alakka- m.]

Name: arkaparṇá
Description: 626 arkaparṇá n. 'leaf of Calotropis gigantea' ŚBr., m. 'the plant'. [arká²-, parṇá-]

Name: arkapādapa
Description: 627 arkapādapa m. 'the tree Melia azadirachta' lex. [arká-², pādapa-]

Name: *arkavarta
Description: 628 *arkavarta 'a sort of ornament'. [Cf. arkapuṭikā- f. 'a silver ornament consisting of a round disk like the sun' lex.: arká-¹, *varta-³]

Name: *argaḍa
Description: 629 *argaḍa-, argala- m.n. 'bolt', irgala- m.n. Pāṇ., argalikā- f. 'small bolt' lex. [Cf. sā́rgaḍa- 'barred' ŚBr. Poss. Muṇḍa origin and further connexions in IA. Kuiper PMWS 14.]

Name: argʰá
Description: 630 arghá m. 'respectful reception of guest' ŚBr., 'value, price' Mn. [√arh]

Name: argʰya
Description: 633 arghya 'valuable' Kālid., 'deserving respectful reception (as a guest)' PārGr̥., 'used at such reception' Gobh., n. 'water offered at such reception' ĀśvGr̥. 2. *arghiya-. [arghá-]

Name: arcís
Description: 635 arcís n. (f. ŚBr.), arcí- m. 'ray, flame, lustre' RV. [√arc]

Name: *arjana
Description: 636 *arjana 'millet'. [Cf. Pers. arzan, Orm. ažan Morgenstierne IIFL i 388, Psht. ẓ̌dan, Khot. éysä H. W. Bailey BSOS viii 122]

Name: artʰín
Description: 640 arthín 'active' RV., 'desiring, libidinous' R., m. 'beggar' Mn., 'servant' lex., arthika- 'desiring' MBh. [ártha-]

Name: árdʰa
Description: 643 árdha¹ m. 'part, place, country' AV., ŚBr., árdham c. gen. 'near' ŚBr.

Name: *ardʰakuḍava
Description: 646 *ardhakuḍava 'half a kuḍava'. [Cf. ā˅rdhakauḍavika- 'equal to half a ku°' Kāś.: ardhá-², kuḍava-]

Name: ardʰatr̩tīya
Description: 651 ardhatr̥tīya 'two and a half' ĀśvŚr. 2. *ardhatr̥tya-. [ardhá-², tr̥tī́ya- and *tr̥tya- in Pk. tacca-]

Name: ardʰabʰāga
Description: 666 ardhabhāga m. 'half' Kālid., cf. ardhabhāgin- 'receiving a half share' Yājñ. [ardhá-², bhāgá-]

Name: *ardʰavayasa
Description: 672 *ardhavayasa 'middle age'. [Cf. pūrvavayasá- n. 'first age', madhyamavayasá- n. 'middle age' ŚBr.: ardhá-², váyas-³]

Name: árdʰika
Description: 682 árdhika 'measuring half' Yājñ., 'forming half of' Mn., 'receiving half the crop' Viṣṇus. [Cf. ardhín- 'forming a half' TS., 'receiving a half' Mn.: ardhá-²]

Name: arpáyati
Description: 684 arpáyati 'causes to move' AV., 'puts in or on' RV., 'delivers up' Yājñ. [√r̥]

Name: arbudá
Description: 686 arbudá¹ m. 'snake' (ár° m. 'snake-demon') RV., m.n. 'long round mass, esp. foetus in 1st or 2nd month' Yājñ., 'tumour, polypus' Suśr.

Name: arbuda
Description: 687 arbuda² m. 'name of a mountain', pl. 'of a people' BhP.

Name: árbʰa
Description: 687a †árbha- (arbhá- AV.) 'small' RV., arbhaká- RV., m. 'child' Ragh., arbhagá- RV.

Name: árśas
Description: 690 árśas n. 'piles' VS., arśōvartman- n. 'tumour in the corner of the eye' Suśr.

Name: alakta
Description: 695 alakta m.n. 'a partic. red substance, prob. lac or lac dye' R., °aka- m.n. Kālid. [Forms with ā- suggest poss. origin from or contamination with ārakta-, cf. raktā- f. 'lac' Suśr. and lākṣā́- which M. Mayrhofer ZDMG 105, 181 derives from *rakṣa- < IE. *reg-s- in Pers. raxš 'bright']

Name: alakṣaṇá
Description: 696 alakṣaṇá 'having no marks' ŚBr., 'unfortunate' Kālid., n. 'inauspicious sign' Mn. [lakṣaṇá-]

Name: alagardá

Name: alají
Description: 701 alají f. 'inflammation of the eye' AV., °jī- f. 'discharge at the juncture of cornea and sclerotica' Suśr.

Name: alarka
Description: 705 alarka¹ m. 'a fabulous animal' MBh., 'a mad dog' Suśr.

Name: alasá
Description: 708 alasá 'inactive' ŚBr. 2. ālasa- lex. [Mayrhofer EWA i 552 with lit. l-form of arasá-]

Name: alā́bu
Description: 711 alā́bu-, °ū- f. 'bottle-gourd' Suśr., m.n. 'vessel made of it' AV., n. 'its fruit' MBh., ālābu- f. lex. 2. lābū̆- f. 'gourd' lex., lābukī- f. 'a kind of lute' lex., lā́pu- m.n. 'a partic. instrument' MaitrS. 3. lambā- f. 'a bitter gourd' Suśr. [Austro-as.: Mayrhofer EWA i 55 with lit. Cf. further Pk. kalavū- f. 'gourd']

Name: alin
Description: 716 alin m. 'black bee' BhP., 'scorpion' lex., alí- m. 'bee' Kālid., 'scorpion' lex., alinī- f. 'female bee' Śiś. 2. āli-² m. 'bee' lex., 'scorpion' VarBr̥S. [H. Lüders PhilInd 428 equates alí- (< *r̥di-) with Gk. ἄρδις 'spear-point': perh. < *aḍin- 'having a sting', cf. ala- m. 'sting in tail of scorpion or bee' lex., sāḍa- 'having a point or sting (as stick, scorpion, &c.)' Pat.]

Name: alinda
Description: 717 alinda¹ m. 'terrace before a house door' Kālid., °aka- m. lex., ālinda- m. lex.

Name: alīká
Description: 718 alīká 'unpleasing' AV., 'untrue' MBh., 'a little' lex. [For semantic relation of 'lie' and 'little' cf. Sh. koh. čōṭ 'lie' ~ N. choṭo 'small' s.v. *chōṭṭa-]

Name: ávakā
Description: 727c †ávakā- f. 'Blyxa octandra Rich., grassy plant in marshy land' VS., ávaka- m. id. MaitrS.

Name: ávakāśatē
Description: 729 ávakāśatē 'is visible' ŚBr., ávakāśayati 'causes to look at' ŚBr. [Cf. avacā́kaśat- 'shining' AV., 'seeing' RV.: √kāś]

Name: avakirati
Description: 732 avakirati 'scatters, pours out' ĀśvGr̥., 'spills semen' TĀr., 'bestrews, fills' MBh. [√kr̥̄¹]

Name: *avakṣala
Description: 734 *avakṣala 'washing' or *avakṣālya- 'to be washed off'. [Cf. Pa. avakkhalita- 'washed off': √kṣal]

Name: *avakṣōdati
Description: 737 *avakṣōdati 'crushes'. [Cf. avakṣudya 'having rubbed or pounded to pieces' Suśr.: √kṣud]

Name: avagalati
Description: 742 avagalati 'falls down, slips down' Śiś. 2. With anal. -gg-. 3. *avagālayati with anal. gg. [Cf. *avagirati: √gal¹, √*gr̥̄¹]

Name: *avagʰātana
Description: 754 *avaghātana 'instrument for crushing'. [Cf. avaghāta- m. 'threshing corn in a mortar' Jaim.: √han¹]

Name: avacaya
Description: 758 avacaya m. 'gathering (flowers, &c.)' Kālid. [Cf. avacinvatī́ pres. part. f. 'drawing back (a garment)' RV., Pa. ōcinā̆ti 'gathers' :√ci¹]

Name: avacūḍa
Description: 759 avacūḍa m. 'pendent crest of a standard' Śiś., avacūla- m. Kād., °laka- m. 'chowrie' lex. [cū́ḍa-¹]

Name: avaccʰinna
Description: 766 avacchinna 'separated' Lāṭy. [Cf. ávacchidyatē 'is separated from' TS., Pa. occhindati 'cuts off, severs': √chid]

Name: *avajjʰarati
Description: 770 *avajjharati 'drips down, falls, throws down or away'. [√*jhar]

Name: *avajjʰāyati
Description: 771 *avajjhāyati 'extinguishes'. [Cf. avakṣā́ṇa- 'burnt down, extinguished' MaitrS., aṅgārāvakṣáyaṇa- n. 'instrument for extinguishing coals' ŚBr.: √*jhai]

Name: avatá
Description: 774 avatá m. 'well, cistern' RV. 2. avaṭá- 'hole in the ground' SV., VS. 3. *āvāṭa-¹.

Name: avadarati
Description: 782 avadarati 'splits open', aor. subj. ávadarṣat RV. [Cf. ávadīryatē 'is split' ŚBr., Pa. avadīyati :√dr̥̄]

Name: *avanidrā
Description: 791a †*avanidrā- f. 'falling asleep': cf. ávadrāti (fut. part. avadrāsyát- ŚBr.) and avasupta- MBh. [√drai]

Name: ávabādʰatē
Description: 796 ávabādhatē 'keeps off' RV., '*presses down'. [Cf. sáṁbādhatē AV., Pk. saṁbāhaï 'presses down': √bādh]

Name: ávabʰaratē
Description: 797 ávabharatē 'sinks into', °ti 'throws into' RV. Some confusion prob. with avaharatē 'brings down' KātyŚr. since from Pk. onwards cmpds. of bhr̥- and hr̥- collide phonet. [√bhr̥]

Name: avarā
Description: 813 avarā² f. 'the afterbirth' PārGr̥., amarā-, °alā- 'afterbirth, umbilical cord' lex. [Cf. sā́vara- 'together with the afterbirth' ŚBr.: ávara- ?]

Name: avarōdʰa
Description: 815 avarōdha m. 'shoot sent down by a branch of the banyan tree' AitBr., °rōha- m. Kauś. [√ruh¹]

Name: avarṇa
Description: 818 avarṇa 'having no outward appearance' ŚvetUp., 'colourless' MBh. Cf. avarṇasaṁyōga- m. 'no connexion with caste' Āp. [várṇa-¹]

Name: *avalaŋgʰati
Description: 824 *avalaṅghati °ghita- 'passed (of time)' Kathās. [Cf. *avalaṅghayati in Pa. ōlaṅghēti 'makes jump down': √laṅgh]

Name: avalamba
Description: 826 avalamba, °ka- 'hanging down' R., m. 'stay, support, perpendicular' KātyŚr. [√lamb]

Name: *avalipya
Description: 832 *avalipya 'to be smeared'. [Cf. avalipta- 'smeared' MBh., Pa. ullittāvalitta- 'plastered inside and out', Pk. ōliṁpaï, ōlitta-: √lip]

Name: avalīyatē
Description: 833 avalīyatē 'stoops' MBh., 'hides oneself' R., 'sticks to' Suśr. 2. X *ullīyatē (cf. caus. ullāpayatē 'causes to lie down, humiliates' Pāṇ. Kāś.). [√lī]

Name: *avalōpayati
Description: 839 *avalōpayati 'has cut off'. [avalumpati 'takes off, cuts off' TS., Pa. ōlumpēti 'wrests off', Pk. ōluṁpa- m. 'crushing': √lup]

Name: avavāda
Description: 842 avavāda m. 'speaking ill of' lex. (cf. apavāda-), 'instruction' BHSk. [Cf. avavaditr̥- 'one who gives the definitive opinion' AitBr.: √vad]

Name: *avavr̩ddʰa
Description: 844 *avavr̥ddha or *apa° 'cut off'. [For prep. cf. ávakr̥ntati ŚBr., apak° Kauś.: √vardh]

Name: *avavr̩ṣṭi
Description: 845 *avavr̥ṣṭi 'rainfall'. [Cf. avavarṣati 'rains on' VS., Pa. ōvassati; ávavr̥ṣṭa- TBr., Pk. ōvaṭṭha- 'rained on'; m. 'rain': √vr̥ṣ]

Name: *avaśara
Description: 848 *avaśara 'protection, shelter'. 2. *avaśāra-. [For semantic change to 'roof, veranda, porch' cf. esp. śaraṇá-. G. ɔ- points to initial apa-. In view of Pa. Pk. words derivation from apasā̆ra- (Bloch LM 303, ND 63 b 10) is semantically unsatisfactory; these words also rule out conn. with upaśāla- n. 'courtyard before a house' Kauś

Name: avaśin
Description: 849 avaśin 'not independent' Āp. [Cf. avaśá- 'not submissive to another's will' AV., 'not having one's own free will' Mn.: váśa-]

Name: *avaśīyatē
Description: 851 *avaśīyatē² 'is cold'. 2. *avaśyāpayati caus. 3. *avaśyāpana-. [Cf. śīyatē 'is cold, congeals' TS., avaśīta- 'cooled' Pāṇ., śyāpayati 'causes to congeal' Gr.: √śyai].

Name: *avaśūyatē
Description: 853 *avaśūyatē 'subsides (of a swelling)'. [For this use of ava in compd. cf. avasavya- 'not left': √śvi]

Name: *avaścandati
Description: 854 *avaścandati 'jumps down'. [< IE. *skend-, see *ścandati: cf. avaskandati 'jumps down' BhP.: √skand]

Name: *avaśrayati
Description: 856 *avaśrayati 'leans from'. [Cf. avaśrayaṇa- n. 'act of taking off the fire' lex.: √śri]

Name: avasārayati
Description: 862 avasārayati 'moves aside' Kauś., cf. apasārayati from which the Pk. N. H. forms may equally stem. [√sr̥]

Name: *avastr̩ti
Description: 869 *avastr̥ti 'spreading'. [Cf. stŕ̥ti- f. TS. and *avastr̥ta- in Pa. otthaṭa- 'spread over', Pk. otthaa- 'scattered': √str̥]

Name: avastʰā
Description: 872 avasthā f. 'stability, state, condition' R. [Cf. avasthā́van- 'possessed of stability' TS.: √sthā]

Name: ávasvanati
Description: 880 ávasvanati 'flies down with noise' RV., avaṣvaṇati 'smacks the lips' Pāṇ [√svan]

Name: avākká
Description: 882a †avākká- 'speechless' ŚBr. [avā́c- id. ŚBr.: replaced by †nirvākya- id. R

Name: avācya
Description: 883 avācya 'not to be uttered or spoken about' Mn. [vācyá-]

Name: ávi
Description: 887 ávi m.f. 'sheep' RV., aviká- m. Pāṇ., avikā́- f. RV., avíkā- f. AV., avilā- f. lex.

Name: avikaṭá
Description: 888 avikaṭá m. 'flock of sheep' Pāṇ. [ext. with -ṭa- of aviká-: ávi-.]

Name: *avidʰavātva
Description: 891 *avidhavātva n. 'the state of a woman whose husband is living'. 2. *avidhavātvana-. [avidhavā́-]

Name: *avimaya
Description: 895 *avimaya 'consisting of sheep'. [ávi-, maya-: cf. gōmáya- 'consisting of cattle' RV.]

Name: *aśati
Description: 908 *aśati 'eats', aśnā́ti RV., aor. subj. aśīt, past part. aśitá-. 2. Perf. ā́śa. [√aś²]

Name: aśáni
Description: 910 aśáni f. 'thunderbolt' RV., °nī- f. ŚBr. [Cf. áśan- m. 'sling-stone' RV.]

Name: aśōka
Description: 914 aśōka m. 'the tree Jonesia asoca Roxb.' [Conn., in pop. etymology at least, with áśōka- 'without heat' ŚBr., 'without grief' lex.: śṓka-]

Name: áśri
Description: 918 áśri f. 'sharp side, corner, angle, edge' ŚBr. 2. -aśra- in cmpds.

Name: áśru
Description: 919 áśru n. 'tear' RV., once m. ŚBr. Many forms, like the word for 'eye' (see ákṣi-), were nasalized, early enough to voice the following ś in S. L. P., which also have initial h-.

Name: áśva
Description: 920 áśva m. 'horse', áśvā- f. RV., aśvaká- m. 'small horse' VS., °vikā- f. 'small mare' Pāṇ.

Name: aśvagandʰā
Description: 921 aśvagandhā f. 'the plant Physalis flexuosa' Suśr. [áśva-, gandhá- ?]

Name: aśvattʰá
Description: 922 aśvatthá m. 'the tree Ficus religiosa' AV. [Non-aryan and unconnected with áśva- Mayrhofer EWA i 61: for plant-names in -ttha- cf. kapittha-, kulattha-, dadhittha-].

Name: aśvayuja
Description: 925 aśvayuja m. 'the month Āśvina, i.e. September-October' Kauś. (āśvayuja- m. Mn., but S. L. P. attest a-). [Cf. aśvayúj- 'harnessing horses', RV. f. du. 'a partic. constellation' AV.: áśva-, yuj-]

Name: aśvavāra
Description: 926 aśvavāra m. 'horseman, groom' Śiś. [← Ir.: from OPers. asabāra- P. Tedesco ZII 2, 40; from MPers. asβār, not OPers. since earliest reference is Śiś. 3. 66;if so, as- re-formed after Sk. áśva-, cf. esp. NiDoc.]

Name: aśvastʰāna
Description: 928 aśvasthāna n. 'horse-stable' Yājñ., adj. 'born in a stable' Pāṇ. Kāś. [áśva-, sthā́na-]

Name: aśvín
Description: 930 aśvín 'mounted on or drawn by horses', aśvínā 'the twin charioteer gods' RV. [áśva-]

Name: áṣṭaka
Description: 933 áṣṭaka 'consisting of eight parts' ŚBr., n. 'a whole consisting of eight parts' ŚvetUp. [aṣṭā́]

Name: aṣṭapāda
Description: 935 aṣṭapāda 'eight-footed' MBh., 'spider' lex., aṣṭā́pad- 'eight-footed' RV., aṣṭāpada- m. 'spider' lex. [aṣṭā́, pā́da-]

Name: aṣṭamá
Description: 937 aṣṭamá eighth' RV., °aka- Yājñ. 2. aṣṭamī- f. 'eighth day of the fortnight' ĀśvGr̥. [aṣṭā́]

Name: aṣṭamaŋgala
Description: 938 aṣṭamaṅgala n. 'a collection of eight lucky things' lex. [aṣṭā́, maṅgalá-]

Name: aṣṭi
Description: 955 aṣṭi f. 'kernel of fruit' BhP. [Cf. aṣṭhi- f. 'kernel' lex., aṣṭhīlā- f. 'round pebble' Suśr., asthi- n. 'kernel of fruit' Suśr. The relationship of these words among themselves and with ásthi- 'bone' is obscure: Mayrhofer EWA i 63]

Name: aṣṭʰīlā
Description: 955a †aṣṭhīlā- f. 'small pebble, ball' MBh., 'globular swelling below navel' Suśr., °la- m. or n. Hcat., °likā- f. 'kind of tumour' Suśr.

Name: aṣṭʰi
Description: 958 aṣṭhi '*bone', f. 'kernel' lex., aṣṭhī- f. 'bone of elbow or knee' lex. [Cf. aṣṭhīvántau m. 'the knees' RV., pādāṣṭhīla- m.n. 'ankle' MBh., ūrv-aṣṭhīvá- n. 'thigh and knee' VS. The relationship of these words with ásthi- 'bone' RV. is obscure: Mayrhofer EWA i 67. Connexion with haḍḍa- is improbable]

Name: aṣṭʰīvát
Description: 959 aṣṭhīvát 'knee', aṣṭhīvántau m. du. RV., ūrv-aṣṭhīvá- n. 'thigh and knee' VS., aṣṭhī- 'bone of elbow or knee' lex. [aṣṭhi-]

Name: asana
Description: 963 asana m. 'the tree Terminalia tomentosa' Suśr., aśa°, āsa°, āśa° lex.

Name: ásr̩j
Description: 971 ásr̥j, nom. ásr̥k, gen. asnáḥ n. 'blood' RV., asra- n. Kālid.

Name: asáu
Description: 972 asáu 'that' RV. with its obl. cases from the st. amu-, esp. gen. amúṣya formed the basis of MIA. and NIA. remote demonstratives.

Name: ásta
Description: 973 ásta n. 'home' RV., °aka- n. AV., ástam ēti 'sets (of sun)' RV., asta- m. 'setting (of sun, &c.)' MBh.

Name: astamayá
Description: 974 astamayá m. 'setting of the sun' ŚBr. [ástam ēti]

Name: astamáyana
Description: 975 astamáyana n. 'setting (of sun)' ŚBr., astamana- n. MBh. [ástam ēti]

Name: ástam
Description: 976 ástam ēti 'goes home, sets (of sun)' RV. [ásta-, ḗti]

Name: astavyasta
Description: 976a †astavyasta- 'tossed hither and thither' Sūryapr. [asta-² 'thrown aside' Ragh. (ánasta- ŚBr.), vyàsta- 'dismembered' RV.: √as²]

Name: astrá
Description: 979 astrá n. 'missile weapon, arrow' AV., 'any weapon' lex. [√as²]

Name: ástʰi
Description: 982 ásthi n. 'bone', nom. acc. sg. ásthi, other cases ásthan- RV. [See aṣṭhi-]

Name: asmad
Description: 986 asmad base of obl. cases plur. of 1st pers. pronoun asmā́n, asmā́bhiḥ, asmábhyam, asmā́kam, asmā́su, dat. loc. asmḗ.

Name: áhar
Description: 993 áhar n. 'day', nom. °ar, loc. áhan-i RV., pl. áhas-su ŚBr. Pa. aha- n., acc. ahaṁ and ahō; Pk. aha- n., ahō 'by day'; Pr. ənċərā 'day' < *anċar < *aj̈nara- Morgenstierne NTS xv 211 with (?); Kho. anús 'day, daytime' < *ahnasa- or X divasá- Morgenstierne BelvalkarVol 86; H. ah m. 'day'.

Name: ahō
Description: 996 ahō 'exclamation of joy or painful surprise' R. Pāṇ.

Name: ākara
Description: 1000 ākara m. 'accumulation, plenty, mine' R. [Cf. ākará- m. 'one who scatters' RV.: √kr̥̄¹]

Name: ākāla
Description: 1007 ākāla-, °lḗ 'just at the time of' TS., ākālam 'until the same time on the following day' Āp. [Cf. ánākāla- 'unseasonable' ŚBr.: kālá-²]

Name: ākula
Description: 1012 ākula 'confused' MBh., 'filled with, crowded' R. 2. With anal. -kk-. [Connexion with √kr̥̄¹ denied by Mayrhofer EWA i 69; poss. Muṇḍa origin and farther connexions in IA. Kuiper PMWS 16. But note parallelism between ākula-, vyākula-, saṁkula-, samākula- and ākīrṇa-, vyākīrṇa-, saṁkīrṇa-, samākīrṇa, all meaning 'confused, filled with'].

Name: ākrandá
Description: 1015 ākrandá m. 'crying out, war cry' AV., 'lamenting' MBh.

Name: ā́krōśati
Description: 1019 ā́krōśati 'cries out at' TS. 2. ākrōśa- m. 'calling' R., 'abuse' Yājñ. 3. ākrōśana- n. 'scolding' BHSk. [√kruś]

Name: ākṣika
Description: 1025 ākṣika m. 'the tree Morinda tinctoria' lex., akṣĭ̄ka- m., ācchuka- m. [Cf. akṣĭ̄ba-², kākṣība- m. 'Guilandina or Hyperanthera moringa' lex., Pa. acchiva- m.]

Name: ākṣipati
Description: 1026 ākṣipati 'throws down, takes away' MBh., 'puts into' Suśr. 2. ākṣipta- MBh. 3. *ākṣipyati. [√kṣip]

Name: ā́kṣēti
Description: 1031 ā́kṣēti 'abides, dwells in' RV., ākṣiyáti 'exists' AV., ākṣyáti 'is to be found, is' AV x 5, 45. [Full discussion with lit. BSOS viii 793 ff.: √kṣi¹]

Name: ākṣēpa
Description: 1032 ākṣēpa m. 'convulsion, objection (to rectify a statement)' Suśr. [√kṣip]

Name: *ākṣōṭayati
Description: 1033 *ākṣōṭayati 'withdraws'. [ācchōṭita- 'pulled, torn' Jain.; semant. cf. ākṣipati 'takes away, withdraws', Pk. akkhitta- 'dragged': √kṣuṭ]

Name: ākʰará
Description: 1034 ākhará m. 'hole or lair of an animal' RV.

Name: *ākʰyātra
Description: 1042 *ākhyātra 'saying'. [Cf. ākhyātr̥- m. 'one who tells' AitBr., Pa. akkhātar- m.: √khyā]

Name: āgantu
Description: 1045a †āgantu- m. 'newcomer' Ragh., °uka- 'arriving of one's own accord' Yājñ., m. 'guest' Hit. [√gam]

Name: āgrayaṇī
Description: 1052 āgrayaṇī f. 'oblation of first fruits' KātyŚr., āgrayaṇá- 'the first soma libation at the Agniṣṭoma sacrifice' VS. [ágra-]

Name: *āgrāhayati
Description: 1053 *āgrāhayati 'holds back'. [Cf. ā́gr̥bhṇē 'I hold in (horses)' RV., Pk. aggaha- m. 'obstinacy': √grah]

Name: āgʰaṭṭayati
Description: 1054 āghaṭṭayati 'touches on, rubs' lex. [parighaṭṭana- n. 'stirring round' MBh., Pk. parihaṭṭaï 'rubs, crushes, strikes down': √ghaṭṭ¹]

Name: āgʰāṭa
Description: 1056 āghāṭa m. 'the plant Achyranthes aspera' lex., āghaṭṭaka- m. 'a red-flowering Achyranthes' lex. [= apāmārgá- AV.]

Name: āgʰrāpayati
Description: 1062 āghrāpayati 'causes to smell' KātyŚr., āghrāta- 'smelt at, satiated' lex. 2. āghrāṇa- n. 'act of smelling' Gaut., 'satiety, satiated' lex. [√ghrā]

Name: ācamati
Description: 1064a †ācamati (indecl.part. ācamya Mn.) 'sips water from the hand for purification' ŚBr. [√cam]

Name: ācamaṇa
Description: 1065 ācamaṇa n. 'sipping water from the palm of the hand' Āp.

Name: ācāma
Description: 1068 ācāma m. 'water in which rice has been boiled' KātyŚr. [√cam]

Name: ā́cāmati
Description: 1069 ā́cāmati 'sips water from the palm of the hand' ŚBr., ācāmayati 'causes to sip water' Mn.

Name: *ācikʰyati
Description: 1074 *ācikhyati 'communicates'. [Redup. pres. or desid. of ākhyāti, cf. cikhyāpayiṣā- f. 'intention to communicate' Com. on Nyāyas.: √khyā]

Name: *ācullī
Description: 1075 *ācullī 'small or secondary stove'. [For ā- cf. ākōpa- 'a little anger': cullī-]

Name: āccʰādana
Description: 1083 ācchādana n. 'cover for a bed' R. [Cf. ācchādayati 'dresses' Kauś., Pa. acchādēti 'covers': √chad¹]

Name: *āccʰindati
Description: 1084 *ācchindati, ā́chinatti 'cuts off, cuts in pieces' AV., 'snatches away' MBh. [√chid]

Name: āja
Description: 1089 āja 'pertaining to goats' ĀśvGr̥., '*goat's milk'. [ājaka- n. 'flock of goats': ajá-]

Name: ā́jāyatē
Description: 1092 ā́jāyatē 'is born' RV. [Cf. Pa. ājānīya- 'of good birth', Pk. āyāi- f. 'birth': √jan]

Name: ā́ñcʰati
Description: 1099 ā́ñchati 'stretches, draws, sets (a bone)' Suśr. [Relationship with áñcati not clear: for other forms with ā̆ñch- in Pk. see *atiyañcati: √āñch]

Name: ā́ñjana
Description: 1100 ā́ñjana n. 'fat' RV., 'ointment (esp. for the eyes)' AV.; āñjanī- f. 'ointment' VS., 'collyrium for the eyes, box therefor' R. [√añj]

Name: āñjaníya
Description: 1101 āñjaníya-, °nyà-, '(with eyes) having to be anointed with collyrium' TBr. [ā́ñjana-: √añj]

Name: *āḍi
Description: 1102 *āḍi² 'row, line, ridge', āli-¹ f. 'row, range, line' lex., ālī- f. Pañcat. [Connexion with āvali- (Mayrhofer EWA i 81) doubtful]

Name: āḍʰaka
Description: 1106 āḍhaka m.n. 'a measure of grain (= 4 prasthas)', ā́ḍhakika- 'containing an ā°' Pāṇ.

Name: āḍʰyá
Description: 1108 āḍhyá 'rich' ŚBr. 2. *āḍhiya-. [Scarcely with P. Tedesco JAOS 67, 89 and Mayrhofer EWA i 71 < arthya-]

Name: āṇí
Description: 1110 āṇí m. (m. f. lex.) 'axle-pin' RV.; 'corner of house, boundary' lex. [Cf. aṇi- lex.]

Name: āṇḍá
Description: 1111 āṇḍá n. 'egg' RV., du. 'testicles' AV., aṇḍá- Ep., °aka- 'egg, scrotum' lex. [Kaf. Paš. Kal. forms point to *āṇḍra-: ac. to Mayrhofer EWA i 26, with Kuiper PMWS 76, of Muṇḍa origin]

Name: *āṇvaka
Description: 1114 *āṇvaka 'small coin'. [Connexion with aṇu-² by no means certain: Or. M. indicate MIA. single -ṇ-]

Name: *ātapasyati
Description: 1120 *ātapasyati 'is hot'. [tapasyà- 'produced by heat' KātyŚr., tápasyati 'undergoes austerities' ŚBr.: √tap]

Name: ātāra
Description: 1125 ātāra m. 'fare for ferrying' lex., ātara- m. 'id.' Udbh., 'crossing a river' Rājat. [√tr̥̄]

Name: ātí
Description: 1127 ātí f. 'an aquatic bird' RV., 'Turdus ginginianus' lex., āṭi- f. 'Turdus g.', PārGr̥., āḍi- f. 'an aquatic bird' MārkP.

Name: *ātr̩tīyam
Description: 1130 *ātr̥tīyam 'on the third (day) back or forwards'. [For ā-, cf. ācaturam 'to the fourth generation' MaitrS., and a similar formation in Par. ašö-ruč 'the day before yesterday' < *ā-θri- Morgenstierne IIFL i 61: tr̥tī́ya-¹]

Name: *ātr̩ptika
Description: 1131 *ātr̥ptika 'satisfied'. [Cf. ā́tr̥pati 'is satisfied' RV., ātarpaṇa- n. 'satisfaction'; 'whitening walls on festive occasions, pigment therefor' lex., Pk. āippaṇa- n

Name: ātmán
Description: 1135 ātmán m. 'breath, soul' RV., 'self' Mn., nom. °mā́, acc. °mā́nam, gen. °mánaḥ. 2. *ātmanaka- 'own' (replacing adjectives of type -ātmaka- 'having the character of', ātmanya- 'connected with self' TāṇḍyBr., ātmanīna- Pāṇ).

Name: ātmabʰāva
Description: 1136 ātmabhāva m. 'existence of the soul' ŚvetUp. [ātmán-, bhāvá-]

Name: *ātriśvas
Description: 1138 *ātriśvas 'the day after tomorrow'. [For ā- see *ātr̥tīyam: trí-, śvás]

Name: ādáhana
Description: 1146 ādáhana n. 'a place where anything is burnt' AV. [√dah]

Name: ādāna
Description: 1147 ādāna¹ n. 'act of taking' ŚBr., 'taking away' Mn. [√dā¹]

Name: ādityá
Description: 1153 ādityá 'son of Aditi, names of seven deities, esp. of the sun' RV.

Name: *ādr̩ṁhaṇa
Description: 1156 *ādr̥ṁhaṇa 'making coagulate'. [Cf. dŕ̥ṁhaṇa- n. 'making firm' AV., 'means of strengthening' TBr.: √dr̥ṁh]

Name: ā́driyatē
Description: 1161 ā́driyatē 'regards, is careful about, attends to' ŚBr. 2. *ādarati. [√dr̥]

Name: ādʰā́na
Description: 1163 ādhā́na n. 'the place in which anything rests' ŚBr. [√dhā]

Name: ādʰāpayati
Description: 1164 ādhāpayati caus. of ā́dadhāti 'gives, lends' RV., cf. ādhí- m. 'pledge, pawn' RV. 2. Pp. replaced by MIA. *ādhapta-, cf. ājñapta-: ājnāpayati. [√dhā]

Name: ādʰārá
Description: 1165 ādhārá m. 'support, substratum' AV., 'vessel' Yājñ., 'dike, dam' Kālid., 'basin at the foot of a tree, pond' lex., °aka- in cmpd. 'substratum' Suśr. [√dhr̥]

Name: ādʰí
Description: 1167 ādhí m. 'deposit' RV., 'receptacle' BhP. [Cf. ā́dadhāti 'adds (fuel to fire)' RV., ā́hita- 'added (of fuel to fire)': √dhā]

Name: ā́dʰmāyati
Description: 1170 ā́dhmāyati 'swells with wind' ŚBr., 'is puffed up' MBh. [√dhmā]

Name: ā́namati
Description: 1173 ā́namati 'propitiates' RV., 'bends down' R. 2. ānā- mayati 'causes to bend (e.g. a bow)' MBh. [√nam]

Name: ā́nayati
Description: 1174 ā́nayati 'leads forward, fetches' RV. 2. ā́nīta- RV. 3. ānāyayati 'causes to be brought' MBh. [√nī]

Name: *ānavana
Description: 1176 *ānavana 'roar'. [Cf. ā́nūṣata 'they roared', ā́navīnōt 'he kept on roaring' RV., ānuvāna- pres. part. Bhaṭṭ.: √nu²]

Name: *āpaṭʰati
Description: 1190 *āpaṭhati 'reads'. [Cf. āpapráthan 3rd pl. aor. subj. 'spread' RV., *āprāthayati in Pk. appāhēi 'teaches', °haï 'announces' Pischel GrPk § 286: √paṭh]

Name: ā́patati
Description: 1193 ā́patati 'flies towards' RV., 'befalls' MBh. 2. With MIA. -paḍ-. 3. With MIA. anal. -pp-. [√pat]

Name: ā́padyatē
Description: 1197 ā́padyatē 'goes into' ŚBr., 'gets into misfortune' AV., 'occurs' ŚBr. 2. ā́panna- 'entered' ŚBr. [√pad¹]

Name: āpāka
Description: 1202 āpāka m. 'baking oven, potter's kiln' lex. [āpākēsthá- 'standing in an oven' AV.: √pac]

Name: āpāna
Description: 1204 āpāna¹ n. 'act of drinking, drinking party' MBh., 'drinking place or house' lex. [√pā¹]

Name: *āpiya
Description: 1208 *āpiya-, ā́pya- 'belonging to or living in water' Suśr. [ápya-: áp-]

Name: āpīta
Description: 1210 āpīta 'yellowish' R., m. 'a species of tree', n. 'filament of lotus' lex. [pīta-²]

Name: āpnṓti
Description: 1219 āpnṓti 'reaches, obtains' RV., cf. āpyatē 'is obtained, arrives at one's end' TS. [√āp]

Name: āpyāya
Description: 1219a †āpyāya- m. 'becoming full, increase' Kathās., āpyāyana- n. 'satiating, refreshing' Mn. [√pyai, √pī]

Name: *ābʰakta
Description: 1223 *ābhakta 'shared'. [Cf. ā́bhajati 'causes to share', ā́bhaga- m. 'one who is honoured with a share' RV.: √bhaj]

Name: ābʰihārika
Description: 1231 ābhihārika 'fit for presentation', n. 'a respectful offering' MW. [abhihāra-]

Name: ābʰīra
Description: 1232 ābhīra m. 'name of a people' MBh., 'herdsman' Mn., °rī- f. lex.

Name: *āmagandʰa
Description: 1237 *āmagandha-, āmagandhi-, °in-, °ika- 'smelling like raw meat, smelling musty' lex. [āmá-, gandhá-]

Name: āmantrayatē
Description: 1242 āmantrayatē 'summons' TBr., 'invites' MBh. 2. āmántraṇa- n. 'calling to' ŚBr., 'deliberation' AV., 'invitation' Yājñ. [mántra-]

Name: āmalaka
Description: 1247 āmalaka m. 'the small tree Phyllanthus emblica or myrobalan', n. 'its fruit' ChUp.

Name: *āmārayati
Description: 1252 *āmārayati 'rubs'. [Cf. *mālayati and, for ā- with verbs of touching, āmr̥j-, āmr̥d-, āmr̥ś-: √mr̥̄]

Name: *āmārta
Description: 1253 *āmārta 'flour from uncleaned grain'. [Cf. āma- n. 'grain not yet freed from chaff' MW, Pa. āmadhañña- n., Pk. āma- 'uncleaned'; and Wakhi yūmǰ 'flour < *āmačī, Khot. hāmaa- 'barley-flour' < *āmaka- Morgenstierne IIFL ii 554

Name: āmiṣá
Description: 1256 āmiṣá n. 'flesh', ā́miṣ- n. 'raw flesh, dead body' RV.

Name: *āmiṣṭa
Description: 1258 *āmiṣṭa 'mixed'. [Cf. ā́miśla- 'having a tendency to mix' RV., āmíkṣā- f. 'mixture of boiled and curdled milk' AV.: √mikṣ]

Name: āmukʰa
Description: 1259 āmukha n. 'beginning' lex., āmukham 'face to face', āmukhī-kr̥- 'to make visible' MW. [múkha-]

Name: āmuñcati
Description: 1260 āmuñcati orig. 'puts off or on': 'discharges' MBh., 'puts on (clothes)' Kālid. 2. *āmucati. 3. *āmukna- (replacing āmukta- 'shot off, accoutred' MBh., Pa. āmutta- 'dressed'). [√muc]

Name: *āmuhyati
Description: 1262 *āmuhyati 'is bewildered'. 2. *āmūḍha-. [Cf. āmōhanikā- f. 'a partic. fragrant odour' Suśr.: √muh]

Name: āmr̩ṣyatē
Description: 1265 āmr̥ṣyatē 'bears patiently' MBh. 2. pp. *āmr̥ṣṭa-². 3. āmarṣa- '*forgetfulness' ('anger' lex.). [mŕ̥ṣyatē 'forgets' RV.: though phonet. colliding with āmr̥śyatē 'is wiped out' in NIA., derivation from mr̥ṣ- is supported by Pahl. framōš 'forgetting': √mr̥ṣ]

Name: āmrá
Description: 1268 āmrá m. 'mango tree, Mangifera indica' MBh., n. 'its fruit' ŚBr.

Name: āmrapēśī
Description: 1270 āmrapēśī f. 'portion of dried mango' lex. [āmrá-, pēśī́-]

Name: āmrāvarta
Description: 1278 āmrāvarta m. 'inspissated mango juice' lex. [āmrá-, āvartá-: for this meaning of the latter see ā́vartayati]

Name: āmlā
Description: 1280 āmlā f. 'tamarind tree', °la- m., °likā- f., °līkā- f., amlikā- f. lex. [amlá-]

Name: ā́yaccʰati
Description: 1284 ā́yacchati 'stretches' RV. [Cf. ā́yāmayati 'brings near' RV., Pa. āyamati 'stretches out', Pk. āyāmēi 'extends, gives': √yam]

Name: āyatta
Description: 1286 āyatta 'resting on, depending on, being at the disposition of' MBh. [ā́yatatē 'arrives at, adheres to' RV.: √yat]

Name: āyuṣyà
Description: 1292a †āyuṣyà- 'giving long life' ŚBr., n. 'long life' AV. [ā́yuṣ-]

Name: ā́yuṣmant
Description: 1294 ā́yuṣmant 'alive, long-lived' AV., 'honorific term of address' ŚBr. [ā́yuṣ-]

Name: *āyōgya
Description: 1294a †*āyōgya- 'relating to a yoke'. [āyōga- m. 'yoke or team of draft animals' ŚāṅkhŚr., Pa. āyōga- m. 'yoke'

Name: ārá
Description: 1295 ārá¹ pronominal stem in ārā́t 'from a distance' RV., 'near' Gaut., 'immediately' Kathās., ārḗ 'at a distance'.

Name: āracayati
Description: 1300 āracayati 'prepares, provides with' lex., āracita- 'put on (of ornaments)' Pañcat. [√rac]

Name: ārambʰá
Description: 1307 ārambhá¹ m. 'beginning' ŚBr. 2. *ārambhati¹, cf. ā́rabhatē 'lays hold of' RV., 'begins' ŚBr. 3. ārámbhana- n. 'seizing' AitBr., 'beginning' ŚBr. [√rabh]

Name: *āraśa
Description: 1311 *āraśa 'shoulder (blade)'. [< IE. *ōlek̂-, cf. Arm. otn 'shoulder' Morgenstierne NTS xii 156

Name: ārātrika
Description: 1315 ārātrika n. 'the ceremony of waving a lamp in front of an image at night' AVPariś., 'the lamp so waved' Śaṁkara [*ārātri-]

Name: ārāmá
Description: 1317 ārāmá m. 'delight' ŚBr., 'place of pleasure, garden' Mn. [√ram]

Name: ārōpa
Description: 1331a †ārōpa- m. 'imposing (as a burden), placing on, superimposition' Vedānt., ārōpaka- 'planting' Mn. [√rup]

Name: ārōha
Description: 1333 ārōha m. 'ascent, rider' R., °aka- 'rising' Pañcat., m. 'tree' lex. [√ruh]

Name: ā́rta
Description: 1337 ā́rta¹ or ā́rtta- 'pained, injured, sick' ŚBr. [Despite general opinion, e.g. in last place Mayrhofer EWA i 78, semantically rather < ā-r̥tta- (: árdati, r̥dáti, r̥ṇátti 'disperses, dissolves' RV., 'wounds, kills' Dhātup.; ardáyati 'vexes, hurts, makes uneasy' AV.) than < ār̥ta-

Name: *ārta
Description: 1338 *ārta² 'flour', aṭṭa- n. 'food' MBh., 'boiled rice' lex. [Cf. Ir. *ārta- > Psht. ōṛə 'flour', Yghn. ārt, Pers. ārd, beside *r̥ta- > Av. aša-. Either vr̥ddhi-form of *r̥ta-, i.e. 'consisting of what is ground' or *ā-r̥ta- with Morgenstierne EVP 12. Wackernagel AiGr i 170 wrongly aṭṭa- < *alta- since Dm. P. L. and perh. Kal. point to ā]

Name: ārdraka
Description: 1341 ārdraka n. 'fresh ginger' Suśr., ārdra- n., ārdrikā- f. lex. 2. *āllaka- < *ārdlaka-. [Cf. ārdra-śāka- 'fresh ginger' lex. and Pa. adda-siṅgivēra-: ārdrá-]

Name: ārdrā́
Description: 1343 ārdrā́ f. 'the fourth or sixth asterism' AV. [ārdrá-]

Name: ārdʰika
Description: 1345 ārdhika 'sharing half', m. 'one who ploughs in return for half share of the crop' Mn. [árdhika-: ardhá-²]

Name: ā́rya
Description: 1347 ā́rya m. 'an Aryan', f. °yā- RV., 'noble, respectable' Mn. 2. *āriya-.

Name: āryaka
Description: 1348 āryaka¹ m. 'respectable man, grandfather' MBh. [So called because the mother addresses her husband's father as ārya{ka}-, cf. Pk. ajjaütta- 'husband' Baburam Saksena Proc. and Trans. 2nd Or. Conference 478: ā́rya-]

Name: āryaka
Description: 1349 āryaka² n. 'ceremony performed in honour of departed ancestors' lex. [ā́rya-]

Name: *āla
Description: 1353 *āla² 'hole for water'. [Cf. ālavāla- m. 'basin for water round a tree' Kālid., āvāla- m. lex. (not with Tedesco JAOS 67, 97), Pk. ālavāla- n., āvāla-, °aya- n. 'place near water']

Name: ālagati
Description: 1354 ālagati 'adheres' Kāvyād., pres. part. ālagant-. 2. ālagayati 'affixes' Com. on KātyŚr. [√lag]

Name: *ālagʰayati
Description: 1357 *ālaghayati 'makes soft'. [laghayati 'makes soft, tender or smooth' Kālid.: laghú-]

Name: ālambatē
Description: 1364 ālambatē 'clings to, leans on' MBh. 2. Caus. *ālambayati. 3. *ārambatē, cf. rámbatē. [√lamb, √ramb]

Name: ālambā
Description: 1365 ālambā f. 'a species of plant with poisonous leaves' Suśr. [Mayrhofer EWA i 79 :√lamb]

Name: ālāna
Description: 1372 ālāna n. 'post to tie an elephant to' Mr̥cch., 'tethering rope for an elephant' Kāv. [< ādā́na-² Lüders KZ 38, 431 and Mayrhofer EWA i 555. If so: √dā²]

Name: *ālāpayati
Description: 1377 *ālāpayati² 'brings close, makes stick'. [ālīyatē 'comes close to' MBh., lāpayatē Pāṇ.: √lī¹]

Name: ā́likʰati
Description: 1382 ā́likhati 'scratches' ŚBr. 2. ālēkhanī- f. 'brush' lex. [ālēkhaná- n. 'scratching' Pāṇ. gaṇa: √likh].

Name: ālīyatē
Description: 1387 ālīyatē 'comes close to' MBh. 2. 'crouches, stoops'. [MIA. forms with anal. -ll-, not with Pischel BB 13, 10 and Wackernagel AiGr i § 192 c < *ā-ślīyatē: √lī¹]

Name: ālu
Description: 1388 ālu-, °uka- n. 'esculent root of Amorphophallus campanulatus' lex. 2. ālukī- f. 'a species of root' Bhpr.

Name: āluka
Description: 1389 āluka n. 'a kind of fruit' lex., āruka- n. 'a medicinal fruit of an Himalayan tree' lex.

Name: *āluḍati
Description: 1390 *āluḍati 'moves to and fro'. 2. ālōḍayati 'stirs up' Suśr. [Cf. ālulita- 'agitated' Mālatīm., ālōlita- 'shaken' MW.: √luḍ].

Name: ālēkʰa
Description: 1393 ālēkha m. 'writing' Apte. [Cf. ā́likhati 'scratches, delineates by scratching' ŚBr., 'draws, paints' MBh.: √likh]

Name: ālōka
Description: 1400 ālōka m. 'brightness, splendour' R. [~ ārōká- m. 'small points of light' RV.: √lōk]

Name: ālōcayatē
Description: 1401 ālōcayatē 'makes see, brings before one's own consciousness' MBh. [~ *ārōcayati: √luc]

Name: *ālōḍa
Description: 1402 *ālōḍa 'movement to and fro', ālōla- m. 'trembling, rocking' Kālid. [√luḍ]

Name: *ālōpya
Description: 1405 *ālōpya 'that which is to be cut off'. [√lup]

Name: *ālōpyatē
Description: 1406 *ālōpyatē 'is cut off' [ā́lumpati 'tears out, separates' AV., Pa. ālumpati 'breaks off', Pk. āluṁpaï 'takes away', ālōviya- 'covered': √lup]

Name: āvápana
Description: 1411 āvápana n. 'act of sowing, of inserting' ŚBr. [√vap]

Name: āvartá
Description: 1418 āvartá m. 'whirlpool' ŚBr., 'revolving' R., 'crowded place where many men live together' lex. [√vr̥t¹]

Name: ā́vartayati
Description: 1420 ā́vartayati 'causes to turn round' RV. 2. āvártana- n. 'turning round' RV., 'stirring, melting of metals' lex. 3. ā́vr̥tta- 'stirred'. [√vr̥t¹]

Name: āvali
Description: 1423 āvali-, °ī- f. 'row, line' Hit. 2. *avali- [Connexion with āli-¹, *āḍi-² (Mayrhofer EWA i 81) is doubtful except as independent loans from non-Aryan sources].

Name: āvāha
Description: 1434 āvāha m. 'invitation' MBh., 'marrying' lex. [ā́vahati 'brings' RV., 'brings home the bride' MBh.: √vah]

Name: ā́viśati
Description: 1437 ā́viśati 'enters, takes possession of' RV., 'sits down' MBh. 2. *āviśyatē 'is entered, is possessed'. 3. āviṣṭa- 'possessed' AitBr., 'sitting' BhP. [√viś]

Name: *āvr̩ṣa
Description: 1445 *āvr̥ṣa 'rain, pertaining to the rains'. [Cf. prāvŕ̥ṣ- and ā́varṣatē RV.: √vr̥ṣ]

Name: āvēśika
Description: 1446 āvēśika m. 'guest' lex. [āvēśa- m. 'entering' Bālar., Pk. āvēsa- m.: √viś]

Name: āśá
Description: 1452 āśá m. 'food, eating' usu. in cmpd. ŚBr., āśi- f. 'eating' Kauś. [√aś²]

Name: āśayá
Description: 1453 āśayá m. 'resting place' ŚBr., 'any receptacle' Mn., 'stomach' Suśr. [√śī¹]

Name: āśú
Description: 1459 āśú 'quick' RV., m.n. 'rice ripening quickly in the Rains' ŚBr.

Name: ā́śvattʰa
Description: 1470 ā́śvattha 'belonging to Ficus religiosa', n. 'its fruit', °thika- adj., °thī́- f. Pāṇ. [aśvatthá-]

Name: āśviná
Description: 1472 āśviná 'belonging to the Aśvins', m. 'name of a month in the Rains' ŚBr. [aśvín-]

Name: āṣāḍʰá
Description: 1473 āṣāḍhá m. 'the month June-July' Suśr., °aka- m. lex. 2. āṣāḍhī- f. 'the day of full moon in this month' KātyŚr. [áṣāḍhā-].

Name: āṣāḍʰīya
Description: 1474 āṣāḍhīya '*pertaining to the month Āṣāḍha' ('born in the constellation of aṣāḍhā' Pāṇ.). [āṣāḍhá-]

Name: ā́sana
Description: 1484 ā́sana¹ n. 'sitting' AV., °ná- n. 'seat' ŚBr., āsanī- f. 'small seat' Kauś. [√ās]

Name: āsandī́
Description: 1485 āsandī́ f. 'chair, stool' AV., °dikā- f. 'small chair' Kād. 2. *āsandaka-. [√sad]

Name: āsava
Description: 1488 āsava m. 'juice, molasses spirit' MBh. [ā́sunōti 'presses out' RV.: √su¹]

Name: *āsāṭa
Description: 1489 *āsāṭa 'maggot', āśātikā- f. 'egg of fly or other insect, nit' BHS II 109.

Name: āsita
Description: 1493 āsita 'seated', m. 'one who dwells' R., n. 'abode' MBh. [√ās]

Name: āsēcayati
Description: 1498 āsēcayati 'pours in or on' ĀśvGr̥. [Cf. ā́siñcati 'pours in' RV., Pa. āsiñcati 'sprinkles', Pk. āsitta-: √sic]

Name: āskandá
Description: 1500 āskandá m. 'attack' Kathās. ('the fourth die' TS.), āskándam absol. 'having attacked' VS. [√skand]

Name: āstáraṇa
Description: 1506 āstáraṇa n. 'layer of sacred grass' AV., 'bed, coverlet' AitBr. [√str̥]

Name: *āstariman
Description: 1508 *āstariman 'spreading out, covering'. [Cf. inf. stárimani RV., stariman- m. 'bed' lex.: √str̥]

Name: ā́stʰāpayati
Description: 1516 ā́sthāpayati 'causes to stay, hurts' RV., 'fixes into' AitBr. [√sthā]

Name: āspʰāla
Description: 1530 āsphāla m. 'striking, flapping (of elephant's ears), recoiling' Naiṣ [√sphal¹]

Name: āspʰālayati
Description: 1531 āsphālayati 'causes to flap, rocks, shakes, throws' Hariv., 'tears asunder' BhP., āsphālana- n. 'flapping, striking' MBh. [√sphal¹]

Name: āsrava
Description: 1534 āsrava m. 'foam on boiling rice' lex., 'action of senses impelling soul to external objects'. Sarvad. [√sru]

Name: āsrāvayati
Description: 1535 āsrāvayati 'causes to flow'. [Cf. ā́sravati 'flows off' AV., Pa. āsavati 'flows to', Pk. āsavamāṇa- 'dripping': √sru]

Name: ā́hārayati
Description: 1545 ā́hārayati 'procures' ŚBr., 'takes for oneself, enjoys, eats' MBh. [√hr̥]

Name: ikṣú
Description: 1550 ikṣú m. 'sugar-cane' AV., °uka- m. Suśr. [Variation in the initial syllable of i-, u-, a- and ri- suggests an orig. r̥-, but this is without other confirmation or support]

Name: iŋgita
Description: 1553 iṅgita n. 'movement of body, sign, hint' Mn. [√iṅg]

Name: iŋguda
Description: 1554 iṅguda m. 'the medicinal tree Terminalia catappa', n. 'its nut' MBh., °dī- f. 'the tree' MBh. Suśr., iṅgula- m., °lī- f. lex. [Poss. connexion with hiṅgú- (hiṅgupattra- = iṅguda-) and hiṅgula- 'vermilion, name of various plants' (in Bi. H. 'vermilion' < iṅgula-)]

Name: iccʰáti
Description: 1556 iccháti 'seeks for, wishes' RV. [In MIA. collides with √īps : √iṣ²]

Name: iñcāka
Description: 1558 iñcāka m. 'prawn, shrimp' lex., iñcaka- KāśyapaS. [Drav. Mayrhofer EWA i 85 with lit.]

Name: iṇḍvà
Description: 1559 iṇḍvà n. du. 'two coverings made of muñja grass to protect the hands from the fire' ŚBr. 2. iṇḍúva-. 3. *induva-. [Cf. uṇḍuka- and vīṭa- with list of words there given: Pa. aṇḍuva-, °uka- n. 'a roll (of cloth, hairs, or the like), aṇḍūpaka- n. 'circular roll of cloth used as a stand for a vessel']

Name: itkaṭa
Description: 1563 itkaṭa-, ikkaṭa- m. 'a kind of reed or grass' lex. 2. utkaṭa-¹ m. 'Saccharum sara or similar grass' Suśr., 'fragrant bark of Laurus cassia', °ṭā- f. 'the plant' lex.

Name: indīvara
Description: 1569 indīvara m. 'the blue lotus', n. 'its blossom' MBh., indivara-, indambara-, indirālaya- n. lex.

Name: indu
Description: 1570 indu m. 'drop (esp. of soma)' RV., 'bright drop, spark' TS., 'moon', pl. 'periodic changes of the moon' RV. [Cf. bindú- and poss. connexion with the group under vīṭā-]

Name: induka
Description: 1571 induka m. 'name of a plant (= aśmāntaka- Mn. from the fibres of which a brahman's girdle is made)' Suśr.

Name: índragōpa
Description: 1573 índragōpa 'having Indra as protector' RV., m. 'cochineal insect, firefly' ŚBr. [índra-, gōpá-]

Name: indrajālá
Description: 1574 indrajālá m. 'Indra's net' AV., 'jugglery, magic' Kathās. [índra-, jā́la-]

Name: *indrāgāra
Description: 1580 *indrāgāra n. 'a well'. [S. K. Chatterji ODBL 324: índra-, agāra-]

Name: indriyá
Description: 1581 indriyá n. 'might of Indra' RV., 'virility, penis, any sense organ' AV. [índra-]

Name: ilī
Description: 1592 ilī f. 'a kind of weapon, a cudgel or short sword', īli-, īlī- f. lex.

Name: illiśa
Description: 1594 illiśa m. 'the fish Clupea alosa', illisa- Bhpr., ilīśa- m. Udbh.

Name: iṣī́kā
Description: 1595 iṣī́kā f. 'reed used as an arrow' AV., 'sort of sugar-cane, small stick to stir crucible' lex., īṣī́kā- f. 'reed, cane' MaitrS., īṣikā- f. 'arrow' lex, iśīkā- lex.

Name: iṣukā́
Description: 1596 iṣukā́ f. 'arrow' AV. [íṣu- f. RV., n. BHSk., Pk. isu- m.]

Name: íṣṭakā
Description: 1600 íṣṭakā f. 'brick' VS., iṣṭikā- f. MBh., iṣṭā- f. BHSk. [Av. ištya- n. Mayrhofer EWA i 94 and 557 with lit

Name: *īdʰra
Description: 1612 *īdhra 'clear sky'. 2. *īdhᵃra- [īdhríya- 'belonging to the clear sky' TS.]

Name: īráyati
Description: 1614 īráyati 'causes to rise, brings to life, utters' RV. [Cf. údīrayati 'causes' RV.: √īr]

Name: īṣā́
Description: 1620 īṣā́ f. 'pole of carriage or plough' RV.

Name: īṣādaṇḍa
Description: 1621 īṣādaṇḍa m. 'handle of a plough' VP. [īṣā́-, daṇḍá-]

Name: *īṣādʰāra
Description: 1622 *īṣādhāra 'holding the pole of a plough'. [Cf. yugadhāra-: īṣā́-, dhāra-¹]

Name: úkʰya
Description: 1630 úkhya 'being in a cauldron' ŚBr., 'boiled in a pot' Pāṇ. [ukhá-]

Name: uccaṭati
Description: 1635 uccaṭati 'goes away' BhP. 2. *uccaṭyatē 'is separated from'. 3. *uccāṭya- (uccāṭayati 'drives away, scares' Pañcat., Pk. uccāḍaï 'prevents, is sorry.') [< *uccr̥tati? Cf. cr̥táti 'binds' Dhātup., ávacr̥tati 'loosens, lets go' TS.: √cr̥t?]

Name: *uccāpayati
Description: 1643 *uccāpayati 'causes to be collected'. 2. Pass. *uccā- pyatē. [Cf. cāpayati Pāṇ., uccinōti: √ci¹]

Name: *ucciŋgaka
Description: 1645 *ucciṅgaka 'a cricket'. [ucciṅgaṭa- m. 'cricket, crab' lex.; cf. ucciṭiṅga- m. 'small venomous animal in the water, crab', cicciṭiṅga- m. 'a kind of venomous insect' Suśr., ciṅgaṭa-, °aḍa- 'shrimp' lex.]

Name: uccʰēdayati
Description: 1657 ucchēdayati 'causes to be destroyed' Pañcat. [úcchinatti 'cuts off' AV., Pa. ucchindati 'destroys', Pk. ucchiṁdaï; Pa. ucchēdana- 'destroying', Pk. ucchēyaṇa- n. 'destruction': √chid]

Name: *ujjāgrat
Description: 1665 *ujjāgrat 'awake'. [Cf. jā́garti RV. and ujjāgarayati 'awakens' Sāh., Pk. ujjāgara-, ujjāara- m. 'lack of sleep': √jāgr̥]

Name: újjvalati
Description: 1671 újjvalati 'blazes up, shines' TS. 2. *ujjvālayati, újjval° 'causes to shine' ŚBr. 3. *ujjuvālayati.

Name: ujjʰáti
Description: 1674 ujjháti 'leaves, escapes' MBh. [Formed from pp. ujjhita- < *ud-źhita- and replacing *ujjahāti, Pa. ujjahati: Mayrhofer EWA i 100 with lit.: √hā³]

Name: úñcʰati
Description: 1680 úñchati or uñcháti 'gleans' ŚāṅkhGr̥. [√uñch: derivation < ucci- with P. Tedesco JAOS 77, 193 ff. phonet. unacceptable].

Name: uṭa
Description: 1681 uṭa m. 'leaves or grass used for thatching' lex. [Cf. uṭaja- m. 'hut made of leaves' MBh., Pk. uḍaya- m.]

Name: uḍu
Description: 1694 uḍu f.n. 'star' Kālid. [If isolated from uḍupa- 'moon', derivation from *r̥tu-pa- (Mayrhofer EWA i 100 with lit.) is made doubtful by the Pa. form]

Name: uḍupa
Description: 1695 uḍupa m. 'raft' MBh. [Cf. hōḍa- m. lex. prob. ← Drav., Tam. ōṭam]

Name: uḍḍīyatē
Description: 1697 uḍḍīyatē 'flies up' MBh. 2. uḍḍayatē MBh. 3. X *uddrāti. 4. Caus. uḍḍāpayati. [For discussion of ḍ see √ḍī]

Name: uṇḍuka
Description: 1699 uṇḍuka m. 'net, chignon, part of the body' Suśr. [Cf. uṇḍēraka- m. 'ball of flour, loaf, roll', uṇḍērakasraj- f. 'balls of meal on a string' Yājñ.: belongs to iṇḍvà- and the group of words collected under vīṭā- and is prob. ← Drav. cf. Tam. uṇṭai 'ball' Mal. uṇḍa, Kan. Tu. uṇḍe]

Name: utkaṭā
Description: 1704 utkaṭā f. 'the plant Laurus cassia', °ṭa- n. 'its fragrant bark' lex.

Name: utkaṇṭʰa
Description: 1708 utkaṇṭha 'having the neck uplifted, longing for' Kālid. 2. utkaṇṭhā- f. 'longing for' MBh. [kaṇṭhá-]

Name: utkaṇṭʰati
Description: 1709 utkaṇṭhati 'longs for, mourns' Dhātup. 2. utkaṇ- ṭhita- 'longing for, sorrowing for' R. [utkaṇṭha-]

Name: utkara
Description: 1710 utkara m. 'anything dug out, rubbish' AitBr., 'heap' MBh. 2. utkāra- m. 'piling up' Pāṇ. 3. utkira- 'heaping up' Kālid. 4. *utkēra- infl. by *utkērayati. [√kr̥̄¹]

Name: *utkartati
Description: 1712 *utkartati 'cuts out'. [útkr̥ntati 'cuts off or out' ŚBr., Pa. ukkantati 'cuts out, skins': √kr̥t¹]

Name: utkarṣa
Description: 1713 utkarṣa m. 'drawing upwards, eminence' Mn., adj. 'superior, boastful' Yājñ. [√kr̥ṣ]

Name: *utkalati
Description: 1716 *utkalati 'goes out or up', utkalita- 'rising, prosperous', utkalayati 'loosens' BhP. 2. *utkalyatē. 3. utkālayati 'drives out' Śaṁk. [√kal²]

Name: útkirati
Description: 1723 útkirati 'digs out or up' VS., 'piles up, engraves' Kālid. 2. *utkarati prob. MIA. formation from fut. kariṣyati, &c. but cf. útkarōti 'extirpates' MaitrS. 3. utkīrṇa-. 4. *utkērayati. [√kŕ̥¹]

Name: *utkucyatē
Description: 1725 *utkucyatē 'is bent up'. [utkucati 'bends upwards, crooks, opens (as a flower)' Kauś. : √kuc]

Name: utkuṭaka
Description: 1726 utkuṭaka 'sitting on the hams', utkaṭikā- f. 'the act of so doing' Suśr. [Cf. *utkaṭa-³ and √kuṭ¹]

Name: utkuṇa
Description: 1728 utkuṇa m. 'bug, louse', uṅkuṇa-, ōkaṇa-, °ṇi- m., ōkkaṇī- f., ōkōdanī- f. lex. [Cf. kuṇa-, *ḍhēṅkuṇa-, matkuṇa-¹]

Name: útkramati
Description: 1737 útkramati 'ascends' AV., 'passes away' ŚBr., 'neglects, transgresses' MBh. 2. útkrāmayati 'causes to go up' TS. [√kram]

Name: utkrāma
Description: 1739 utkrāma m. 'going out or up' lex. [Cf. utkramá- m. 'id.' VS.: √kram]

Name: úttanōti
Description: 1759 úttanōti 'stretches', 3 pl. aor. mid. úd atnata 'they stretched themselves' RV. [√tan]

Name: uttapatē
Description: 1761 uttapatē 'gives out heat, warms oneself' Pāṇ. 2. uttapta- 'red hot' Śārṅg. 3. uttāpayati 'heats' MBh. [√tap]

Name: uttapana
Description: 1762 uttapana m. 'a partic. kind of fire' MW. [√tap]

Name: uttamá
Description: 1765 uttamá 'highest, the most removed in order or time' RV. [ud¹]

Name: *uttamaputra
Description: 1766 *uttamaputra 'the son most removed in order'. [uttamá-, putrá-]

Name: úttara
Description: 1767 úttara 'upper' RV., 'northern' AV., 'following, future' RV. 2. n. (sc. vākyam) 'answer' R. [ud¹]

Name: uttaraṁga
Description: 1768 uttaraṁga n. 'wooden arch over doorframe' lex. [Perh. Pk. < uttarāṅga- n. '*upper part, last sound of combined consonants']

Name: uttáraṇa
Description: 1769 uttáraṇa 'coming out, crossing over' VS., n. 'landing, crossing a river' Pañcat. 2. *uttaraṇī-. [√tr̥̄]

Name: úttarati
Description: 1770 úttarati 'elevates' RV., 'passes over' MBh., 'alights, descends' Vet. 2. uttārayati 'makes come out' MBh., 'makes descend' Pañcat. [The assumption by Wackernagel AiGr 1, lii of a sanskritization of MIA. ōtarati (*ottarati) < avatarati to explain late meaning of uttarati 'alights, descends' is perh. unnecessary: semant. development was 'crosses over — lands — alights (from boat or vehicle) — descends': √tr̥̄]

Name: uttarāpatʰa
Description: 1774 uttarāpatha m. 'the north' Kathās. [uttarapatha- m. Pāṇ.: úttara-, pánthā-]

Name: uttarāṣāḍʰā
Description: 1778 uttarāṣāḍhā f. 'name of a lunar mansion' lex. [úttara-, áṣāḍhā-]

Name: uttarī́ya
Description: 1781 uttarī́ya n. 'outer or upper garment' KātyŚrS., °aka- n. Kathās. [úttara-]

Name: uttāná
Description: 1785 uttāná 'stretched out, lying on the back' RV. [√tan]

Name: uttāraṇa
Description: 1792 uttāraṇa n. 'act of landing, transportation, rescuing' R. [√tr̥̄]

Name: *uttutta
Description: 1795 *uttutta 'pushed up'. [Sk. úttudati 'pushes up or open' AV., Pk. uttuyaï 'pains, distresses': √tud]

Name: *uttr̩ta
Description: 1797 *uttr̥ta 'passed over or up'. [Cf. uttīrṇa- 'crossed, landed, escaped', Pa. uttiṇṇa- 'drawn out', n. 'outlet': √tr̥̄]

Name: *utpaṭati
Description: 1809 *utpaṭati 'bursts open'. 2. utpāṭayati 'roots up' SāṅkhŚr. 3. *utpaṭyati 'is burst open' (cf. utpāṭyatē 'is rooted up' Suśr.) [útpaṭa- m. 'sap issuing from a cut in a tree' ŚBr., páṭati 'splits' Gr.: √paṭ¹]

Name: útpatati
Description: 1810 útpatati 'flies up, ascends' RV., 'is produced' MBh. 2. útpātayati 'causes to fly up or rise' RV. [√pat]

Name: *utpatʰika
Description: 1813 *utpathika 'astray'. [utpatha- m. 'wrong road' Kāś., adj. 'astray' BhP., Pa. uppatha- m., Pk. uppaha- m.: pánthā-]

Name: útpadyatē
Description: 1814 útpadyatē 'arises, originates' ŚBr. 2. utpanna- 'produced, born' R. 3. utpādayati 'produces, begets' MBh.

Name: utpala
Description: 1815 utpala¹ n. 'blossom of the blue lotus' MBh. [Mayrhofer EWA i 103 MIA. form of útpaṭa- 'eruption' ŚBr.: very doubtful]

Name: *utpala
Description: 1816 *utpala² 'a cake', utpalī- f. 'a cake of unwinnowed corn' lex. ['shaped like a lotus'

Name: utpāṭa
Description: 1819 utpāṭa 'splitting off, pulling up by the roots' lex., utpā́ṭikā- f. 'external bark of a tree' (which can be split off?) ŚBr. [√paṭ¹]

Name: utpā́ta
Description: 1820 utpā́ta m. 'any sudden portent' AV., 'flying up' MBh. [√pat]

Name: utpātaka
Description: 1821 utpātaka m. 'a kind of animal', utpādaka- 'a fabulous animal Śarabha' (= ūrdhvapāda-) lex., utpādikā- f. 'a noxious insect', (Wilson Hār. 110) 'flea (?), white ant', upādikā- f. (see upadī́ka-). [Poss. conn. or contam. with útpatati or útpibati 'drinks, sucks' ŚBr., utpiba- 'drinking out' Vop

Name: utpāda
Description: 1823 utpāda² 'having the legs stretched out, standing on the feet' MW. [pā́da-]

Name: *utpraidʰa
Description: 1833 *utpraidha 'rising up'. [Cf. ḗdhatē 'increases' RV., 'becomes insolent' MBh., 'rises' BhP., praidhatē Pāṇ. com. :√ēdh]

Name: utplavatē
Description: 1834 utplavatē 'swims up' Suśr., 'springs up' Mn. 2. Caus. *utplāvayati. [Cf. 2 sg. aor. utprōṣṭhāḥ 'leapt' ĀśvŚr. :√plu]

Name: utpʰalati
Description: 1837 utphalati 'springs open, jumps out, bursts' Bālar. 2. utphālayati 'opens wide' MBh. [√sphal¹]

Name: *ut-śiṣṭa
Description: 1850 *ut-śiṣṭa-. 2. úcchiṣṭa- 'left over, stale, spat out' TS., n. 'leavings' AV. [uñśiṣṭa- MaitrS. :√śiṣ]

Name: *ut-śīrṣa
Description: 1853 *ut-śīrṣa-, ucchīrṣaka- m. 'one who has raised his head' Suśr., n. 'pillow' Mn. [Cf. *ut-śiras-: śīrṣá-]

Name: *ut-śrayaṇa
Description: 1857a †*ut-śrayaṇa-, ucchrayaṇa- n. 'raising, erecting' KātyŚr. (cf. ucchraya- m. 'height of tree or mountain etc.' MBh.). [√śri]

Name: *ut-śrāya
Description: 1860 *ut-śrāya-, ucchrāyī́- f. 'raised piece of wood', °ya- m. 'elevation, height', ucchraya- m. Yājñ. [Cf. samucchraya- m., Pa. samussaya- m. 'accumulation': √śri]

Name: *ut-śvasiti
Description: 1866 *ut-śvasiti, ucchvasiti 'takes a deep breath' Gobh. 2. *ut-śvāsayati, ucchvāsayati 'causes to breathe again, gladdens, raises' BhP. ucchvasiti

Name: útsa
Description: 1869 útsa m. 'spring of water' RV. 2. utsíya- (utsyà-) 'coming from a spring (of water)' AV. [√ud²].

Name: utsaŋga
Description: 1870 utsaṅga m. 'haunch, part above the hips, lap' MBh. [√sañj]

Name: *utsadʰānī
Description: 1872 *utsadhānī 'spring of water'. [Cf. utsadhí- 'receptacle of a spring' RV. and *udadhānī-: útsa-, dhā́na-]

Name: útsarati
Description: 1874 útsarati 'hastens away, escapes' AV. 2. '*rises', cf. utsaraṇa- n. 'going up' lex., utsr̥ta- 'high' Hariv. [√sr̥]

Name: utsā́dana
Description: 1879 utsā́dana n. 'putting away' ŚBr., 'causing to fill up' Suśr., 'raising' lex. [√sad]

Name: útsiñcati
Description: 1883 útsiñcati 'causes to flow over' RV. 2. Caus. utsē- cayati. [√sic]

Name: *utsukya
Description: 1886 *utsukya 'eagerness'. [Cf. utsuka- 'anxious, eager' MBh., Pa. ussuka- 'eager', NiDoc. osuǵa-, Pk. ucchua-, ussuga-, ōsua-; autsukya- n. 'longing for' MBh., NiDoc. osukya-. Pa. uss- regularly < ut-s- contradicts the theory of Wackernagel and Debrunner KZ 67, 155 f., accepted by EWA i 9, of hypersanskritism < MIA. *icchua- (cf. Sk. Pk. icchu-)

Name: utsr̩ṣṭa
Description: 1890 utsr̥ṣṭa 'let loose, abandoned' MBh. [útsr̥jati 'lets loose' RV., Pa. ussajjati: √sr̥j]

Name: *ut-stʰāti
Description: 1900 *ut-sthāti 'stands up'. 2. Reformed as *utthāti. [úttiṣṭhati, udásthāt RV.; pres. -*sthāti formed after -sthā- in aor., fut., inf., and ger.: √sthā]

Name: *ut-stʰāna
Description: 1901 *ut-sthāna 'act of rising'. 2. Reformed as utthā́na- n. ŚBr, 'starting on an expedition' Mn., 'manly effort' MBh. [√sthā]

Name: *ut-stʰāpyatē
Description: 1904 *ut-sthāpyatē 'is raised'. [utthāpya- 'to be raised, to be sent away' AitBr.: √sthā]

Name: údañcati
Description: 1924 údañcati 'raises, throws up' RV., 'ladles out' AV. 2. *upāñcati, úpācati 'lifts up e.g. water' ŚBr. [Phon. the mod. forms may derive from either: √añc]

Name: udáñcana
Description: 1925 udáñcana n. 'bucket for drawing water from a well' RV., 'throwing up, lid' lex. [√añc]

Name: *udadʰānī
Description: 1926 *udadhānī-, udadhāna- 'holding water' Kauś., n. 'reservoir for water' Āp. [udán-, dhā́na-]

Name: udācāra
Description: 1934 udācāra m. 'place for walking' Āp. [Cf. udā́carati 'rises out of' RV.: √car]

Name: *udāstʰāti
Description: 1936 *udāsthāti, 1 pl. aor. udā́sthāma 'we have risen again' AV., udāsthita- 'set over' lex. [√sthā]

Name: udīkṣā
Description: 1938 udīkṣā f. 'looking up' BhP. [údīkṣatē 'looks up at' ŚBr., Pa. udikkhati, Pk. udikkhia-: √īkṣ]

Name: údīrtē
Description: 1939 údīrtē 'rises' RV. [Cf. údīrayati 'causes to move' RV., Pa. udīrēti, Pk. uīrēi 'sends': √īr]

Name: udumbára
Description: 1942 udumbára-, udú° m. 'the tree Ficus glomerata' TS., n. 'its fruit' ŚBr. 2. uḍumbára- m. AV. 3. *dumbara. 4. *ḍumbara-. [Prob. ← Austro-as. EWA i 104 with lit.]

Name: údēti
Description: 1944 údēti 'goes up, rises' RV. 2. údita-¹ 'risen' RV. 3. *udāyayati 'causes to rise'. [√i²]

Name: *udgamati
Description: 1947 *udgamati 'comes forth, rises'. [Orig. subj. of aor. in udáganma 1st pl. RV.: √gam]

Name: udgamana
Description: 1948 udgamana n. 'coming forth' R., 'rising (of a star)' Pāṇ [√gam]

Name: udgalati
Description: 1953 udgalati¹ 'trickles out, oozes out, drips' BhP. 2. *udgālayati¹ 'causes to ooze out'. [~ *udgarati¹: √gal¹, √*gr̥̄¹]

Name: *udgāti
Description: 1954 *udgāti 'rises, comes forth'. [Orig. subj. of aor. údagāt RV. 'has risen (of sun)': √gā]

Name: udgātʰā
Description: 1955 udgāthā f. 'a variety of Āryā metre' Colebrooke. [Cf. udgīthá- m. AV.: gā́thā-, √gai]

Name: *udgāmayati
Description: 1956 *udgāmayati 'causes to rise or issue'. [Cf. udgamayati 'causes to issue' Pat., Pk. uggamiya- 'produced': √gam]

Name: údguratē
Description: 1961 údguratē 'lifts up, raises a weapon, raises the voice threateningly' VS. 2. *udgirati¹. 3. *udgurita- (replacing udgūrṇa- n. 'threatening' Yājñ.) [See *udgārayati¹, *udgr̥ta-: √gur¹]

Name: udgráhaṇa
Description: 1965 udgráhaṇa n. 'act of taking out' ŚBr., udgrabhaṇa- n. 'act of raising' KātyŚr. [√grah]

Name: udgrāhayati
Description: 1967 udgrāhayati 'causes to take up, causes to pay' Yājñ. 2. Pp. udgrāhita-. [√grah]

Name: *udgʰata
Description: 1969 *udghata 'raised, opened'. [< IE *-gʷhn̊to- ? Replaced anal. by uddhata-, after úddhanti < *-gʷhen-: √han¹]

Name: *udgʰarati
Description: 1971 *udgharati² 'lifts up'. 2. Caus. *udghārayati. 3. Pp. *udghr̥ta-. [Hardly conn. with hárati which is IE. *ĝher-]

Name: udgʰāṭa
Description: 1972 udghāṭa m. 'act of opening' Subh. 2. *udghāṭaka-¹ 'open'. 3. *udghāṭikā- 'open platform for watching from', udghāṭa- m. 'watchhouse' lex. [√ghaṭ]

Name: udgʰāṭaka
Description: 1973 udghāṭaka² n. 'leather bucket for drawing water' lex. [Poss. conn. with udghāṭaka- m. 'key' Mr̥cch. and udghāṭa-: √ghaṭ]

Name: *uddanta
Description: 1982 *uddanta 'without teeth'. [Replaces adantáka- TS., adánt° ŚBr. (~ uddantura- 'formidable' lex., Pk. uddaṁtura- 'with projecting teeth')

Name: *uddāta
Description: 1986 *uddāta 'cleansed, bright, clear'. [Cf. avadāta- 'cleansed, pure, dazzling white' MBh., Pa. ōdāta-, Pk. avadāya-: √dai]

Name: uddāna
Description: 1987 uddāna¹ n. 'act of binding or fastening together' MBh. [√dā²]

Name: uddāla
