Description: 1990 uddāla¹ m. 'the tree Cordia myxa or latifolia', °aka- m. Suśr. [Poss. conn. with kuddāla-²: note esp. H. uṛāl and Or. kudāḷa 'Bauhinea variegata']

Name: úddīpyatē
Description: 1994 úddīpyatē 'blazes up' ŚBr. [Cf. úddīpayati 'inflames' AV., Pa. uddīpanā- f. 'explanation', Pk. uddīvia- 'kindled'; uddīpta- 'flaming' lex., Pk. udditta-: √dīp]

Name: *uddēkṣati
Description: 1997 *uddēkṣati 'looks for, expects'. 2. *uddēkṣā-. [Formed from *dēkṣati after údīkṣatē ŚBr.: √īkṣ and √dr̥ś]

Name: *uddrāti
Description: 2001 *uddrāti 'flees, flies'. [Cf. uddrāvá- 'running away' VS., m. 'going upwards' Pāṇ.: √drā]

Name: úddʰanti
Description: 2007 úddhanti 'lifts up' RV., 'turns up the earth' TS. [√han¹]

Name: úddʰarati
Description: 2009 úddharati 'takes out' RV., 'rescues, ladles up' AV., 'raises' TS. 2. úddhr̥ta- 'drawn up or out' AV. 3. uddhārayati 'raises'. 4. *ūḍhārayati < *udᶻdh- (= Av. uz-d-)? [ud-hr̥- and ud-dhr̥ collide, but Pa. absol. ūhacca is < *uhhr̥tya < ud-hr̥tya with assimilation of unexploded -d to h-: √hr̥ or √dhr̥]

Name: uddʰava
Description: 2013 uddhava² m. 'name of a friend of Kr̥ṣṇa' MBh. [The ill-success of his mission to Rādhā made him a symbol of simplicity: ODBL 507]

Name: uddʰāna
Description: 2015 uddhāna² '*rising up', n. 'act of ejecting' lex. [Cf. újjihītē 'rises up' RV.: √hā²]

Name: uddʰārá
Description: 2018 uddhārá m. 'act of raising' Gaut., 'deliverance' MBh., 'loan (esp. without interest)'. [√dhr̥]

Name: uddʰí
Description: 2021 uddhí m. 'seat of a carriage' AV., 'earthen stand on which the ukhā rests' ŚBr. [√dhā]

Name: *uddʰuvati
Description: 2024 *uddhuvati, or *uddhavati 'shakes up'. [Cf. dhuváti AV., dhaváti Dhātup., úddhunōti 'shakes up' RV., Pk. uddhuṇiya-, °ūṇiya- 'blown by the wind, scattered': √dhū]

Name: uddʰūta
Description: 2026 uddhūta, °dhuta- 'shaken, shaken off, thrown up' MBh. [Cf. úddhū̆nōti RV.: √dhū]

Name: uddʰūlayati
Description: 2027 uddhūlayati 'sprinkles with powder' Kathās. 2. uddhūlana- n. 'act of so doing' Bālar. [*dhūḍi-]

Name: uddʰmāna
Description: 2028 uddhmāna n. 'fire-place' lex. [Perh. re-sanskritization of uddhāna-¹; but semant. cf. udvāna-³ with which it would collide in Paš. and Si.: √dham]

Name: *uddʰrasā
Description: 2030 *uddhrasā 'coughing up'. [dhrasnāti 'casts up', udhrasnāti 'throws up, gleans', perf. udhrasāṁ babhūva, udhrāsayati Dhātup. for uddhr° E. H. Johnston JRAS 1931, 571: √dhras]

Name: uddʰvaṁsatē
Description: 2031 uddhvaṁsatē 'is affected by disease' Car. [uddhvaṁsa- m. 'affection of the throat, hoarseness' Suśr., uddhvaṁsayati 'attacks, affects' MBh., Pa. uddhaṁsati, Pk. uddhaṁsaï: √dhvaṁs]

Name: *uddʰvalati
Description: 2032 *uddhvalati 'goes astray'. 2. *uddhvālayati 'leads astray'. 3. *uddhvāla-. [Prob. cmpd. of hválati 'goes astray' ŚBr. = hváratē RV., hvālayati 'shakes' Bhaṭṭ.; but poss., in view of forms with ūḍh- (if < *udᶻdh-), cmpd. of *dhvalati = dhvárati 'bends, makes fall' Dhātup., 3 pl. aor. mid. ádhūrṣata RV.: √hval (√hvr̥) or √dhvr̥]

Name: udyama
Description: 2048 udyama m. 'act of raising' Yājñ., 'undertaking, striving after, zeal' R. [√yam]

Name: *udyamati
Description: 2049 *udyamati, údyacchati 'raises' RV., 'undertakes, is diligent' MBh. 2. udyamana- n. 'raising' Pāṇ., 'exertion' Daś. [√yam]

Name: *udyasati
Description: 2050 *udyasati 'is eager for' [Cf. udyāsá- m. 'exertion, effort' VS., yásyati 'froths up' RV., 'heats or exerts oneself' Car., yasati Pāṇ.: √yas]

Name: udyā́na
Description: 2052 udyā́na n. 'going out' AV. 2. 'park, garden' Yājñ., °aka- n. R. [√yā]

Name: udra
Description: 2057 udra² 'water' in anudrá- 'waterless', udrín- 'abounding in water' RV. 2. ulla-² 'wet' BHSk. [udán-: ud²]

Name: *udraṁhati
Description: 2058 *udraṁhati 'jumps up'. 2. Caus. *udraṁhayati. [ráṁhati 'hastens' RV., raṅghatē Bhaṭṭ., láṅghati 'jumps' Dhātup., all < IE. *legʷh- IEW 660: √raṁh]

Name: *udrikʰati
Description: 2060 *udrikhati, úllikhati 'makes an incision or furrow' ŚBr., 'scratches' AśvGr̥. [√rikh¹]

Name: údricyatē
Description: 2061 údricyatē 'is prominent' RV. 2. *udriñcati 'empties'. 3. údrikta- 'superfluous' TS. 4. *udrēcati 'leaves'. 5. udrēcayati 'causes to increase' Rājat. 6. *udrēcyatē 'is poured out'. [All later forms have basic meaning of uncompounded ric- 'leave, empty, pour' cf. Pa. uddēkanika- 'spouting' ZDMG 114, 445 < udrēka-: √ric]

Name: *udrīyatē
Description: 2063 *udrīyatē 'runs out, is dissolved, is broken'. 2. *udrīṇa-. 3. *udrēpayati. [riṇā́ti 'lets go' RV., rī́yatē 'is dissolved, is shattered' RV., rīṇa- 'dissolved' Śiś., rēpayati Gr.: √rī]

Name: *udrēkʰa
Description: 2066 *udrēkha 'scratching, drawing', ullēkha- 'causing to appear clearly', °khā- f. 'stroke, line' lex. [√rikh¹]

Name: údvartatē
Description: 2071 údvartatē 'bursts open, is puffed up with pride, originates' ŚBr., 'rises, swells' Suśr. 2. udvr̥tta- 'turned up, opened' MBh. 3. údvartayati 'breaks in pieces' RV. [√vr̥t¹]

Name: udvartana
Description: 2072 udvartana n. 'pounding, rubbing and kneading the body, unguents used therefor' Yājñ. [√vr̥t¹]

Name: udvāna
Description: 2078 udvāna³, uddā° n. 'stove' lex. [Semant. cf. uddhmāna- with which it would collide in Paš. and Si.: √vā²]

Name: údvāyati
Description: 2081 údvāyati 'is extinguished, is exhausted' TS. 2. údvāpayati¹ 'extinguishes' TBr. 3. udvāna-¹ n. 'being extinguished' Nyāyam. [vā́yati 'is exhausted' RV., 'dries up' Dhātup., vāna-, vāta- 'dried up' lex. Merges with údvāti 'is blown out' AitBr.: √vā² and √vai]

Name: udvāhanī
Description: 2085 udvāhanī f. 'rope' lex., °na- n. 'anything that lifts' lex. [udvahana- n. 'lifting up' Suśr., Pk. uvvahaṇa- n.: √vah]

Name: udvēṣṭatē
Description: 2091 udvēṣṭatē 'winds or twists upwards' MBh. 2. udvēṣṭana- n. 'wrapping, contraction, pain in the back' Suśr. [√vēṣṭ]

Name: undura
Description: 2095 undura m. 'rat, mouse' Suśr., °duru-, °daru- m. lex. 2. indūra- m. lex. [← Austro-as. EWA i 105 with lit.]

Name: unnaḍa
Description: 2098 unnaḍa 'arrogant' BHS ii 132, more prob. 'boisterous' Brough Dhp 279. [Perh. < *un-nr̥t-a- (Brough loc. cit. with lit.) cf. unnaṭati 'jumps' Kāś. on Pāṇ. and poss. semantic contamination with unnatá- in BHSk. 'arrogant', Pk. uṇṇaya- and with unnaddha- 'impudent' MBh

Name: unnatá
Description: 2099 unnatá 'having a large hump' VS., 'raised, high' MBh., n. 'elevated part' TS. [√nam]

Name: únnayati
Description: 2101 únnayati 'leads out or up, sets up, frees from' RV. 2. únnīta- 'led up' RV. [√nī]

Name: *unnahati
Description: 2103 *unnahati 'unties'. [unnahyati 'frees, unties' Suśr., 'frees oneself, rushes out' MBh., unnahana- 'unfettered' BhP.: √nah]

Name: unnābʰa
Description: 2106 unnābha '*tearing open' (m. 'name of a king' Kālid.). [únnambhayati 'tears open' TS.: √nabh]

Name: *unmatʰyatē
Description: 2113 *unmathyatē 'is stirred up' 2. unmathayati 'shakes, excites' BhP. 3. *unmāthayati. [unmathnāti 'disturbs, rouses' PārGr̥., mathyátē 'is stirred' RV., māthayati MBh.: √manth]

Name: unmada
Description: 2114 unmada 'mad, drunk' Kālid. or unmāda- 'mad' BhP., m. 'intoxication' MBh. [√mad¹]

Name: unmāna
Description: 2121 unmāna n. 'weight, value' ŚBr., 'measure of height or length' VarBr̥S. [√mā]

Name: *upakanīyas
Description: 2137 *upakanīyas 'next younger'. [Cf. upakaniṣṭhikā- f. 'finger next the little finger' ĀśvGr̥. and kánīyas- 'younger' RV., Pa. kaniya-, Pk. kaṇīa-, °ṇīasa-: *kana-]

Name: úpakarōti
Description: 2139 úpakarōti 'takes care of' ŚBr., 'provides' Mn., 'helps' R. [Cf. upaskurutē 'adorns' Pāṇ.; √kr̥¹]

Name: upakāra
Description: 2141 upakāra m. 'help, use' MBh., 'embellishment (as a gate with garlands)' Suśr. [√kr̥¹]

Name: *upakāla
Description: 2144 *upakāla 'summer'. [Semant. cf. Psht. psarlai 'spring' < *upa-sarada-ka- (where sarad- is 'summer') and similar time and season names in Sk.: upaparvan- 'the day before the Parvan', upapūrvarātram 'towards the beginning of night': EVP 60. Did kālá-² which gives 'year' in Sh. mean 'autumn' or 'winter'?]

Name: *upakr̩kāṭī
Description: 2147 *upakr̥kāṭī 'part near the back of the neck'. [kr̥kā- ṭikā-]

Name: upakr̩ta
Description: 2148 upakr̥ta 'helped' Pāṇ., n. 'help, favour' Kālid. [Cf. upaskr̥ta- 'adorned' MBh., Pa. upakkhata- 'helped': √kr̥¹]

Name: upagīti
Description: 2155 upagīti f. 'a variety of āryā metre'. [Cf. upagīthá- n. MaitrS., upagātŕ̥- m. 'one who accompanies the song of udgātṛ' TS.: √gai]

Name: *upagr̩bʰāyati
Description: 2156 *upagr̥bhāyati, úpagr̥hṇāti 'seizes from below' AV., 'collects' TS., 'takes possession of' MBh. 2. *upaghr̥pta-. [√grah]

Name: upagraha
Description: 2157 upagraha m. 'a handful (of kuśa grass)' KātyŚr. [Cf. upagrahaṇa- n. 'act of seizing' ib.: √grah]

Name: *upagʰrāyati
Description: 2158 *upaghrāyati 'smells at'. [Cf. upaghrā́yam 'smelling at' MaitrS., úpaghrāpayati 'causes to smell at' TS. upajaghrau 'kissed' Kālid. √ghrā]

Name: *upacāyayati
Description: 2162 *upacāyayati 'heaps up'. [úpacinōti 'heaps up' TS., Pa. upacināti; Pk. uvacayaṇa- n. 'growth'; cāyayati, cāpayati Pāṇ.: √ci¹]

Name: upacít
Description: 2165 upacít f. 'a partic. disease, a kind of swelling' VS. [√ci¹]

Name: upacīyatē
Description: 2166 upacīyatē 'is heaped together, is strong, succeeds' MBh. 2. upacita- 'heaped up, prosperous' MBh., 'strong, fat' Suśr. [√ci¹]

Name: *upatimyati
Description: 2176 *upatimyati 'wets'. [For upa with a verb 'to wet' cf. úpōnatti ŚBr., úpōtta-: √tim]

Name: upadarśayati
Description: 2176a †upadarśayati 'causes to appear, illudes' Kathās., 'illustrates' Yājñ., úpadadarśa- RV. [√dr̥ś]

Name: upadī́ka
Description: 2178 upadī́ka m., °kā- f. 'species of ant' ŚBr., upacī́ka- m. AV. (Ppp.), upajī́ka- m. AV. 2. uddēhikā- f. 'white ant' Hār. 3. upadēhikā- f. lex. [With uddēhikā- which is poss. ancient Bartholomae AirWb 411 compares Av. uzdaēza- m. 'piling up earth', uzdaēzay- m. 'wall'. But in addition to the preceding cf. also upajíhvikā- f. RV., upadīpikā-, uddīpikā-, upādikā-, utpādikā- f. lex. This variety of forms was attributed by Wackernagel AiGr ii 1, 11 with lit., and ii 2, 316 to popular etymology. Taboo also prob. played a part. Very aberrant Pk. ōliṁbhā- perh. infl. by ōliṁpaï 'smears']

Name: úpadravati
Description: 2181 úpadravati 'rushes at, attacks' RV. 2. *upadrā- vayati 'causes to be attacked'. [√dru]

Name: úpapadyatē
Description: 2191 úpapadyatē 'goes towards, attacks' AV., 'approaches for help' AitBr., 'enters' MBh., 'is produced' Kauś., 'is suitable' MBh. 2. upapanna- Yājñ. [√pad¹]

Name: úpayaccʰati
Description: 2206 úpayacchati 'lays hold of, takes' RV. or *upāyacchati cf. ā́yacchati. [√yam]

Name: *uparaṭati
Description: 2211 *uparaṭati 'shouts to'. [úpa with 'to call' cf. úpahvayatē RV., upārudati Bhaṭṭ.: √raṭ]

Name: úpala
Description: 2223 úpala m. 'stone, rock' MBh., °aka- m. 'precious stone' Suśr., 'upper millstone (?)' in upala-prakṣín- RV., úpalā- f. 'upper and smaller millstone' ŚBr. 2. *upalla-. 3. *pala- or *palla-. [EWAi 106 l-form of úpara-; but more general meaning 'rock, stone' suggests another origin. Then upalā- f. might be primarily the smaller of the two millstones, but influenced semant. by úpara-]

Name: *upalābʰayati
Description: 2230 *upalābhayati 'causes to obtain'. [upalabhatē 'obtains' MBh., Pk. uvalabhaï; caus. upalambhayati BhP., Pk. uvalaṁbhaï 'obtains': √labh]

Name: upavartatē
Description: 2240 upavartatē 'walks on' ĀśvŚr., 'returns' R., upā́vartatē 'approaches' RV., 'returns' MBh., upā́vartayati 'causes to turn to' ŚBr. [√vr̥t¹]

Name: úpavīta
Description: 2247 úpavīta 'invested with the thread', n. 'the sacred thread' Kālid. [√vyē]

Name: upavēṣṭayati
Description: 2251 upavēṣṭayati 'wrap up' MW., upavēṣṭitin- 'one who has wrapped a cloth round his loins' Āp. [√vēṣṭ]

Name: úpaśrayati
Description: 2254 úpaśrayati tr. 'leans against' ŚBr., upāśrayati Mn. [Cf. upāśraya- m. 'refuge' MBh., Pa. upassaya- m. 'resting place', Pk. uvassaya-, uvāsaya- m.: √śri]

Name: upasara
Description: 2258 upasara m. 'approach' Bhaṭṭ., 'approach of a male to a female' (see *upasariyā-) Pāṇ. [√sr̥]

Name: *upasariyā
Description: 2260 *upasariyā, upasaryā- f. 'one to be impregnated' Pāṇ. [upasara- m. 'approach of a male to a female, covering (a cow)' Pāṇ.: √sr̥]

Name: upasḗcana
Description: 2261 upasḗcana 'pouring on' RV., n. 'sprinkling on' RV., 'infusion, juice' AV. [√sic]

Name: *upaskadati
Description: 2263 *upaskadati 'jumps towards'. 2. *upaskatta-. [Cf. inf. skádē, skádaḥ RV., aor. askadat Gr., upaskanna- 'attacked' R.: √skand]

Name: upastára
Description: 2268 upastára m. 'anything laid under' AV. [Cf. upastír- f. 'cover' RV.: √str̥]

Name: *upastarati
Description: 2269 *upastarati, úpastr̥ṇāti 'spreads over, scatters under' RV., upāstarati VarBr̥S. 2. upastáraṇa- n. 'cover' RV., 'undermattress' ĀśvGr̥. 3. *upastr̥ta- 'spread over'. [√str̥]

Name: upástʰa
Description: 2271 upástha¹ m. 'lap, sheltered or secure place' RV. [√sthā]

Name: *upastʰāti
Description: 2274 *upasthāti 'stands near', upasthita- 'approached' ĀśvGr̥S. [úpatiṣṭhati 'stands near' RV., 'attends on' MBh.: √sthā]

Name: úpaharati
Description: 2281 úpaharati 'brings near, offers (food)' AV., 'takes away' MBh., °tē 'accepts' TS. [√hr̥]

Name: upahāsá
Description: 2282 upahāsá m. 'sport' ŚBr., 'laughter' Kathās., upahāsya- 'to be laughed at'. [√has]

Name: upā́karōti
Description: 2284 upā́karōti 'fetches (úpa ā́ akaram RV.), makes preparation (for a sacred ceremonial), undertakes, begins' TS., 'consecrates' Mn. [√kr̥¹]

Name: upākṣa
Description: 2287 upākṣa¹, °aka- m. 'part of cart which adjoins axletree' lex. 2. '*adjoining the shoulder'. [ákṣa-¹]

Name: *upāñjali
Description: 2298 *upāñjali 'putting the open hands together'. [Cf. upa-hasta- m. 'act of taking with the hand' Pāṇ.: añjalí-]

Name: upādʰi
Description: 2299 upādhi¹ m. 'point of view, aim' Car., upā́hita- 'set out, proposed as prize' ŚBr. [√dhā]

Name: upānáh
Description: 2302 upānáh f. 'shoe, sandal' TS., upānaha- m. MBh. (prāṇāhitā- f. 'shoe' lex. sanskritization of MIA. *pāṇah-). [√nah]

Name: upāntá
Description: 2303 upāntá n. 'border, edge', °tḗ 'near the end' TS. [Cf. Psht. bānde 'upon' < *upā̆ntai EVP 15: ánta-]

Name: upāntika
Description: 2304 upāntika n. 'nearness', °tam 'near' R. [antika- or poss. *upānti in Pa. upanti 'near': ánti¹]

Name: upārdʰa
Description: 2310 upārdha n. 'half, the first half' Lalit. [Cf. upacaturaḥ 'nearly 4' Kāś.: ardhá-²]

Name: upā́labʰatē
Description: 2312 upā́labhatē 'touches' ŚBr., 'lays hold of, kills, censures' ChUp. 2. *upālābhayati. [√labh]

Name: *upēṣayati
Description: 2323 *upēṣayati 'sends on'. [Cf. upaprḗṣyati 'drives on' AV.: prob. to be separated from úpēṣatē 'attacks' RV. < upa īṣ-: √iṣ¹]

Name: úpōdaka
Description: 2327 úpōdaka 'near to water' VS., n. 'the plant Basella cordifolia' Suśr. [udaká-]

Name: *upparabʰūmi
Description: 2332 *upparabhūmi 'upper ground'. [Cf. uparibhūmí adv. 'above the ground' ŚBr.: *uppara-, bhū́mi-]

Name: *ubbakka
Description: 2337 *ubbakka 'vomited'. [S. uḇ-, G. M. ub- point to earlier *ubb- (< *udb- ?) rather than *uvv- as in Pk. (< *udvakka- replacing udvānta-)]

Name: *ubbal
Description: 2339 *ubbal 'rise, swell, boil'. 2. *ubbāl- tr. [Morgenstierne AO xviii 222 derives from ud-val-, Sk. vā̆layati, ONorwegian vella 'boil', IE. *wel- IEW 1140. If so forms of K. G.M. with b and S. with ḇ must be ← Centre, since -d-v- > Pk. -vv- and in these languages -v-. Poss., with *ubbar-, *ubbār- above, due to coalescence of ud-val- with ud-bhar- s.v. údbharati; but cf. also a similar series s.v. *ummaḍ-.

Name: umbara
Description: 2341 umbara, °bura- m. 'upper timber of a door-frame' lex.

Name: *umbāḍa
Description: 2342 *umbāḍa 'firebrand'. [Conn. doubtful with úlmuka- m. AitBr., Pk. ummua- n.]

Name: umbī
Description: 2343 umbī f. 'fried stalks of wheat or barley', °bikā- f., ulumbā- f. lex.

Name: úrā
Description: 2352 úrā f. 'ewe' RV. [Cf. urabhra- m. 'ram' Suśr., Pa. Pk. urabbha- m.]

Name: *urvara
Description: 2356 *urvara 'surplus, left over', urvarita- 'left over' BhP. [Poss. with EWA i 110 hyper-sanskritism fr. Pk., but perh. conn. with ulvaṇá-, ulba° 'excessive', Pk. ullaṇa-, uvvaṇa- ubba° and with urvárī- f. 'wife presented with many others for choice' AV., Pa. ubbarī- f. 'concubine'. S. with b and ḇ indicates early MIA. -vv- and -bb-]

Name: úlapa
Description: 2357 úlapa m. 'bush, shrub, grass' RV., 'the grass Saccharum cylindricum' lex., ulū̆pa-, ulūka-² m. lex. [Cf. ulapyà- 'having to do with u°' VS., °pyá- MaitrS.]

Name: ulū́kʰala
Description: 2360 ulū́khala n. 'a wooden mortar' RV., aulūkhalḗ 'pestle and mortar' MaitrS. 2. *ulukkhala-. 3. udūkhala- n. Suśr. 4. *udukkhala-. [← Drav. EWA 111 with lit. Like músala-, pop. derivative with -ala- J. Bloch BSOS v 742]

Name: ulkā́
Description: 2362 ulkā́ f. 'meteor, fire falling from heaven' RV., 'fire-brand' ŚBr.

Name: ullasati
Description: 2375 ullasati 'shines out' BhP., 'sports' lex. 2. ullāsayati 'causes to dance' Kathās. 3. ullāsa- m. 'merriment' Kathās. 4. ullāsin- 'rejoicing'. [√las¹]

Name: ullāpayati
Description: 2376 ullāpayati 'coaxes' MārkP. [Cf. ullāpa- m. 'calling out in a loud voice, change of voice in grief or sickness', Pk. ullāva-, °lāya- m. 'noise, answer, change of voice': √lap]

Name: ullāla
Description: 2377 ullāla '*springing up or out' ('a sort of metre' lex.). [√lal]

Name: *ulluṇṭʰati
Description: 2379 *ulluṇṭhati 'rolls to and fro'. [Cf. ulluṇṭhana- 'rolling' Apte, ulluṭhati 'moves violently to and fro' lex., luṇṭhita- 'set in motion' Hariv.: √luṭh]

Name: *ullōpana
Description: 2382 *ullōpana 'taking out'. [Cf. úllupta- 'taken or drawn out' AV., ullōpam Kauś., Pa. ullumpati 'takes out, saves': √lup]

Name: uśīra
Description: 2384 uśīra m.n. 'fragrant root of the grass Andropogon muricatum' Suśr., °rī f. 'a species of grass' lex., ūrṣā-¹ f. 'Andropogon serratum'.

Name: úṣṭra
Description: 2387 úṣṭra m. 'buffalo' RV., 'camel' MBh. [Cf. uṣṭŕ̥- m. 'bull drawing a plough' RV.]

Name: uṣṇa
Description: 2390 uṣṇa² m. 'onion' lex., °ṇā- f. 'name of a plant' Nigh. [Same as uṣṇá-¹?]

Name: usrá
Description: 2399 usrá m. 'ray, sun, day', usŕ̥- f. 'morning light', usrā́- f. 'daybreak, cow' RV. [√vas³]

Name: ū́badʰya
Description: 2417 ū́badhya or ū́va° n. 'undigested grass &c. in the stomach of an animal killed for sacrifice' RV. 2. *ubbadhya-.

Name: ūrjas
Description: 2422 ūrjas n. 'vigour, strength' Sāh., ū́rj-, °jā́- f., °já- adj. RV. [√ūrj]

Name: ūrṇanā́bʰi
Description: 2423 ūrṇanā́bhi m. 'spider' TBr., °bha- m. ŚvetUp., °bhī- f. [ū́rṇā-, nā́bhi-]

Name: ūrdʰvajānu
Description: 2430 ūrdhvajānu, °uka- 'raising the knees in sitting' ŚāṅkhŚr. [ūrdhvá-, jā́nu-]

Name: ūrdʰvamukʰa
Description: 2432 ūrdhvamukha 'having the mouth turned up' Kālid. [ūrdhvá-, múkha-]

Name: ūrdʰvaśvāsa
Description: 2433 ūrdhvaśvāsa m. 'shortness of breath, asthma' Suśr. [ūrdhvá-, śvāsa-]

Name: ūrdʰvastʰiti
Description: 2435 ūrdhvasthiti f. 'standing up, horse's back, elevation' lex. [ūrdhvá-, sthíti-]

Name: *ūrṣā
Description: 2438 *ūrṣā² 'wool'. [< IE. *wlHso-, cf. Lat. vellus < *welsos, IIFL iii 3, 27 with (?): ū́rṇā-]

Name: ū́ṣa
Description: 2439 ū́ṣa m. 'salt ground' TS., ūṣā-, ūṣī- f. KātyŚr., 'salt' in ūṣapuṭá- m. 'box of salt' MaitrS.

Name: ūṣmán
Description: 2441 ūṣmán m. 'heat, steam' AV., uṣman- m., ūṣmā- f. MBh., °maka- m. lex. [√vas³]

Name: ū́hati
Description: 2444 ū́hati 'suppose' MBh. [From perf. st. of ūhḗ J. Wackernagel KZ 41, 309, pres. ṓhatē RV.: √ūh²]

Name: ŕ̩kṣa
Description: 2445 ŕ̥kṣa m. 'bear' RV., °ṣī- f. MBh., accha- m. lex.

Name: *r̩tuvanta
Description: 2454 *r̥tuvanta-, r̥tvanta- m. 'end of the (rainy?) season' Mn. [Cf. ánta r̥tū́nāṁ hēmantáḥ ŚBr.: r̥tú-, ánta-]

Name: r̩dʰáti
Description: 2457 r̥dháti (a) 'increases, prospers, succeeds' RV. 2. ŕ̥dhyati Dhātup. 3. r̥ddha-. (b) '*cooks, is cooked': 1. ŕ̥dhyati. 2. r̥ddha-. 3. *r̥ndhati (cf. r̥ṇáddhi 'increases' RV.) [P. Tedesco BSL 72, 114 (see ND 537 a 34) derives the group 'be prosperous or pleased' — Pk. rijjhaï, riddha-, &c

Name: ḗka
Description: 2462 ḗka 'one' RV. 2. Replaced by *ēkka- either with emph. doubling (as in Pk. igga-) or as MIA. loan from Sk. when single -k- was no longer a sound of the language.

Name: ēkaccʰattra
Description: 2466 ēkacchattra 'ruled by one king only' BhP. 2. With -kk-. [ḗka-, cháttra-¹]

Name: ēkatra
Description: 2468 ēkatra 'in one (with noun in loc.), in one place' Yājñ. [ḗka-]

Name: ēkabʰakta
Description: 2474 ēkabhakta n. 'eating only one meal a day' Kauś. 2. With -kk-. [ḗka-, bhakta-]

Name: *ēkāṇḍin
Description: 2484 *ēkāṇḍin, ēkāṇḍa- 'having one testicle only (of a horse)'. [ḗka-, āṇḍá-]

Name: ēkādaśá
Description: 2486 ēkādaśá², 'eleventh' RV., °śī- f. 'eleventh day of the fortnight' MBh. [ḗkādaśa¹]

Name: ēkārtʰa
Description: 2489 ēkārtha 'having the same purpose' KātyŚr., 'having the same meaning' Nir. 2. With -kk-. [ḗka-, ártha-]

Name: *ēkāhika
Description: 2492 *ēkāhika 'having interval of one day'. 2. With -kk-. [ēkāhá- m. 'ceremony lasting one day' ŚBr., 'period of one day' Pāṇ., Pa. ēkāha- m., Pk. ēgāha- m.n.: ḗka-, áhar-]

Name: ēkin
Description: 2492a †ēkin- 'consisting of one' Lāṭy., cf. ēkīya- 'belonging to one' Gr̥hyas. [ḗka-]

Name: ḗṭatē
Description: 2511 ḗṭatē 'goes' lex. [Cf. iḍvara- m. 'bull to be set at liberty' ~ itvará- 'id.' lex.?]

Name: ēḍa
Description: 2512 ēḍa m. 'a kind of sheep' KātyŚr., ēḍī- f., ēḍaka-¹ m. 'a sheep or goat', aiḍa- 'ovine' MBh., aiḍaká m. 'a kind of sheep' ŚBr., iḍikka- f. 'wild goat' lex. [← Drav. EWA i 126 with lit.]

Name: ērakā
Description: 2516 ērakā f. 'a kind of grass with emollient and diluent qualities' MBh., °kī- f. 'a species of plant'.

Name: ēraṇḍa
Description: 2517 ēraṇḍa m. 'castor-oil plant, Ricinus communis' Suśr. °ḍā- f. 'long pepper' lex. [Cf. āmaṇḍa-]

Name: ērvāru
Description: 2520 ērvāru m.f. 'Cucumis utilissimus' Yājñ., n. 'its fruit', °uka- m. Suśr., īrvāru-, ir°, ur°, irvālu- lex.

Name: ēlavālu
Description: 2521 ēlavālu-, ēlavāluka-, ēlvav°, ēlvālu-, °uka- n. 'fragrant bark of Feronia elephantum' Suśr., [Cf. ailēya- n. lex. der. ēlā- (?) and ēluka-]

Name: ēlā
Description: 2522 ēlā f. 'cardamum' Suśr. [← Drav. EWA i 561 with lit

Name: ēluka
Description: 2523 ēluka n. 'a kind of fragrant substance' Suśr. [Cf. ēlavālu-]

Name: ēṣá
Description: 2530 ēṣá¹ nom. sg. m. 'this' RV., f. ēṣā, all other cases from ēta-: n. sg. ētad, m.n. gen. sg. ētasya.

Name: aindrá
Description: 2535 aindrá 'belonging to Indra' AV., n. 'wild ginger', °drī- f. 'a kind of cucumber' lex. [índra-]

Name: *ōggara
Description: 2539 *ōggara 'gruel'. [← Turk. ögrä, ükrä, üg° 'soup' Brockelmann Mitteltürk. Wb. 235, 'vermicelli' Radloff Vergl. Wb. i 1813]

Name: *ōṭṭā
Description: 2544 *ōṭṭā 'shelter, screen'. 2. *ōttā-, which is therefore prob. not < *apagupta- or *avag°. 3. *ōḍḍā-. [Poss. further conn. with *ōḍḍh- 'dress, cover', but to be separated from forms < *apaghaṭya-, °ghāṭa-, °ghāṭayati]

Name: *ōḍḍʰ
Description: 2547 *ōḍḍh 'put on, wear, cover'. [← Drav. cf. Tam. uṭu-, Kan. uḍu- 'to dress', Tel. uḍupu 'dress' (though ac. to T. Burrow BSOAS xii 134 < *cuṭu). The forms of all languages (except Tir., see below) must or may contain -ḍḍh-: conn. therefore with váhati 'wears clothes' Mr̥cch. (vṓḍhum LM 302) is unlikely.]

Name: ōḍra
Description: 2549 ōḍra¹ m. 'a tribe of Śūdras' Mn., 'name of a people' MBh., uḍra-, auḍ°. 2. *auḍrika- 'of that people'. [S. Lévi JA 1923, 20 ff., EWA i 132]

Name: ōḍra
Description: 2550 ōḍra² m. 'the China rose, Hibiscus rosa sinensis'.

Name: ōdaná
Description: 2552 ōdaná n.m. 'grain mashed and cooked with milk' RV., 'boiled rice' Kāś. on Pāṇ. [EWA i 132: √ud²?]

Name: ōlla
Description: 2558 ōlla¹ n. 'the esculent root Arum campanulatum', ōla- n. lex., aula- n., ulla-¹ m., ullī- f. Nigh.

Name: ōṣṭʰī
Description: 2564 ōṣṭhī f. 'the plant Coccinia grandis (with the red fruit to which lips are compared)' lex. [ṓṣṭha-]

Name: augʰá
Description: 2565 aughá m. 'flood, stream' ŚBr., ōgha- m. MBh., 'quantity' MBh.

Name: audikā
Description: 2567 audikā f. adj. scil. dŕ̥ti-, °daka- MBh. 'relating to water'. [udaká-: √ud²]

Name: auṣadʰá
Description: 2571 auṣadhá 'consisting of herbs', n. 'herbs in general, a herb' ŚBr. [ṓṣadhi-]

Name: áuṣṭraka
Description: 2572 áuṣṭraka 'of a camel' Pāṇ., auṣṭra- Mn., n. 'the camel genus' W. 2. auṣṭrika- Suśr., m. 'oilmiller' MBh. [úṣṭra-]

Name: ká
Description: 2574 ká², nom. sg. m. káḥ, f. kā́, n. kím q.v., gen. sg. m.n. kásya, inst. kḗna. In nom. m.f. largely replaced by kaḥ punar and kō'paraḥ.

Name: kaṁsá
Description: 2576 kaṁsá¹ m. 'metal cup' AV., m.n. 'bell-metal' Pat. as in S., but would in Pa. Pk. and most NIA. lggs. collide with kā́ṁsya- to which L. P. testify and under which the remaining forms for the metal are listed. 2. *kaṁsikā-.

Name: kaṁsa
Description: 2577 kaṁsa² m. 'name of a king of Mathurā' MBh.

Name: *kakudiṣṭʰa
Description: 2582 *kakudiṣṭha 'on the hump'. [For formation cf. *kākutstha-: loc. sg. kakúd-, stha-]

Name: kakubʰá
Description: 2584 kakubhá 'lofty' VS., kakuhá- RV. 2. m. 'the tree Terminalia arjuna' MBh. [Cf. kakúbh- f. 'peak' RV. and *kakudha- with similar meanings]

Name: kakkaṭá
Description: 2585 kakkaṭá¹ m. 'a kind of animal (offered at sacrifice to the goddess Anumati)' VS., katkaṭá- TS.

Name: kakkōla
Description: 2586 kakkōla m. 'a species of plant with a berry the inner part of which is waxy and aromatic' R., n. 'its perfume', °aka- n. Suśr., °likā- f. 'a plant' lex. 2. takkōla- m. 'Pimenta acris' R. [Cf. kākōli- f. 'a medicinal plant' Suśr., °lī- Car., kōlaka- n. 'a kind of perfume' Bhpr.; karkōṭa- cf. esp. G. kãkoṛũ 'Myrtus pimenta'.]

Name: kákṣa
Description: 2588 kákṣa¹ m. 'armpit' RV., 'groin (?)' AV., kakṣā- f. 'armpit' Suśr. which despite EWA i 561 (correcting i 136) is to be distinguished from kakṣyāˋ- 'girdle'.

Name: kákṣa
Description: 2589 kákṣa² m. 'undergrowth' RV. (?), VS. 'dead wood' VS., 'grass' lex.

Name: *kakṣapuṭī
Description: 2591 *kakṣapuṭī, kakṣapuṭa- m. 'armpit' as title of a work. [kákṣa-¹, puṭa-]

Name: kakṣyā̀
Description: 2592 kakṣyāˋ f. 'girdle, girth' RV., kakṣyà- 'pertaining to a girdle, girded (?)' RV., 'girth' in kakṣyaprā́-; kakṣā- f. 'girdle' MBh., 'loincloth' BhP., kakṣa- m. 'girdle' MBh., 'end of lower garment, hem' BhP. both prob. with kṣ for kṣy. [kákṣa-¹]

Name: kaŋká
Description: 2595 kaṅká m. 'heron' VS. [← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 87; onomat. Mayrhofer EWA i 137. Drav. influence certain in o of M. and Si.: Tam. Kan. Mal. kokku 'crane', Tu. korṅgu, Tel. koṅga, Kuvi koṅgi, Kui kohko]

Name: kaŋkaṭa
Description: 2596 kaṅkaṭa¹ m. pl. 'name of a people' VarBr̥S.

Name: kaŋkaṇa
Description: 2597 kaṅkaṇa n. 'bracelet' MBh., °ṇī- f. 'ornament with bells' lex.

Name: káŋkata
Description: 2598 káṅkata m. 'comb' AV., n. lex., °tī-, °tikã- f. lex. 2. *kaṅkaṭa-². 3. *kaṅkaśa-. [Of doubtful IE. origin WP i 335, EWA i 137: aberrant -uta- as well as -aśa- replacing -ata- in MIA. and NIA.]

Name: kaŋkara
Description: 2601 kaṅkara¹ n. 'buttermilk mixed with water' lex. [Suggesting non-Aryan (Drav.?) source EWA i 143 groups with kaccara-¹, kaṭvará-, kaṭura-, kadvara- n. 'milk with water', kadara- n. 'a partic. milk product' lex.]

Name: *kaŋkāla
Description: 2604 *kaṅkāla² 'poor, miserable'. [Poss. same as kaṅkāla-¹ which in Pa. has a for ā, as in kaṅkara-²]

Name: kaŋku
Description: 2605 kaṅku m. 'a panic seed' VarBr̥S. 2. kaṅgu- f. 'Panicum italicum' VarBr̥S., °gū- f. lex. °guka- m., °gukā- f., gaṅkuka- m. Suśr. [A word of the Mlecchas for Aryan yava- according to Gotama Nyāya-sūtra 2, 56, quoted by Mayrhofer EWA i 138, who comparing priyáṅgu- as a pop. etymology of a form with initial p- suggests Austro-as. origin. This is further borne out by the form *ṭaṅgunī- s.v. *kaṅkunī-]

Name: *kaŋgunītaila
Description: 2608 *kaṅgunītaila 'oil made from the millet Panicum italicum'. [*kaṅkunī-, tailá-]

Name: kacu
Description: 2609 kacu f. 'the esculent root of Arum colocasia.' [Cf kacvī- f., kēcuka- m. 'Colocasia antiquorum', kēmuka-]

Name: *kacc
Description: 2610 *kacc¹ 'pull'. [Cf. kácatē 'fastens' Dhātup., kacākaci 'mutual pulling of hair' MBh., kaca- m. 'band, hem' lex., 'hair of head' Kālid., kacēla- m. 'string holding manuscript leaves together' lex.]

Name: kaccara
Description: 2615 kaccara¹ 'dirty, vile' lex. 2. *kassara-. [Sk., Pa. and Pk. have a series of somewhat similar words: kaṅkara- 'vile', kaṭvara- 'despised' which as n. subst., like kaṭura-, kadara-, kadvara- n., also mean 'whey'. Pa. kacavara- m. 'rubbish', Pk. kayavara-, kayāra- (J. Charpentier IL ii 47), kaccavāra- m.; kacchara-, kassa- m. 'mud' (LM 304)

Name: kaccʰa
Description: 2618 kaccha m. 'bank, shore, marshy ground' MBh. [Conn. with kákṣa- (EWA i 139) doubtful, but see kacchapa-]

Name: kaccʰapa
Description: 2619 kacchapa m. 'turtle, tortoise' MBh. 2. *kacchabha-. [By pop. etym. through kaccha- for kaśyápa- VS. J. Charpentier MO xxvi 110 suggested equivalence in MIA. of kassa- = kaccha- to explain creation of kacchapa- ~ kassapa-. But K. kochuwᵘ, unless a loan from Ind., points to *kakṣapa-, which would make the formation earlier.]

Name: kaccʰurá
Description: 2620 kacchurá 'affected with itch' Kāś. on Pāṇ. 2. kacchula- Mv. [kacchū́-]

Name: kaccʰū́
Description: 2621 kacchū́ f. 'itch, scab, cutaneous disease' Suśr. [Prob. like kharju-¹, khasa-¹ and poss. kaṇḍū- ← Drav. EWA i 139, 147 with lit.]

Name: kajjala
Description: 2622 kajjala n. 'lamp-black' Suśr. [← Drav. or Mu. EWA 139 with lit. Former might account for N. g-. J. Bloch BSOS v 738 puts it with kāla-¹ as ← Drav.]

Name: *kañcu
Description: 2626 *kañcu 'skin of a snake'. 2. kañcuka- m. 'corselet, jacket' R., 'snake's slough' Pañcat., 'husk' BhP. [Poss. ← Mu. Kuiper AO xvi 307, EWA i 140]

Name: kañjala
Description: 2628 kañjala m. 'the bird Gracula religiosa', kañjaka-, °jana- m. lex.; kañjara- m. 'peacock' Apte, kañjāra- m. lex.

Name: káṭa
Description: 2629 káṭa¹ m. 'twist of straw, mat' TS., káṭaka- m.n. 'twist of straw' Kād., 'bridle ring' Suśr., 'bracelet' Kālid., kaṭikā- f. 'straw mat' KātyŚr. com. [Derivation as early MIA. form of *kr̥ta-² ~ kr̥ṇátti EWA i 141 is supported by S. P. L. forms of the latter q.v. In NIA., except in G., káṭa-¹ has developed as 'ring, bracelet, chain'.]

Name: kaṭa
Description: 2631 kaṭa³ m. 'thin piece of wood, plank' lex.

Name: kaṭakaṭā
Description: 2632 kaṭakaṭā 'sound of rubbing' MBh., kaṭakaṭāpayati 'makes a grating sound' R. 2. *kaṭakka-, kaḍatkr̥ta- n. 'noise'. [Cf. kiṭakiṭāyatē, khaṭakhaṭāyatē]

Name: kaṭāha
Description: 2638 kaṭāha¹ m. 'boiler, saucepan with handles' MBh., °aka- m., °hī- f. lex.

Name: kaṭi
Description: 2639 kaṭi, °ṭī́- 'hip, buttocks' Mn., °ṭikā- f., °ṭa- 'hip' MBh. [IE. *{s}qI̊-to- WP ii 597: rather ← Drav., cf. Tam. kaḍam 'mountain side, elephant's temple', Kan. kaḍe 'side, end', Tel. kaḍa.]

Name: kaṭukarōhiṇī
Description: 2642 kaṭukarōhiṇī f. 'the plant Helleborus niger', kaṭur° Suśr., kaṭukār° Car. [kaṭú-, rṓhiṇī-]

Name: *kaṭṭa
Description: 2645 *kaṭṭa² 'young male animal'. [Cf. kaṭāha-² m. 'young male buffalo with horns just appearing' prob. ← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 368; *kaḍḍa-, *kēṭṭa-]

Name: kaṭpʰala
Description: 2649 kaṭphala m. 'the small tree Myrica sapida (of which bark and seeds are used medicinally and the fruit eaten)' Suśr. [kāphala- m. lex. sanskritized from one of the NIA. forms which depend on MIA. kapphala- and *kāipphala- or *kāyap° of unknown origin]

Name: kaṭʰiná
Description: 2650 kaṭhiná 'hard, stiff' Suśr. [EWA i 144 with lit. groups kaṭhiná-, káṭhōra-, °ōla-, kaṭhara-, kaḍḍati as ← Drav. Tam. kaṭṭu 'hardness', Tu. gaṭṭi, &c.]

Name: káṭʰōra
Description: 2651 káṭhōra 'hard, solid, stiff' BhP., 'cruel' Pañcat., °ṭhōla-, °ṭhura-, °ṭhara- 'hard, cruel' lex. [See kaṭhiná-]

Name: kaḍambá
Description: 2653 kaḍambá, kalamba-¹, m. 'end, point, stalk of a potherb' lex. [See kadambá-]

Name: kaḍambī
Description: 2654 kaḍambī f. 'the potherb Convolvulus repens', °ba- m. Car., kalambī-, °bikā-, °bū-, °bukā- f. lex. [See kadambá-]

Name: káḍāra
Description: 2655 káḍāra 'having projecting teeth' (for this meaning see H. Lüders AO xvi 131), karāla- (< *kaḷāra- J. Charpentier MO xxvi 150) 'gaping' R., 'gaping with projecting teeth' BhP., 'dreadful' MBh.

Name: kaḍēbara
Description: 2656 kaḍēbara-, °ēpara-, °ēvara- n. 'body, corpse' BHSk., kalēvara- m.n. MBh. [← Austro-as.: ka-ḍēbara- as Pk. kā-liṁba- 'body' ~ ḍimba-² EWA i 182 with lit. But cf. kaṭa- 'corpse' lex. ← Tam. kaḍam 'body']

Name: káṇa
Description: 2661 káṇa m. 'a grain of corn' AV., 'drop (of water)' Kāv., kaṇikā- f. 'a single grain' MBh.

Name: kaṇika
Description: 2665 kaṇika m. 'grain' BhP., 'meal of parched wheat' lex

Name: kaṇṭa
Description: 2668 kaṇṭa¹ m. 'thorn' BhP. 2. káṇṭaka- m. 'thorn' ŚBr., 'anything pointed' R.

Name: kaṇṭakāra
Description: 2672 kaṇṭakāra m. 'name of a plant' lex., °rī- f. 'Solanum jacquini' Suśr., 'Bombax heptaphyllum, Flacourtia sapida' lex., °raka- m. 'Solanum jacquini' lex., °rikā- f. Suśr. [kaṇṭa-¹]

Name: kaṇṭapʰala
Description: 2675 kaṇṭaphala m. 'name of various trees, the bread-fruit or jack-fruit tree' lex. [Cf. kaṇṭakāla-: kaṇṭa-¹, phála-¹?]

Name: kaṇṭala
Description: 2676 kaṇṭala m. 'the thorny tree Mimosa arabica which yields gum arabic' lex. [kaṇṭa-¹]

Name: *kaṇṭavēlli
Description: 2677 *kaṇṭavēlli 'a thorny creeper', cf. kaṇṭavalli- f. 'Acacia concinna' lex. [kaṇṭa-¹, vēlli-]

Name: kaṇṭʰá
Description: 2680 kaṇṭhá m. (a) 'throat, neck' ŚBr. (b) 'narrowest part of a hole' Suśr. (c) 'voice' MBh., 'sound' W. (d) '*border, immediate proximity' Pañcat.

Name: kaṇṭʰamaṇi
Description: 2682 kaṇṭhamaṇi m. 'jewel worn on neck' lex. [kaṇṭhá-, máṇi-¹]

Name: káṇḍati
Description: 2684 káṇḍati² 'is glad' Dhātup. [Cf. kaḍati 'is intoxicated' Dhātup.: ← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 369: √kaṇḍ²]

Name: kaṇḍana
Description: 2685 kaṇḍana n. 'separating chaff from grain in a mortar, chaff' Suśr. [√kaṇḍ¹]

Name: kaṇḍū
Description: 2688 kaṇḍū f. 'itching, the itch' Suśr., °ḍūti- f. 'sexual desire in women', °ḍūyā- f. 'itching' Suśr. com. [← Drav. or Austro-as. see kacchū́-]

Name: kaṇḍūla
Description: 2690 kaṇḍūla 'having a desire to scratch, itchy' Uttarar. [kaṇḍū-]

Name: kataka
Description: 2691 kataka m. 'the clearing nut Strychnos potatorum' Mn.

Name: katīmuṣa
Description: 2697 katīmuṣa 'name of a place in Kashmir' Rājat.

Name: *kattara
Description: 2698 *kattara 'useless, old, rubbish'. 2. *kattavāra-. [Just poss. comparative of kad pejorative prefix Pāṇ.; but cf. *katta- 'dregs', kaccara-¹ 'dirty' with same formation in Pk. kaccavāra- as 2 above; and Sk. kātara-]

Name: katʰā́
Description: 2704 kathā́ 'conversation, speech' ĀśvGr̥., 'story' MBh. [Subst. formed of kathā́ 'how, why?' RV. EWA i 149: √kath]

Name: katʰānaka
Description: 2705 kathānaka n. 'a little tale' Vet. [kathā́-, katháyati X vyākhyā́na-: √kath]

Name: katʰyatē
Description: 2708 kathyatē 'is called' Pañcat., kathya- 'to be spoken about' R. [√kath]

Name: kadambá
Description: 2710 kadambá m. 'the tree Nauclea cadamba' MBh., °baka-, °bada-, kalamba-, °baka- m. lex. [EWA i 144 groups kadambá-, kaḍambá-, kaḍambī- as ← Drav. Tam. kaṭampu, &c.: T. Burrow BSOAS xii 369]

Name: kadara
Description: 2710a †kadara- m.n. 'corn or callosity on foot' Suśr.

Name: *kadarikā
Description: 2711 *kadarikā-, kadara- m. 'iron goad for guiding an elephant' lex.

Name: kadala
Description: 2712 kadala m., °lī́- f. 'the banana plant Musa sapientum', °la- n. 'its fruit' MBh. Suśr., °lā- f., °laka- m., °likā- f. lex. 2. *kaḍalī-. [← Austro-as. EWA i 150 with lit. In S. it collides with kētaka-]

Name: kantʰā
Description: 2720 kanthā¹ f. 'wall, town' lex., -kántha- n. in cmpd. 'town' Pāṇ. [← Ir. EWA i 151 with lit. Coincides with kaṇṭhá- in meanings 'wall, border, bank']

Name: kanda
Description: 2723 kanda m. 'bulbous root' MBh., n. 'garlic' lex. [Prob. with gaṇḍa-¹ ← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 369 and EWA i 152 with lit.]

Name: kandará
Description: 2724 kandará n. 'cave, glen' R., m. lex., °rī́- f.

Name: kandúka
Description: 2727 kandúka m. 'ball of wood or pith to play with' MBh., n. 'cushion' Bhartr̥. [With gēnduka- q.v. ← Drav.]

Name: kandūraka
Description: 2729 kandūraka m. 'a kind of fragrant substance' lex. [Cf. kunduru-]

Name: kandʰara
Description: 2730 kandhara m. 'neck' Yājñ. [A. Master BSOAS xii 352 ← Drav. cf. Tel. kandamu 'neck'; but see kaṇṭhá-]

Name: kanyakubja
Description: 2733 kanyakubja n. 'name of a town' (= Κανογυζα), kān° MBh., kanyāk° lex. [kanya-, kubjá-]

Name: kaparda
Description: 2740 kaparda m. 'a small shell' lex., °daka- m., °dikā- f. 'cowrie' Hit. [← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 370]

Name: kapardín
Description: 2742 kapardín 'having braided hair' RV., '*having or wearing or like or worth cowries'. [kaparda-]

Name: kapala
Description: 2743 kapala n. 'part, half' ŚāṅkhŚr. [Cf. kapaṭī- f. 'measure equal to a double handful'; prob. to be separated from kavala-, but see EWA i 154-5 with lit.]

Name: kapā́la
Description: 2744 kapā́la n. 'skull, cranium' AV., 'cup, jar, bowl' TS., 'beggar's bowl' Mn., kapālikā- f. 'sherd' Kauś. 2. *kapalla-. 3. *kabhalla- beside bhágāla- PārGr̥. 4. *kappāla-. [Although IE. (cf. OEng. hafola 'head') EWA i 155, the variant MIA. and NIA. forms suggest at least influence by Austro-as. ND 73 b 27]

Name: kapi
Description: 2747 kapi² m. 'Emblica officinalis, a species of the tree Pongamia glabra, olibanum' lex., kapikā- f. 'Vitex negundo' lex.

Name: kapikaccʰū
Description: 2748 kapikacchū f. 'the plant Mucuna pruritus' VarBr̥S., °chu-, °churā- f. lex. [kapí-¹, kacchū́-]

Name: kapittʰa
Description: 2749 kapittha m. 'the tree Feronia elephantum', n. 'its fruit the wood-apple' MBh. [For ending cf. dadhittha- m. 'id.' Gobh.; aśvatthá-, kulattha-, and for variation in MIA. and NIA. tth ~ ṭṭh cf. aśvatthá- in Si.: prob. only in pop. etym. connexion with kapí-¹, see EWA i 155]

Name: kapilá
Description: 2750 kapilá 'brown, tawny, reddish' RV., kapilaka-, °iraka- 'reddish' Pāṇ., kabila- lex. [Cf. kapiśa- 'brown' MBh.: for relationship 'monkey ~ brown' cf. G. mākṛũ s.v. markaṭa-, N. lākhu s.v. lākṣā-: kapí-¹]

Name: kapiśīrṣa
Description: 2751 kapiśīrṣa n. 'the upper coping of a wall' lex. [kapí-¹, śīrśá-]

Name: kapīta
Description: 2752 kapīta m. 'name of a tree', °aka- n. 'Berberis asiatica' Bhpr.

Name: kapṓta
Description: 2753 kapṓta m. 'pigeon, dove' RV., °aka- m. 'small do.' MBh.

Name: kapōlá
Description: 2755 kapōlá m. 'cheek' Yājñ. 2. *kappōla-. [Prob. ← Austro-as., poss. ← Drav. EWA i 158 with lit.]

Name: kapʰōṇi
Description: 2757 kaphōṇi m.f. 'elbow', kaphaṇi- m.f., kuphaṇī- f. lex. [Cf. kaphauḍá- m. '(prob.) elbow' AV., and kūrpara-: EWA i 255 with PMWS 44 ← Munda rather than ← Drav. with Burrow TPS 1945, 96]

Name: kabandʰa
Description: 2758 kabandha-, kav° m. 'headless trunk' R. [EWA i 158 same as kábandha-, káv° m. 'big barrel' RV., 'belly' Nir., but perh. with Austro-as. prefix conn. with group of baṇḍá- PMWS 100]

Name: *kabbu
Description: 2759 *kabbu 'feeble, yielding'. [Cf. kambuka- m. 'mean person' lex., °bū- m. 'thief' W., poss., with semantic equivalence 'chaff ~ worthless', same as kábru- n., kambū́ka- m. 'husk of rice' AV.]

Name: kamaṭʰa
Description: 2760 kamaṭha m. 'bamboo' lex. 2. *kāmaṭha-. 3. *kāmāṭṭha-. 4. *kammaṭha-. 5. *kammaṭṭha-. 6. *kambāṭha-. 7. *kambiṭṭha-. [Cf. kambi- 'shoot of bamboo', kārmuka-² n. 'bow' Mn., 'bamboo' lex. which may therefore belong here rather than to kr̥múka-. Certainly ← Austro-as. PMWS 33 with lit

Name: kamaṇḍalu
Description: 2761 kamaṇḍalu¹ m.n. 'gourd or other vessel used for water' MBh.

Name: kamala
Description: 2764 kamala² n. 'lotus' R. [Like kavāra-, kavēla- n. lex., kuvalaya- n. MBh. and Pk. kalima- n. ← Drav. EWA i 160]

Name: kambalá
Description: 2771 kambalá¹ m.n. 'woollen blanket or upper garment' AV., °laka- m. 'a woollen cloth' Suśr., °likā- f. Pāṇ. [If ← Austro-as. (EWA i 161 with lit) perh. cf. also ámbara-, in Pa. once ambala-]

Name: kambi
Description: 2774 kambi f. 'branch or shoot of bamboo' lex. [See kamaṭha-]

Name: kambu
Description: 2775 kambu m. 'shell, conch, shell ring or bracelet' MBh., n. 'bracelet' lex., °uka- m. 'shell' lex. [Cf. śambu-]

Name: kara
Description: 2780 kara² m. 'tax, tribute' Mn. [kāra-⁷ m. 'tax' Pāṇ.: ← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 88; EWA i 166]

Name: karaŋka
Description: 2784 karaṅka m. 'skull, head' Kathās., 'any bone of the body' lex.

Name: kárañja
Description: 2785 kárañja m. 'the tree Pongamia glabra' RV. (?) Āp., °jaka- m., °jikā- f. MBh., karaja- m. lex.

Name: karaṭa
Description: 2787 karaṭa¹ m. 'crow' BhP., °aka- m. lex. [Cf. karaṭu-, karkaṭu- m. 'Numidian crane', karēṭu-, °ēṭavya-, °ēḍuka- m. lex., karaṇḍa²- m. 'duck' lex: see kāraṇḍava-]

Name: karaṇīya
Description: 2791 karaṇīya 'to be done' MBh. [Cf. karaṇi- f. 'action' Bālar., Pk. karaṇi- f.: √kr̥¹]

Name: karapattra
Description: 2795 karapattra n. 'saw' Suśr., °aka- n. lex. 2. *karaparṇa-. [By pop. etym. from kará¹- and páttra- (and parṇá-) EWA i 164 who connects with krakaca-, krakara-, Pa. khara-, Pk. karakaya- 'saw' perh. ← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 96]

Name: karapāla
Description: 2796 karapāla m. 'sword', °aka- m., °ikā- f. lex., karavāla-, °aka-, karabāla- m. [At least by pop. etym. from kará-¹, pālá- cf. *bhujapāla EWA i 165]

Name: karabʰá
Description: 2797 karabhá m. 'camel' MBh., 'young camel' Pañcat., 'young elephant' BhP. 2. kalabhá- 'young elephant or camel' Pañcat. [Poss. a non-aryan kar- 'elephant' also in karḗṇu-, karin- EWA i 165]

Name: karamarda
Description: 2799 karamarda m. 'the tree Carissa carandas' MBh., °aka- m. 'the tree', n. 'its fruit' Suśr., °mardī- f. lex. 2. *karamārja-. [Cf. kāsamarda- ~ *kāsamārja-]

Name: karavīra
Description: 2800 karavīra m. 'oleander, Nerium odorum' MBh. 2. karṇikāra- m. 'Pterospermum acerifolium' MBh., kaṇēra- m. lex. 3. karṇāṭī- f. 'a kind of mimosa'. [Three forms of a word for 'oleander' all prob., like karavīra- (T. Burrow BSOAS xii 370) ← Drav., cf. esp. Tam. kaṇaviram, Kan. kaṇagil, Tel. gannēru. See karī́ra-²]

Name: karī́ra
Description: 2805 karī́ra² (Uṇ. ká°) m. 'Capparis aphylla (a thorny plant eaten by camels)' ŚBr., n. 'its fruit' Suśr. 2. karibha- m. 'Ficus religiosa (?)' lex. [Same as karīra-¹?]

Name: kárīṣa
Description: 2806 kárīṣa¹ m.n. 'dung, dried cowdung, rubbish' ŚBr. [Bec. of ākhukarīṣá- 'mole-hill' EWA i 167 connects with kiráti rather than IE. *qers 'dirty' of WP i 428, but NIA. forms mean 'cowdung': for suffix cf. esp. púrīṣa-

Name: *karīṣa
Description: 2807 *karīṣa² 'a measure of land'. [Same as kárīṣa-¹, lit. 'the amount of manure required'?]

Name: karḗṇu
Description: 2812 karḗṇu m. 'elephant' MBh., °ṇu- or °ṇū- f. MBh., °ṇukā- f. Pañcat. [Feminine is earlier if, with J. Charpentier IL ii 67, < *kaṇēru- (after kariṇī-) < pejorative ka- and *ṇēru- 'tusk' in Pa. rēruka- 'ivory', i.e. 'having no or poor tusks'. But rather with EAW i 168 connected with kar- in karabhá-.]

Name: karōṭi
Description: 2813 karōṭi f. 'cup, skull' Rājat., °ṭa- m. lex. 2. *karōṭṭi- [Prob. ← Drav. Mal. kuraṭṭa, Tu. koraṇṭu 'nut', Kan. karaṭa 'coconut shell', Tam. ciraṭṭai 'coconut shell, begging bowl' T. Burrow TPS 1945, 88]

Name: karká
Description: 2815 karká 'white' AV., m. 'white horse' MBh., 'a partic. gem' lex.

Name: karkaṭa
Description: 2816 karkaṭa¹ 'crab', °ṭaka- m. Suśr., °ṭī- f. MBh. [karka-² m. 'crab' lex.: comparison with gāṅgaṭa-, ciṅgaṭa-, *jhiṅga- suggests non-Aryan origin (cf. Sant. kaṭko̱m 'crab') and reinforces doubt expressed in EWA i 169 of generally accepted connexion with Lat. cancer, &c.]

Name: karkaṭa
Description: 2817 karkaṭa² m. 'name of various plants, curved root of a plant' lex., °ṭī- f. 'Cucumis utilissimus', °ṭaka- m. 'a kind of plant', n. 'a poisonous plant', °ṭikā- f. 'a kind of plant' Suśr. [Poss. same as karkaṭa-¹, but cf. karkāru-]

Name: karkaṭaśr̩ŋgī
Description: 2818 karkaṭaśr̥ṅgī-, °gikā- f. 'gallnut (formed by an excrescence on Rhus succedana)' Suśr. [karkaṭa-¹, śŕ̥ṅga-]

Name: karkara
Description: 2819 karkara¹ 'hard, firm' Mālatīm. [Prob. same as karkara-²; cf. karkaśá-, kakkhaṭa-, *kakkaṭa-², khára-²]

Name: karkara
Description: 2820 karkara² m.n. 'stone', m. 'bone' lex. [Prob. same as karkara-¹: for semant. development 'ice ~ hail ~ stone' cf. aśáni-, úpala-]

Name: karkaśá
Description: 2822 karkaśá 'rough, hard' MBh., °śā- f. 'name of a thorny shrub'. 2. *khakkhaśa-. [Cf. karkara-¹, kakkhaṭa-]

Name: karkāru
Description: 2823 karkāru-, °uka- m. 'the gourd Beninkasa cerifera' Suśr., °ru- n. 'its fruit' lex. [Cf. karkaṭa-²]

Name: karkōṭa
Description: 2825 karkōṭa n. 'a partic. fruit' Suśr., °aká- m. 'Momordica mixta', n. 'its fruit' Suśr., 'Aegle marmelos' lex., °akī- f. 'a plant with yellow flowers' Car., °ṭikā- f. 'Momordica mixta'. [See kakkōla-]

Name: *karkṣī
Description: 2826 *karkṣī 'accursed she-bear'. [For pejorative kā- with animals cf. Shughni xūrn 'crow' < *ku-warana- and Lith. kóvarnis 'raven' beside várna 'crow': kā- or ka-³, r̥kṣī-]

Name: karcarī
Description: 2827 karcarī f. 'a medicinal substance' Bhpr., °rikā- f. 'a kind of pastry or cake'. [Cf. karcūṭikā- f. 'a kind of pastry' lex.]

Name: karcūra
Description: 2828 karcūra '*yellow', m. 'turmeric' lex., n. 'an orpiment' Śiś., 'gold' lex., °aka- m. 'turmeric' lex. [Cf. karpūraka- and karbūra- m. 'Curcuma amhaldi or zerumbet, yellow orpiment', n. 'gold' lex.; karbura-]

Name: kárṇa
Description: 2830 kárṇa m. 'ear, handle of a vessel' RV., 'end, tip (?)' RV. ii 34, 3. [Cf. *kāra- ⁶]

Name: kárṇaka
Description: 2831 kárṇaka m. 'projection on the side of a vessel, handle' ŚBr. [kárṇa-]

Name: karṇakaṇḍū
Description: 2832 karṇakaṇḍū f. 'painful itching of the ear' Suśr. [kárṇa-, kaṇḍū-]

Name: karṇapattraka
Description: 2837 karṇapattraka m. 'lobe of the ear' Yājñ. [kárṇa-, páttra-]

Name: *karṇamarda
Description: 2840 *karṇamarda 'touching the ears as a sign of disgrace or repentance'. [Semant. cf. H. kān pakaṛnā: kárṇa-, marda-]

Name: karṇamūla
Description: 2841 karṇamūla n. 'root of the ear' Suśr. [kárṇa-, mū́la-]

Name: karṇavēdʰa
Description: 2843 karṇavēdha m. 'ceremony of piercing the ears' lex. [kárṇa-, vēdha-]

Name: karṇāṭa
Description: 2848 karṇāṭa-, °aka- m. 'name of a people' MBh., kārṇāṭa-bhāṣā- 'the Kanarese language' MW. [NIA. forms < kārṇāṭa- which supports interpretation as 'black country' (EWA i 172) and connexion with kāla-¹]

Name: kárṇikā
Description: 2849 kárṇikā f. 'round protuberance' Suśr., 'pericarp of a lotus' MBh., 'ear-ring' Kathās. [kárṇa-]

Name: kartá
Description: 2851 kartá¹ m. 'hole' RV. [Cf. kāṭá- m. 'hole' RV., gárta-, *gaḍḍa-¹, *gaḍḍ-¹-, gaḍa-¹, *gallī-, *gālī-, *galī-, *khaḍḍa-, *khāḍa-, khalla-², *khāla-, *khala-³

Name: kártati
Description: 2854 kártati¹ 'cuts' Ep. [Later pres. formation from aor. subj., fut., &c. replacing kr̥ntáti¹: with wide extension of MIA. kaṭṭ- to distinguish from katt- 'spin' < *kartati²: √kr̥t¹]

Name: kartari
Description: 2858 kartari f. 'scissors, knife' Suśr., °rī- f. lex., °rikā- f. Hit. [< karttrī-

Name: karda

[See kardaṭa-, kardáma-, *gadda-¹ (also Pk. gatta-, geḍḍa-), *gāḍa-²: this interchange suggests a non-Aryan origin independent of, or at most influencing, an IE. origin (Pers. čardeh 'blackish', &c. EWA i 173, Pokorny IEW 573). Connexion with kartá-¹ and *gaḍḍa- cannot be ruled out.]

Name: kardáma
Description: 2869 kardáma-, ká° m. 'mud, mire' KātyŚrS., kardamá- 'muddy' Pāṇ. [See list s.v. karda-]

Name: karpaṭa
Description: 2871 karpaṭa n. 'patched garment, rag' Pañcat. [← Austro-as. prefixed form of paṭa- of which -pāsa- in karpā́sa- is dial. form J. Przyluski BSL xxv 70, EWA i 174]

Name: *karpaṭamr̩ttikā
Description: 2874 *karpaṭamr̥ttikā 'wrapping in cloth and clay'. [karpaṭa-, mŕ̥ttikā-: cf. mod. cmpds. H. kapaṛmiṭṭī, M. kapaḍlep]

Name: karpā́sa
Description: 2877 karpā́sa m. 'the cotton plant Gosypium herbaceum' Suśr., n. 'cotton', °sī- f. 'the plant'. lex, °sakī- f. Bhpr. [← Austro-as. and perh. related to karpaṭa- EAW i 174 with lit.]

Name: karpū́ra
Description: 2880 karpū́ra m.n. 'camphor' Suśr. [Prob. ← Austro-as. EWA i 75 with lit.]

Name: karpūraka
Description: 2881 karpūraka m. 'Curcuma zerumbet'. [From karbūra- or karcūra- after karpū́ra-, cf. P. kapūrī 'yellow' above]

Name: karbará
