Name: *karbarāŋga
Description: 2883 *karbarāṅga 'having a spotted body'. [Cf. karburāṅga- m. 'a species of fly or bee' lex.: karbará-, áṅga-]

Name: karmakara
Description: 2887 karmakara m. 'workman, hired labourer' MBh. [Cf. karmakāra- from which it cannot in all cases be distinguished: kárman-¹, kará-¹]

Name: karmakāra
Description: 2888 karmakāra 'doing work without wages' Kāś. on Pāṇ., °aka- m. 'one who does any work'. 2. karmakārin- 'doing any work'. [Cf. karmakara-

Name: karmakārāpayati
Description: 2889 karmakārāpayati 'causes to work as a servant' SaddhP. [karmakāra-]

Name: *karmakāṣṭʰikā
Description: 2890 *karmakāṣṭhikā 'using a stick to make work'. [kárman-¹, kāṣṭhá-]

Name: karmakŕ̩t
Description: 2891 karmakŕ̥t 'performing work, skilful in work' AV., 'one who has done any work' Pāṇ., m. 'workman' Rājat. [kárman-¹, kr̥t-]

Name: karmaraŋga
Description: 2895 karmaraṅga m. 'Averrhoa carambola' R. [Cf. karmara-, °aka-, karmāra-, °aka- m. 'the plant' lex., karmaphala- n. 'its fruit' lex.]

Name: karmā́ra
Description: 2898 karmā́ra m. 'blacksmith' RV. [EWA i 176 < stem *karmar- ~ karman-, but perh. with ODBL 668 ← Drav. cf. Tam. karumā 'smith, smelter' whence meaning 'smith' was transferred also to karmakāra-]

Name: karmī́ṇa
Description: 2902 karmī́ṇa 'competent' in anuṣṭúp-karmī́ṇa- 'being performed with an a° verse' ŚBr., alaṁ-k° 'competent for any work' Pāṇ. [kárman-¹]

Name: *karyatē
Description: 2903 *karyatē 'is done'. [Formed after act. karṓti and pass. caus. kāryatē: √kr̥¹]

Name: karṣaṇa
Description: 2907 karṣaṇa n. 'tugging, ploughing, hurting' Mn., 'cultivated land' MBh. [kárṣati, √kr̥ṣ]

Name: kálatē
Description: 2914 kálatē 'sounds' Dhātup., kalayati³ 'makes a murmurous sound', kalakala- m. 'indistinct sound' Śiś. [kal³]

Name: kálatra
Description: 2915 kálatra n. 'pudendum muliebre' lex., 'wife' MBh., 'family' BHSk., káḍatra- Uṇ. BHSk.

Name: kaláyati
Description: 2918 kaláyati¹ 'counts, thinks' Śiś., kálatē Dhātup. [Cf. kāláyati 'counts, tells over' MBh. Like kalā́-² ← Drav. e.g. Tam. Kan. kal-, Tel. Gondi kar- 'to learn' EWA i 180 with lit.: √kal¹]

Name: kalahaṁsa
Description: 2923 kalahaṁsa m. 'a species of goose' MBh., °aka- m. Kād. [kala- (?), haṁsá-]

Name: kalā́
Description: 2927 kalā́² f. 'any practical art' R. [← Drav. see kaláyati¹: √kal¹]

Name: kalāpa
Description: 2931 kalāpa m. 'bundle, quiver of arrows' MBh., 'rope round an elephant's neck' lex., °aka- m. MBh. 2. kalamba-³ n. 'crowd' lex. [Cf. *kaḍappa- which supports deriv. from Drav. (Kan. kalappu 'miscellaneous collection' &c. T.Burrow BSOAS xii 371)]

Name: káli
Description: 2933 káli¹ m. 'the losing die with one dot' AV., 'the iron age' AitBr., 'strife, quarrel' MBh.

Name: kaliŋga
Description: 2935 kaliṅga¹ m. 'a warrior tribe in Coromandel' MBh.

Name: kaliŋga
Description: 2937 kaliṅga³ m. 'Wrightia antidysenterica' lex., n. 'its seed' Suśr., °aka- m. Car., kāliṅga-³ m. lex.

Name: kaliyuga
Description: 2938 kaliyuga n. 'the present or Iron Age' Mn. [káli-¹, yugá-]

Name: kalká
Description: 2939 kalká m. (n. lex.) 'viscous sediment' Yājñ., 'dirt' lex., 'impurity, sin' MBh. [Various aberrant suffixes- -u-, -ṭa-, -bba-, -vva-, -mma-]

Name: kálpa
Description: 2941 kálpa 'capable' ŚBr., m. 'rule, practice' RV., 'an age' MBh. 2. *karpa-. [√kI̊p]

Name: kalpana
Description: 2943 kalpana n. 'cutting' VarBr̥S., °nā- f. 'arranging' Mn., 'making' Suśr., °nī- f. 'scissors' lex., karpaṇa- n. 'weapon' Daś. [√kI̊p]

Name: kalpáyati
Description: 2944 kalpáyati 'sets in order' RV., 'trims, cuts' VarBr̥S. [Cf. kr̥pāṇa- m. 'knife' Pāṇ.: √kI̊p]

Name: kalmaṣa
Description: 2946 kalmaṣa n. 'stain, dregs, sin' Mn., karmaṣa- Kāś. [Cf. kalmā́ṣa- and kaśmalá- 'dirty' lex., m.n. 'despair' MBh.]

Name: kalmā́ṣa
Description: 2947 kalmā́ṣa 'variegated, spotted' VS., n. 'stain' ŚBr., m. 'variegated colour' lex. [Cf. kalmaṣa-]

Name: kalya
Description: 2949 kalya² 'deaf and dumb', kalla- 'deaf' lex., 'stammering' BHS 174. [kaḍá- 'dumb' ŚBr., kala- 'indistinct, dumb' ChUp.: √kal³]

Name: kalya
Description: 2950 kalya⁴ n., °yā- f. 'spirituous liquor' lex. [Cf. kaḍaṅga- m. 'id.', kalukkā- f. 'tavern': ← Drav. see kaṇḍati²]

Name: kalyapāla
Description: 2951 kalyapāla-, °yāp° m. 'distiller of spirituous liquor' Rājat. [Some NIA. forms < *kallāla- from which kalyapāla- is an IA. creation: kalya-⁴, pālá-]

Name: kalyāṇī
Description: 2953 kalyāṇī f. 'name of a river in Ceylon' MW. [kalyā́ṇa-]

Name: kallōla
Description: 2955 kallōla m. 'wave' Bhartr̥., 'gambol' lex. [← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 82]

Name: kávaca
Description: 2957 kávaca m.n. 'coat of mail' ŚBr., 'jacket' Kāṭh. [kavása- m. 'id.', kaváṣa- m. 'shield' lex.: ← Drav. EWA i 186 with lit.]

Name: kavala
Description: 2960 kavala m. 'mouthful' MBh., 'gargle' Suśr., kavaḍa- m. Suśr., kabaḍa-, kapaḍa- Lüders PhilInd 559. [NIA. forms except Paś. can all derive from *kab/pala-: like kavaka- prob. ← Drav. e.g. Tam. kavaḷam, °ar̤am 'morsel of food', kavvu 'to bite' T. Burrow TPS 1945, 91]

Name: kavāṭa
Description: 2963 kavāṭa m.n., °ṭī- f. 'leaf of a door', kapāṭa-, °ṭaka- m., °ṭikā- f. MBh., kavaṭī- f. lex. [Cf. kaváṣa- 'opened (of the legs)' AitBr., kaváṣ- 'open (of the leaves of a door)' VS.: perh. ← Drav. EWA i 187 with lit.]

Name: kaví
Description: 2964 kaví 'wise' RV., m. 'wise man, poet' RV., °ika- m. lex.

Name: káśā
Description: 2965 káśā f. 'whip' RV., 'rein' Śiś., 'string' lex., kaśa- m. 'whip, thong' MBh.

Name: kaśēru
Description: 2966 kaśēru n., °rū- f., °ruka- m., kas° 'root of Scirpus kysoor'.

Name: káścid
Description: 2967 káścid 'some one, anyone' RV., m.pl. kḗcid, n. kíṁcid q.v. Partially collides with kṓ'pi. [ká-²]

Name: kaśyápa
Description: 2969 kaśyápa² m. nom. prop. RV., 'class of divine beings associated with Prajāpati; of semi-divine genii regulating the course of the sun' AV., 'name of a mythical r̥ṣi' VS.

Name: kaṣati
Description: 2972 kaṣati 'scratches' ChUp., 'rubs on a touchstone' Pāṇ. com., káṣ° 'hurts' Dhātup. [See khasa-¹: √kaṣ]

Name: kaṣāya
Description: 2974 kaṣāya 'yellowish red, astringent' Yājñ., n. 'an astringent juice' ŚBr. 2. *kaṣāva-. 3. *kaṣāra-. [Cf. Pa. kasaṭa- 'bitter, bad'. Variety of suffix (though -va- may be the colour suffix seen in śyāvá-) points to nonAryan origin]

Name: kaṣāyin
Description: 2977 kaṣāyin 'yielding a resinous exhudation, astringent, dyed red' W. [kaṣāya-]

Name: kaṣṭá
Description: 2978 kaṣṭá 'bad, difficult' Mn., 'dangerous' Pāṇ., n. 'bad state of affairs, fatigue' R.

Name: *kastambʰa
Description: 2983 *kastambha 'small stem'. [kastambhī́- f. 'prop for supporting carriage-pole' ŚBr.: ka-³, stambha-]

Name: kahlāra
Description: 2986 kahlāra-, kalhā° n. 'white esculent water lily Nymphaea lotus' MBh. [Mth. with divergent ṛ supports non-Aryan origin EWA i 185]

Name: kā́ṁsya
Description: 2987 kā́ṁsya 'made of bell-metal' KātyŚr., n. 'bell-metal' Yājñ., 'cup of bell-metal' MBh., °aka- n. 'bell-metal'. 2. *kāṁsiya-. [kaṁsá-¹]

Name: kāṁsyakāra
Description: 2989 kāṁsyakāra m. 'worker in bell-metal or brass' Yājñ. com., kaṁsakāra- m. BrahmavP. [kā́ṁsya-, kāra-¹]

Name: kā́ka
Description: 2993 kā́ka m. 'crow' Mn., °kī- f. Pāṇ. [kākōla- m. 'raven' Mn., kākāla- m. Vet. Onom. cf. kākākr̥t- 'cawing' MBh

Name: kākaciñcā
Description: 2994 kākaciñcā-, °ñcī- f. 'Abrus precatorius'. [Many various forms: see EWA i 192]

Name: *kākutstʰa
Description: 2996 *kākutstha 'on the top of the head', kākúd- f. 'palate' RV, kākubh- Naigh. [For semant. change 'top of head ~ palate' see tā́lu-, mūrdhán-: kakúd-, stha-]

Name: kākōli
Description: 2997 kākōli f. 'a partic. medicinal plant' Suśr., °lī- f. Car. [Cf. kakkōla-]

Name: *kākka
Description: 2998 *kākka 'senior male relative'. [← Drav.: Kan. kakka 'uncle', Tel. kakka 'daddy', Mal. kākke 'mother's brother']

Name: kāgni
Description: 2999 kāgni m. 'a small fire' Vop. [ka-³ or kā-, agní-]

Name: *kāŋkunikā
Description: 3001 *kāṅkunikā f. 'a woman who lives on panic seed'. [*kaṅkunī-]

Name: *kāŋgārikā
Description: 3006 *kāṅgārikā 'poor or small brazier'. [Cf. kāgni- m. 'a small fire' Vop.: ka-³ or kā-, aṅgāri-]

Name: kāca
Description: 3009 kāca³ m. 'loop, string fastened to both ends of a pole, carrying yoke' lex. [← Drav. Kui kāsa, Kuvi kāñju, Kan. kāgaḍi, kāvaḍi T. Burrow BSOAS xii 372, EWA i 195. See kamaṭha-]

Name: kāñcanaka
Description: 3014 kāñcanaka m. 'the tree Bauhinia variegata' lex. 2. kāñcanāra- m. lex.

Name: kāñjika
Description: 3016 kāñjika n. 'sour rice gruel' Suśr., °jī- f., °jīka- n., kāñcika- n. lex. [← Drav. EWA i 195 with lit.]

Name: kā́ṇḍa
Description: 3023 kā́ṇḍa (kāṇḍá- TS.) m.n. 'single joint of a plant' AV., 'arrow' MBh., 'cluster, heap' (in tr̥ṇa-kāṇḍa- Pāṇ. Kāś.). [Poss. connexion with gaṇḍa-² makes prob. non-Aryan origin (not with P. Tedesco Language 22, 190 < kr̥ntáti). Prob. ← Drav., cf. Tam. kaṇ 'joint of bamboo or sugarcane' EWA i 197]

Name: kātara
Description: 3027 kātara 'confused, discouraged, cowardly' Mn. 2. *kāthala-. [Der. from katará- EWA i 197; but cf. kattara-, i.e. it may belong to a group of words meaning 'weak, &c.']

Name: kānana
Description: 3028 kānana n. 'forest' R. [With kāntāra- ← Drav. EWA i 198 with lit.]

Name: kānta
Description: 3029 kānta¹ 'loved, charming', m. 'lover, husband', °tā- f. 'mistress, wife' R. [√kam]

Name: kāntā
Description: 3030 kāntā f. 'name of various plants, large cardamom' lex., °ta- m. 'Barringtonia acutangula'.

Name: kāntāraka
Description: 3032 kāntāraka m. 'a kind of sugarcane', °ra- m. Suśr.

Name: kāpaṭa
Description: 3037 kāpaṭa 'fraudulent' VarBr̥S. [Forms of G. < *kāpa- with -ṭa-, -la-, -ta- (or -ka-), -tra-. Cf. Sk. Pa. kapaṭa- m.n. 'fraud', Pk. kavaḍa- n.: prob. ← Drav. cf. kūṭá-¹ T. Burrow BSOAS xii 370]

Name: kā́pittʰa
Description: 3040 kā́pittha 'relating to the wood-apple tree Feronia elephantum' Pāṇ. [kapittha-]

Name: kā́pōta
Description: 3041 kā́pōta 'pertaining to pigeons' MBh., 'dull white, grey' VarBr̥S. [kapṓta-]

Name: kāmarūpa
Description: 3043 kāmarūpa m. 'name of a people in West Assam' Kālid.

Name: kāmpīla
Description: 3046 kāmpīla¹ m. 'name of a plant' Kauś., °pilya-, °pilla- m. lex., kampīla- n. 'pigment from Rottleria tinctoria' lex., kampilya- m. lex., °aka-, °pilvaka- m. Car., °pilla-, °aka- m. Suśr.

Name: kāmpīla
Description: 3047 kāmpīla² n. 'name of a town' VS., kāmpilya- n., °yā- f. 'a city of the Pañcālas' MBh., °pilla- m. 'a country in the NW of India' lex.

Name: kā́mya
Description: 3048 kā́mya 'desirable' RV., °yā- f. 'name of an Apsaras' MBh. 2. *kāmiya-, cf. kāmika- 'desired' MBh. (sanskritized from kāmia- ?). [√kam]

Name: kāya
Description: 3050 kāya² m. 'dwelling' lex. [kāyamāna- n. 'hut of straw' lex.

Name: kāyastʰa
Description: 3051 kāyastha m. 'writer, man of the writer caste' Yājñ. [EWA i 200: kā́ya-¹, stha-]

Name: kāraṇḍava
Description: 3059 kāraṇḍava m. 'a kind of duck' MBh. [Cf. kāraṇḍa- m. 'id.' R., karēṭu- m. 'Numidian crane' lex.: see karaṭa-¹]

Name: kāravēlla
Description: 3061 kāravēlla m. 'the gourd Momordica charantia' Suśr., n. 'its fruit' lex., °lī- f. 'the plant', °laka- m., °likā- f. Suśr., kāravallī- f. Car. 2. *kārēlla-. [S. K. Chatterji's theory, Miscellany 74, of Drav. cmpd. 'black-spear' is supported by another name for this plant kāṇḍīra-]

Name: kā́ri
Description: 3064 kā́ri m. 'artisan, worker' Pāṇ. 2. f. 'action, work' Bhaṭṭ. [√kr̥¹]

Name: kārīṣa
Description: 3065 kārīṣa 'produced from dung' Suśr., n. 'heap of dung' lex. [kárīṣa-¹]

Name: *kārti
Description: 3069 *kārti 'knife'. [Cf. Bal. kārč < *kārti-, Pahl. kārt < *kārti- or °ta-. For the series kr̥tí-²: *karta-³ or °ti-: *kārti- cf. Gk. καρδία: Goth. haírtō: Gk. κῆρ and Sk. hŕ̥d-: hā́rdi

Name: kārmika
Description: 3076 kārmika 'engaged in action, name of a partic. Buddhist sect', n. 'any variegated texture' Yājñ. [kárman-¹]

Name: kārṣāpaṇá
Description: 3080 kārṣāpaṇá m.n. 'a partic. coin or weight equivalent to one karṣa'. [karṣa- m. 'a partic. weight' Suśr. (cf. OPers. karša-) and paṇa-² or āpana- EWA i 176 and 202 with lit. But from early MIA. kā̆hā°]

Name: kā́rṣāpaṇika
Description: 3081 kā́rṣāpaṇika 'worth or bought for a kārṣāpaṇa' Pāṇ. [kārṣāpaṇá-]

Name: *kārṣū
Description: 3081a †*kārṣū- f. 'furrow, trench' ~ karṣū́- with dial. IA. a for ā < IE. o as in Av. karšū 'ploughed land' and in karṣí- ~ kā́rṣi- T. Burrow BSOAS xxxviii 70, Turner BSOAS xxxvi 429.

Name: kārṣmaryà
Description: 3082 kārṣmaryà m. 'the tree Gmelina arborea' TS., kārśmarī- f. lex., kāśmarya- m., °marī- f. MBh., °mīrī-, kambhārī-, gambhārī, °rikā- f. lex. [← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 372, EWA i 202]

Name: kāla
Description: 3083 kāla¹ 'black, dark-blue' MBh., kā́laka- Pāṇ. (kā́lakā- f. 'a kind of bird' VS.), Central Asian Sk. kāḷa- H. Lüders PhilInd 553. [< *kāḍa- ← Drav. and poss. connected with kajjala-, karṇāṭa- EWA i 203 with lit.]

Name: kālá
Description: 3084 kālá² m. 'time' AV., 'fixed point of time' ŚBr. 'fate, death' MBh.

Name: kālapr̩ṣṭʰa
Description: 3089 kālapr̥ṣṭha m. 'a species of antelope' lex. [kāla-¹, pr̥ṣṭhá-]

Name: kālamukʰa
Description: 3090 kālamukha 'black-faced' Pat., m. 'a kind of monkey' MBh. [kāla-¹, múkha-]

Name: kālalavaṇa
Description: 3092 kālalavaṇa n. 'a kind of black and factitious salt used medicinally' lex. [kāla-¹, lavaṇá-]

Name: kālasāra
Description: 3093 kālasāra m. 'spotted antelope' Naiṣ. [Cf. kr̥ṣṇasāra- m. 'black antelope' Mn.: kāla-¹, sā́ra-¹]

Name: kālāŋga
Description: 3095 kālāṅga 'having a dark blue body (of a sword)' MBh. [kāla-¹, áṅga-¹].

Name: kālī
Description: 3102 kālī 'the goddess Durgā' MBh., °likā- f. 'a female spirit, one of the Mothers in Skanda's retinue' MBh. [kāla-¹]

Name: kālēyaka
Description: 3103 kālēyaka m. 'a partic. part of the intestines' Suśr., m. 'liver' lex. [For confusion of 'heart' and 'liver' as in several cases below cf. HŚS s.v. kalejā to which (defined as yakr̥t-) is ascribed the function of pumping blood through the body]

Name: kālya
Description: 3104 kālya 'timely, seasonable' (prajanē kālyā- f. 'cow fit for the bull', see kālika-) Pāṇ., °yam, °yē 'at dawn' R. 2. kalya-³ n. 'dawn' lex., °yam 'at dawn, tomorrow' MBh., °yē BhP. [ka- < kā- with early shortening in adverb of time (similar subsequent shortenings in NIA. words below): kālá-²]

Name: kā́vya
Description: 3110 kā́vya-, kāvyá- 'inspired' RV., m.pl. 'poems' MBh., n. 'inspiration, wisdom' RV., 'poem' R. [kaví-]

Name: kā́śa
Description: 3112 kā́śa m. 'a grass used for mats, Saccharum spontaneum' Kauś.

Name: kā́śatē
Description: 3114 kā́śatē 'shines, is visible' MBh. [For meaning 'to see' cf. cā́kaśīti 'sees clearly' RV.: √kāś]

Name: kāṣṭʰá
Description: 3120 kāṣṭhá n. 'piece of wood' ŚBr., °ikā- f. 'small do.' Pañcat.

Name: kā́ṣṭʰā
Description: 3132 kā́ṣṭhā f. 'race-course' RV., 'goal, limit' ŚBr., 'cardinal point' MBh., 'measure of time = 1/30 kalā' Mn.

Name: kāsamarda
Description: 3136 kāsamarda m. 'remedy against cough consisting of a mixture of tamarind and mustard' lex., 'Cassia sophora' Suśr., °aka- m. lex. 2. *kāsamārja-. [For a similar divergent ending see karamarda-: kā́sā-, marda- and mārja- ?]

Name: kāhala
Description: 3141 kāhala¹ m. 'large drum' Pañcat., °lā- f. 'a musical instrument' Rājat.

Name: kāhala
Description: 3142 kāhala² 'speaking unbecomingly or indistinctly' lex., 'downcast, faint-hearted' BHS ii 182.

Name: kiṁkara
Description: 3143 kiṁkara m. 'servant, slave' MBh., °rī- f. 'his wife' Pāṇ., 'female servant' MBh.

Name: kiṁnara
Description: 3145 kiṁnara m. 'a centaur' Mn., °rā- f. 'a musical instrument', °rī- f. 'a lute of Caṇḍālas' lex. [kím, nára-]

Name: kiṁśuka
Description: 3149 kiṁśuka m. 'the tree Butea frondosa' MBh., kaiṁ- śuka- 'pertaining to B. frondosa' Suśr. 2. *kēśuka-. [M. Mayrhofer's assumption, EWA i 206, of a *kīsuka- 'red tree' (changed by pop. etym. to kiṁ-śuka-) ← Drav. is supported by NIA. forms which have no nasal. H. also has ṭesū m.]

Name: *kicca
Description: 3153 *kicca 'mud, dirt'. 2. *kacca-². 3. *khacca-. [Cf. Drav. words quoted s.v. *gicc- and further groups s.vv. kiṭṭa- and kaccara-¹, and *cikka-²]

Name: *kiṭana
Description: 3155 *kiṭana 'a tick'. [kiṭibha- m. 'bug, louse' lex., °aka- m. 'louse' Divyāv.]

Name: kiṭṭa
Description: 3156 kiṭṭa n. 'secretion' Suśr., cf. taila-kiṭṭa- n. 'oilcake' lex. 2. *kaṭṭa-¹. 3. *katta-. 4. *khiṭṭa-. 5. kīṭa-² n. 'feces' lex., in cmpds, expresses contempt (e.g. pakṣi-k° Pañcat.) [Cf. group s.v. *kicca- and poss. ext. of 3 in *kattara-]

Name: kiṇa
Description: 3160 kiṇa² m. 'insect found in wood' lex. [Poss. of same non-Aryan origin as ghuṇa- EWA i 208]

Name: kiṇihī
Description: 3161 kiṇihī f. 'the tree Achyranthes aspera' Suśr., kiṇi- f. lex.

Name: kínāṭa
Description: 3163 kínāṭa n. 'the inner part of a tree' ŚBr.

Name: kím
Description: 3164 kím n.sg. 'what? why?', interrogative particle RV., kiṁ vā 'or whether' Mn. [ká-²]

Name: kím
Description: 3166 kím u 'how much more!', kím utá RV. [kím, u¹]

Name: kirāṭa
Description: 3173 kirāṭa m. 'merchant' Rājat., kirīṭa-² m. BhP., kírāta- m. 'a degraded mountain tribe' VS., cilātī- f. 'woman of this tribe' YogH. [Alternance of k- and c-, -ṭ- and -t- suggests Drav. origin, EWA i 211. Perh. same as kilāta- 'dwarf']

Name: kirātatikta
Description: 3174 kirātatikta-, °aka- m. 'the plant Agathotes chirayta' Suśr. 2. cirā̆tikta- m. lex.

Name: kirīṭa
Description: 3176 kirīṭa¹ n. 'diadem, crest' MBh., tirīṭa-¹ n. lex. [Similar alternance of k- and t- in kirīṭi- ~ tirīṭa-²]

Name: kirīṭī
Description: 3177 kirīṭī f. 'Andropogon aciculatus', kiriṭi- n. 'fruit of the marshy date palm (Phoenix paludosa)'. [Cf. tirīṭa-² and similar alternance of initial in kirīṭa-¹ and tirīṭa-¹]

Name: *kila
Description: 3179 *kila 'scattering, ray'. [kīlā- f. 'flame' lex. (perh. for *kila-), -kira- in cmpd. 'scattering' Pāṇ., kiriká- 'sparkling' VS.: √kr̥̄¹]

Name: kilāṭa
Description: 3181 kilāṭa m. 'inspissated milk' Suśr., °ṭī- f. lex., kīlā́la- m. 'a sweet beverage (food of the gods)' AV., kīlāla-pā́- RV. [Of non-Aryan origin J. Charpentier MO xxvi 140]

Name: kilāta
Description: 3182 kilāta-, kirāta- m. 'dwarf' lex. [Perh. same as kírāta- m. 'member of a mountain tribe' VS., see kirāṭa-: cf. esp. Pa. kirāta-, °āṭa- m. 'man of a jungle tribe (classed with dwarfs among the attendants of a chief)']

Name: kilā́sa
Description: 3183 kilā́sa¹ 'leprous' VS., n. 'a species of leprosy' KātyŚr.

Name: kilikilā
Description: 3185 kilikilā f. 'cries expressing joy' Divyāv., kilakilā- f. MBh.

Name: kiliñca
Description: 3186 kiliñca 'thin board, bamboo' lex. [Cf. kiliñja- m. 'thin plank' lex., 'mat' Suśr., °lañja- m. 'mat', kaliñja- n. 'wood', m. 'mat' lex., kalañja- m. 'Calamus rotang' MW.; and further kaḍaṅkara-, °ṅgara- m. 'straw, stalks' lex., kaḍaṅkarī́ya-, °ryà- 'to be fed with straw' Pāṇ., Pa. kaḷiṅgara-, kal° m.n. 'plank, log', Pk. kaḍaṁgara- n. 'shaving, chaff', kalaṅka- m. 'bamboo', kaliṁba- m. 'dry wood, bamboo vessel']

Name: kilima
Description: 3187 kilima n. 'a kind of pine' Car., m. lex.

Name: kiśara
Description: 3188 kiśara m. 'a fragrant substance for sale' Pāṇ.

Name: kiśala
Description: 3189 kiśala m.n. 'sprout' lex., °laya- n. Gaut., m. lex.: v.l. kisa°. [P. Tedesco JAOS 67, 103 °laya- < °laka-]

Name: kiśōrá
Description: 3190 kiśōrá m. 'foal' AV., 'a youth' BhP., °rikā- f. Pān.

Name: kiṣku
Description: 3191 kiṣku m. (f. lex.) 'forearm' R., 'handle of axe' Tāṇḍya Br. [Poss. < *kr̥ṣku- EWA i 213]

Name: kīṭá
Description: 3193 kīṭá¹ m. 'insect, worm' ŚBr., °aka- m. R., kīṭī- f. lex.

Name: kīdŕ̩k
Description: 3196 kīdŕ̥k nom. n. sg. kīdŕ̥ś- 'of what sort?' RV. [ka-¹, √dr̥ś¹]

Name: kīla
Description: 3202 kīla¹ m. 'stake, peg, tumour' MBh., °laka- m., °likā- f. Pañcat. 2. *kīlla-. 3. *kīḍa-. 4. khī́la- m. 'post' AV. 5. *khīlla-. [IE. origin EWA i 216 with lit., but variation of k- with kh-, and poss. -l- with -ḍ- supports non-Aryan origin proposed by J. Charpentier MO xxvi 140. Cf. *khila-²?]

Name: kīla
Description: 3203 kīla² m. 'elbow' VP., 'blow with the elbow' lex., °lā- f. 'id.' Vātsyāy. [Same as kīla-¹?]

Name: kukr̩tya
Description: 3205 kukr̥tya n. 'evil deed' Pañcat. 2. *kukr̥tiya-. [kukr̥ta- n. Divyāv., Pk. kukkua- n

Name: kukkuṭá
Description: 3208 kukkuṭá¹ m. 'cock' VS., °ṭī- f. 'hen' VarBr̥S., °ṭaka- m. 'wild cock' lex., kurkuṭa- m. Pañcat. [Onom., cf. kukkubha-]

Name: kukkuṭa-
Description: 3209 kukkuṭa-², kukuṭa- m. 'the potherb Marsilla quadrifolia' lex., kukkuṭī-, kukūṭī- f. 'Dolichos pruriens, Salmalia malabarica' Suśr.

Name: kukkubʰa
Description: 3210 kukkubha m. 'the wild cock Phasianus gallus' MBh. [Cf. kukkuṭá-¹]

Name: kukkuramardaka
Description: 3211 kukkuramardaka m., °dikā- f., °dana- m. 'a plant with fragrant leaves' lex. [Platts UD s.v. kulāhal 'Celsia coromandelina a plant dogs are fond of smelling before urinating'

Name: kuca
Description: 3216 kuca (usu. du.) m. 'female breast, teat' Suśr. 2. *kucca-. [Onom. like cuci- EWA i 219]

Name: kucika
Description: 3217 kucika m. 'a kind of fish like an eel' lex. 2. kuñcikā-³ lex. [√kuc?]

Name: kucēla
Description: 3218 kucēla n. 'a wretched garment' Mn., 'rag' Car. [ku-, cēla-]

Name: *kujjati
Description: 3222 *kujjati 'rots'. [Perh. < *kūryatē < *k°rə-ye- = kīryatē with same semantic development, or < *k°ru-ye- beside kṛṇōti 'hurts' Dhātup., Pa. karati 'cuts, hurts']

Name: kuñja
Description: 3226 kuñja m. (n. lex.) 'place overgrown with plants or creepers, arbour' MBh.

Name: kuṭa
Description: 3227 kuṭa¹ m.n. 'water-pot, pitcher' Yaśast., kūṭa-⁵ n. lex., kuḍikā- f. lex. 2. *kuṭava-. 3. *kōṭa-⁴. [With kuṇḍá-¹, *kulla-³, kúlāla-, *kōḍamba-, gōla-², *ghōla-² ← Drav. EWA i 221, 226 with lit

Name: kuṭa
Description: 3228 kuṭa², °ṭi-, °ṭha-³, °ṭhi- m. 'tree' lex., °ṭaka- m. 'a kind of tree' Kauś.

Name: kuṭaja
Description: 3229 kuṭaja m. 'the tree Wrightia antidysenterica (the seeds of which are used as a febrifuge)' MBh., °ṭaca- m. lex. [← Drav. (Tam. kuṭacam, Kan. koḍasige, Tel. koḍise) T. Burrow BSOAS xii 373]

Name: kuṭilá
Description: 3231 kuṭilá 'bent, crooked' KātyŚr., °aka- Pañcat., n. 'a partic. plant' lex. [√kuṭ¹]

Name: kuṭī
Description: 3232 kuṭī f. 'hut' MBh., °ṭikā- f. Divyāv., °ṭīkā- f. Hariv. [Some cmpds. have °ṭa{ka}-: ← Drav. EWA i 222 with lit.: cf. kōṭa-³]

Name: kuṭumbin
Description: 3235 kuṭumbin m. 'householder' Mn., °binī f. 'his wife', °bika- 'taking care of a household' MBh., 'slave' lex. [kuṭumba-]

Name: kuṭṭa
Description: 3236 kuṭṭa¹ in cmpd. 'breaking, cutting', °aka- 'id.', m. 'cutter, breaker, grinder'. 2. *kōṭṭa-². [√kuṭṭ]

Name: kuṭṭanī
Description: 3240 kuṭṭanī f. 'bawd' BhP., °ṭinī- f. lex. [Poss. < '*abusive', cf. kuṭṭana- n. 'abusing', or conn. with *kuṭṭa-³, cf. B. kuṭī 'bawd']

Name: kuṭṭita
Description: 3242 kuṭṭita 'bruised, pounded' Bhpr., °tā- f. 'unskilful opening of a vein'. [√kuṭṭ]

Name: *kuṭṭʰa
Description: 3243 *kuṭṭha 'knee'. [Conn. √kuṭ¹ 'bend' Grierson Tor 162 with (?). But a long range of names for joints and limbs 'ankle-heel-foot-leg-knee-wrist' are characterized by the sequence of guttural -u/ō- retroflex: *kuṭṭha-, *khuṭṭa-², *khuḍa-¹, *guṭṭha-², *gōḍḍa-, ghuṭa-, ghuṇṭa-¹]

Name: kuṭʰāra
Description: 3244 kuṭhāra m. 'axe' R., °raka- m. VarBr̥S., °rī- f. lex., °rikā- f. Suśr. [kuṭhātaṅka- m., °kā- f. lex. Prob. ← Drav. and conn. with √kuṭṭ EWA i 223 with lit.]

Name: *kuḍa
Description: 3245 *kuḍa¹ 'boy, son', °ḍī 'girl, daughter'. [Prob. ← Mu. (Sant. Muṇḍari koṛa 'boy', kuṛi 'girl', Ho koa, kui, Kūrkū kōn, kōnjē); or ← Drav. (Tam. kur̤a 'young', Kan. koḍa 'youth') T. Burrow BSOAS xii 373. Prob. separate from RV. kŕ̥tā- 'girl' H. W. Bailey TPS 1955, 65

Name: kuḍava
Description: 3246 kuḍava m.n. 'a measure of grain containing a quarter of a prastha' MBh., kúṭapa- Uṇ., kuḍapa- lex. [← Drav. EWA i 224; orig. 'pot' and same as *kuṭava- ?]

Name: kuḍya
Description: 3251 kuḍya n. 'wall' Yājñ., 'plastering (a wall)' lex., °yaka- n., °yā- f. 'wall' lex. 2. *kuḍiya-. 3. *kuḍa-². 4. kudya- v.l.

Name: kuṇa
Description: 3255 kuṇa m. 'an insect living in clothes' Gal. [Cf. utkuṇa-, matkuṇa-¹; and Psht. kōṇ, kūnai 'tick, louse' EVP 33]

Name: kuṇáti
Description: 3256 kuṇáti 'makes a certain noise, is in pain' Dhātup.

Name: kúṇapa
Description: 3257 kúṇapa n. 'corpse' AV., kuṇápa- 'smelling like a corpse' ŚBr. [← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 373]

Name: kuṇāla
Description: 3258 kuṇāla m. 'a kind of bird' Lalit., kunāla- m. 'a Himalayan bird' lex. [Cf. kōnālaka- °nāli- (?) m. 'an aquatic bird' Suśr., konīla- m. lex., Pk. kōṇālaga- m.; and *munāla-]

Name: kuṇi
Description: 3259 kuṇi 'defective in having a bent or withered arm or a hand without fingers' MBh., kūṇi- lex. [The meaning of RV. kúṇāru- as 'having a withered arm' is doubtful, but cf. Pk. kuṁṭa- ~ kuṁṭāra- s.v. *kuṇṭa-

Name: kuṇṭʰa
Description: 3261 kuṇṭha 'blunt, dull, stupid, lazy' MBh. [Ir. *kunda- or *kunta- 'defective' in Pers. kund, Bal. kunt 'blunt' H. W. Bailey TPS 1955, 72: cf. esp. *kunta-². But kuṇṭha- is also one of a number of 'defective' words listed below characterized by the sequence 'guttural — u or ō with or without nasal-retroflex or dental stop', which lend some support to F. B. J. Kuiper's theory, PMWS 40, of Muṇḍa origin. Despite EWA i 225 and P. Tedesco JAOS 65, 97, not < kr̥ttá-]

Name: kuṇḍá
Description: 3264 kuṇḍá¹ n. (RV. in cmpd.) 'bowl, waterpot' KātyŚr., 'basin of water, pit' MBh. (semant. cf. kumbhá-¹), °ḍaka- m.n. 'pot' Kathās., °ḍī- f. Pāṇ., °ḍikā- f. Up. 2. *gōṇḍa-. [← Drav., e.g. Tam. kuṭam, Kan. guṇḍi, EWA i 226 with other 'pot' words s.v. kuṭa-¹]

Name: kuṇḍa
Description: 3265 kuṇḍa² m. 'son of a woman during husband's life by another man'. [P. Thieme KZ 66, 143 'pot-bastard' from kuṇḍá-¹ as gōlaka- 'widow's bastard' from gōla-² (see kumbhā-); but poss. with Pa. and Phal. words below belongs to or collides with the 'defective' group of kuṇṭha- with kuṇḍā- f. 'mutilation' Pāṇ., kuṇḍati 'mutilates' Dhātup.]

Name: kuṇḍa
Description: 3266 kuṇḍa³ n. 'clump' e.g. darbha-kuṇḍa- Pāṇ. [← Drav. (Tam. koṇṭai 'tuft of hair', Kan. goṇḍe 'cluster', &c.) T. Burrow BSOAS xii 374]

Name: kuṇḍalá
Description: 3268 kuṇḍalá¹ n. 'ring, ear-ring' ĀśvGr̥., 'bracelet' Śiś., 'coil of a rope' lex. 2. *kōṇḍala-. 3. *guṇḍala-. 4. *gundala-. [← Drav. Burrow BSOAS xii 374, EWA i 226]

Name: kutū
Description: 3273 kutū f. 'leather oil vessel' Pāṇ., kutupa- n. 'small do.' Kāś.

Name: *kutta
Description: 3275 *kutta¹ 'dog'. [Onom.: cf. Sogd. 'kwt, Shgh. kut 'dog', Sant. kutu kutu 'sound made in calling a puppy']

Name: kudiṣṭi
Description: 3285 kudiṣṭi f. 'a partic. measure of length (longer than diṣṭi- !)' Kauś. [NIA. forms < *kudriṣṭi-

Name: kuddāla
Description: 3286 kuddāla¹ m.n. 'a kind of spade or mattock'. 2. *kōddāla-. 3. kuḍḍāla- 'spade' Apte. [Prob. ← Drav. EWA i 229 with lit.]

Name: kuddāla-
Description: 3287 kuddāla-², °dala-, kuṇḍala-, kudāla-, °āra- m. 'the tree Bauhinea variegata'. 2. kōvidāra- m. Gobh. [Poss. conn. with uddāla-¹]

Name: kunakʰín
Description: 3288 kunakhín 'having diseased nails' AV., kunakha- n. 'a disease of the nails' Suśr. [ku-, nakhá-]

Name: *kunta
Description: 3290 *kunta² 'defective'. [Cf. esp. Ir. *kunta-, see s.v. kuṇṭha- and list there given]

Name: kuntalikā
Description: 3291 kuntalikā f. 'a partic. kind of plant' Suśr.

Name: kunda
Description: 3296 kunda² m. 'Jasminum multiflorum or pubescens' MBh. ('olibanum or resin of Boswellia thurifera' lex., see kunduru-), n. 'its flower'.

Name: kunduru
Description: 3298 kunduru m. 'Boswellia thurifera and its resin' VarBr̥S., °uka- m., °ukā- f. 'olibanum' Suśr., °rūka- m. [Cf. kunda-², kandūraka-, mukunda- m. 'resin of B. thurifera']

Name: kúpyati
Description: 3299 kúpyati 'is agitated' Suśr., 'is angry' MBh. [kōpáyati 'moves, shakes' RV.: √kup]

Name: kubjá
Description: 3300 kubjá 'humpbacked' VS., °aka- Pañcat. [Of non-Aryan origin EWA i 231 with lit.: see *khubja-, kubhrá-, *kubba-, *khubba-, *khundha-]

Name: *kubba
Description: 3301 *kubba 'hump'. [Poss. < *kubra-, cf. kubhrá- m. 'humpbacked bull' MaitrS.: ṛ of NIA. forms is an IA. suffix and not integral to the word as suggested by PMWS 43 and EWA i 232. Prob. belongs to the group s.v. kubjá-]

Name: kumārá
Description: 3303 kumārá m. 'boy' RV., 'prince' Ragh., °aká- m. 'little boy' RV. (*°akā- f. in Kho.), °rī́-, °rikā́-, f. 'young girl' AV. [Orig. 'weak, tender', cf. kumārá-dēṣṇa- opp. to skambhá-d° RV. and perh. conn. kōmalá-, cf. sukumāra- ~ sukōmala- EWA i 232, 565 with lit.]

Name: kumārī
Description: 3304 kumārī f. 'Aloe perfoliata' lex., °rikā- f. 'Capparis trifoliata' lex.

Name: kúmuda
Description: 3305 kúmuda n. 'esculent white waterlily' AV. 2. kumudiká- 'pertaining to waterlilies' Pāṇ., '*waterlily' (semant. cf. nalinī- 'pond' and 'lotus').

Name: kumudī
Description: 3305a †kumudī- f. 'the plant kaṭphala- or Myrica sapida' lex., kumudikā- f. id. lex., kumudā- f. name of several plants including kaṭphala-.

Name: kúmba
Description: 3307 kúmba m.n. 'thick end (of a bone or club)' TS.

Name: kumbʰá
Description: 3308 kumbhá¹ m. 'jar, pot' RV. 2. *khumbha-. [Ār. *khumbha- in Av. xumba-; semant. 'pot > pool' cf. kuṇḍá-¹, *ḍabbara-]

Name: kumbʰa
Description: 3309 kumbha² m.n., °bhā-, °bhī-, °bhikā- f. 'names of various plants' lex.

Name: kumbʰalā
Description: 3313 kumbhalā f. 'the plant Sphaeranthus hirtus (the flowers of which are compared with those of Nauclea cadamba)' lex.

Name: kumbʰā
Description: 3315 kumbhā f. 'harlot', kumbhī́ka- m. 'catamite' Suśr. [kumbhá-¹: cf. Av. xumba- 'catamite' and semant, P. N. H. G. pātar f. 'harlot' prob. ← Sk. pātra-. Ac. to P. Thieme ZDMG 91, 121 kumbhā- is hypochoristic for kumbhadāsī- f. 'harlot': see also kuṇḍa-²]

Name: kumbʰila
Description: 3316 kumbhila m. 'housebreaking thief' lex. [lit. 'son of a kumbhā- ' P. Thieme ZDMG 91, 133]

Name: kumbʰīra
Description: 3317 kumbhīra m. 'crocodile, long-nosed alligator' MBh., °īla- m. lex.

Name: kurabaka
Description: 3322 kurabaka m. 'a kind of red Barleria, red amaranth' MBh., °ba- m. 'a red Barleria' lex., n. 'its blossom' Kālid., v.l. °rava-, kuruba- m. lex. [Cf. kuruṇṭa-]

Name: kurī
Description: 3324 kurī f. 'a partic. kind of grass' lex.

Name: *kurasya
Description: 3325 *kurasya 'with poor juice'. [kurasa- 'having a bad taste' W

Name: kuruṇṭa
Description: 3326 kuruṇṭa m. 'yellow Barleria, yellow amaranth' lex., °ṭaka- m., °ṭikā- f. Suśr., kuraṇṭa-, °aka-, kuraṇḍaka- lex. (kuraṇṭa- m., kuruṭa- m. 'the potherb Marsilea quadrifolia'). [Cf. kurabaka-]

Name: kurula
Description: 3327 kurula, °rala- m. 'lock of hair on the forehead' lex.

Name: kuruvinda
Description: 3328 kuruvinda m.n. 'ruby' Suśr., n. 'black salt, the stone cinnabar' lex.

Name: kurkurá
Description: 3329 kurkurá m. 'dog' AV., kukkurá- m. Mr̥cch., °rī- f. VarBr̥S. 2. *kuṅkara-. [Onom. EWA i 237: cf. *karkuṭaka-, *kuccura-, *kutta-¹, *kukka-¹]

Name: kúla
Description: 3330 kúla n. 'herd, troop' RV., 'race, family' Pāṇ., 'noble family' Mn., 'house' MBh.

Name: kulakṣaṇa
Description: 3332 kulakṣaṇa 'having fatal marks on the body' Kathās. [ku-, lakṣaṇá-]

Name: kulattʰa
Description: 3335 kulattha m. 'the pulse Dolichos uniflorus' MBh., °thā- f. lex., °thikā- f. Suśr. [← Drav. (Tam. koḷ 'id.', etc.), T. Burrow TPS 1945, 92 and EWA i 237, 565, with same suffix as in aśvattha-, kapittha-, dadhittha-: the same kul- in kulīnaka- ?]

Name: kuladīpa
Description: 3336 kuladīpa m. 'glory of a family' MW. [kúla-, dīpa-]

Name: kulaputra
Description: 3338 kulaputra m. 'son of a noble family, respectable youth' MBh., °aka- m. Kathās. [kúla-, putrá-]

Name: kulā́ya
Description: 3340 kulā́ya n. (m. Pañcat.) 'woven texture, web, nest' AV. [Prob. with kulya- and *ghōla-² ← Drav. Tam. kuṭai, Mal. kūṭa, Kan. Tu. gūḍe, Tel. gūḍa 'basket'; Tam. kūṭu, Mal. kūḍu, Kan. Tel. Tu. gūḍu 'nest'. For sense 'nest' NTS xii 265 proposes pejorative ku- + lāya- and compares Pers. kunām, Bal. kuδām 'nest' < *ku-dāman-]

Name: kúlāla
Description: 3341 kúlāla m. 'potter' VS., °lī- f. Rājat. 2. kaulālá- m. 'potter' VS. ŚBr., n. 'potter's ware' ĀśrGr̥., °aka- n. Pāṇ. [→ Pers. → Par. kəlấlī 'pot': non-Aryan J. Charpentier MO xxvi 141, prob. with other 'pot' words s.v. kuṭa-¹ ← Drav. Otherwise, but less likely, EWA i 239 with lit.]

Name: kulika
Description: 3342 kulika 'of good family', m. 'kinsman' Yājñ. [kulín- 'of good family' Pāṇ.: kúla-]

Name: kuliŋga
Description: 3343 kuliṅga m. 'fork-tailed shrike' MBh., kuliṅkaka- m. 'sparrow' lex., kulī́kā-, pu° f. 'a kind of bird' VS. [Prob. ← Austro-as. EWA 239, 240 with lit.]

Name: kulmāṣa
Description: 3349 kulmāṣa m. 'half-ripe barley' ChUp., 'sour gruel of fruit juice or rice' Suśr.

Name: kulya
Description: 3350 kulya n. 'receptacle for burnt bones of a corpse' MBh., 'winnowing basket' lex. [Prob. ← Drav.: see kulā́ya-]

Name: kulyā́
Description: 3352 kulyā́ f. 'small river, canal, ditch' RV. 2. *kūlā-, kūla-² n. 'pond, tank' lex. (same as kū́la-¹?). 3. *kūlyā- (cf. kū́lya- 'belonging to a bank' VS.). [Variety of form suggests poss. Drav. origin for kulyā́- as well as for kūla-² (Tam. kuḷam 'tank' T. Burrow Arch. Ling. 7, 151)]

Name: *kulla
Description: 3354 *kulla³ 'pot'. [kulija- n. 'a partic. vessel' Kauś., 'a measure' Pāṇ., kulharī-, °rikā- f. 'pot' Bhpr.: prob. with kúlāla- and other 'pot' words s. v. kuṭa-¹ ← Drav.]

Name: kuváya
Description: 3356 kuváya m. 'a partic. kind of bird' MaitrS., kváyi- m. TS. (cf. also kudhi- m. 'owl' Gal. ~ kudhī- m. 'fool' Pañcat). [EWA i 283 onom.

Name: kúvala
Description: 3358 kúvala n. 'the fruit of Zizyphus jujuba' VS., kvàla- TS., kuvala- m., °lī- f. 'the tree' lex., kōla-³ n. 'the fruit' ChUp., °lā-, °lī- f., °li- m.f. 'the tree' lex.

Name: kuśá
Description: 3363 kuśá¹ m. 'the grass Poa cynosuroides' Mn., 'rope made of this grass for plough' lex.

Name: kuśa
Description: 3364 kuśa² 'depraved, mad, inebriate' lex. [Cf. kuśi- m. 'owl', kuśika- 'squint-eyed', Kuśiká- nom. prop. RV.]

Name: kúśala
Description: 3365 kúśala 'right, proper' AitBr., 'competent, clever' ChUp., 'healthy, prosperous' R., n. 'well-being' TUp. [P. Tedesco's (JAOS 74, 131) derivation by metath. and with Mg. ś < súkr̥ta- is ingenious but very doubtful]

Name: kuśī́
Description: 3367 kuśī́ f. 'small wooden pin used to mark in recitation' MaitrS., 'do. of metal' ŚBr., 'ploughshare' lex., °śika- m.n. lex., kuśā- f. 'pin for marking in recitation' Pāṇ., °śikā- f. 'piece of wood used as a splint for a broken limb' Car.

Name: kúṣṭʰa
Description: 3370 kúṣṭha¹ m.n. 'the plant Costus speciosus (used as a medicine for takmán-, a wasting disease with skin eruptions)' AV. 2. *kōṭṭha-¹. 3. *kuṭha-¹, kuṭhika- m. lex. [Conn. with kúṣṭha-², either original or by pop. etym. because of its use as a specific for leprosy, is poss. EWA i 246: cf. also the oppositions in both words of u ~ ō, ṣṭh ~ ṭh whether after u or ō]

Name: kúṣṭʰa
Description: 3371 kúṣṭha² n. 'leprosy' Suśr. 2. *kōṭṭha-² 3. kōṭha- m. 'a kind of leprosy with large round spots' Suśr. 4. *kuṭha-². [Similar phonet. variation in kúṣṭha-¹: kōṭha- poss. dial. (E? Amg.? as in vēṣṭatē, Pa. vēṭhati, etc. with shortening of consonant group after long vowel) < kōṭṭha-² (also poss., but unlikely, < *kauṣṭha-, kauṣṭhika- 'of leprosy' Car.)]

Name: kuṣmāṇḍa
Description: 3374 kuṣmāṇḍa m. 'the pumpkin-gourd Beninkasa cerifera' MBh., °ḍī-, kumbhāṇḍī- lex., kūśmāṇḍa-, kū̆ṣmāṇḍaka- Car. 2. *kōhaṇḍa-. 3. *kōhala-. [kū̆ṣm°, kūśm°, kumbh° sanskritization of MIA. kōmh° of non-Aryan origin (PMWS 144, EWA i 247). Note phonetic parallelism between kū̆ṣmāṇḍa- Pur. ~ kumbhāṇḍa- Buddh. 'class of demons' and kuṣmāṇḍa- (kūśm°, kūṣmāṇḍaka-) ~ Pa. kumbhaṇḍa- (Sk. kumbhāṇḍī-) 'gourd'

Name: kusúmbʰa
Description: 3378 kusúmbha m. 'safflower or Carthamus tinctorius' Suśr., 'saffron or Crocus sativus' lex., °aka- m.n. 'a partic. kind of vegetable'.

Name: kusūla
Description: 3379 kusūla m. 'granary for rice or other grain' BhP., kusūla-dhānya- 'having grain stored for three years' Yājñ.

Name: kustumbarī
Description: 3380 kustumbarī f. 'coriander' Suśr., °buru- m. Pāṇ. 2. *kōstambarī-. [Non-Aryan: cf. tumburu- n. Suśr., °rī- f., tubarī- f. lex. 'coriander, fruit of Diospyros embryopteris', tumbarī- f. 'a sort of grain']

Name: kuha
Description: 3385 kuha¹ 'cheat' in akuha- m. 'no cheat' R., kúhaka- m. 'cheat, juggler' MBh. [√kuh]

Name: *kuharayati
Description: 3388 *kuharayati 'coos', kuharita- n. 'cry of the kōkila bird' lex.

Name: kūṭa
Description: 3391 kūṭa¹ n. 'iron mallet' MBh. [J. Bloch BSOS v 738 and T. Burrow TPS 1945, 93 connect with √kuṭṭ as ← Drav.]

Name: kūṭa
Description: 3392 kūṭa² m.n. 'heap, multitude' MBh. [Prob. ← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 94; but for poss. conn. with kūṭa-¹ cf. ghaná-¹ 'club' ~ ghaná-² 'compact, dense']

Name: kūṭa
Description: 3393 kūṭa³ n. 'part of a plough, its share' lex. [kuṭaka- n. 'plough without a pole' lex. ← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 93 and EWA i 251]

Name: kūṭa
Description: 3395 kūṭa⁶, °aka- 'base (of coins)' Yājñ., 'false, untrue' Mn. [Perh. same as kūṭá-⁷ 'hornless' AV., Pa. kūṭa- (← Drav.? EWA i 251) and so conn. *kuṭṭa-³, *khōṭi-, *khōṭṭa-. Similar range of meaning in other 'defective' groups, e.g. laṭṭa-¹]

Name: kūṭāgāra
Description: 3398 kūṭāgāra n.m. 'apartment on the roof of a house' R. [kū́ṭa-⁴, agāra-]

Name: kūḍayati
Description: 3399 kūḍayati, kūḷ° RV. 'burns', akūlayat AitBr., kūlita- 'burnt' Suśr., kúṇḍatē 'burns' Dhātup. [If of non-Aryan origin, poss. conn. with Pa. kōḷāpa- 'dry (of a tree)']

Name: kū́pa
Description: 3400 kū́pa¹ m. 'hole, hollow, cave' RV., 'pit, well', °aka- m. lex.

Name: kūpa
Description: 3401 kūpa², °aka- m. 'mooring post, mast' lex. [← Drav. (Tam. kūmpu 'mast, cone-shaped pinnacle of chariot', Mal. kūmpu 'mast, pointed heap', Tu. kū̆vè 'mast') T. Burrow BSOAS xi 135, xii 375. Prob. therefore to be separated from kū́pa-¹: nevertheless for semantic development, 'pit ~ heap ~ post' see kū́pya-, *khaḍa-², khātra-, mēthí-, skambhá- and esp. kūpaka- 'funeral pyre, hole under it' lex.]

Name: kūpa
Description: 3402 kūpa³, °aka- m. 'leather oil vessel' lex. 2. *kumpa-². 3. *kuppa-. [Any connexion with kutū-, kutupa- doubtful]

Name: kūrcá
Description: 3408 kūrcá m. 'bunch, bundle of grass' TS., °aka- m. 'toothbrush, painter's brush' Suśr., °ikā- f. 'brush made of hair' lex., kūcī́- f. 'paintbrush, pencil' Suśr. [Perh. with T. Burrow BSOAS xii 375 belongs to same group of lws. fr. Drav. as guccha-]

Name: kū́rdati
Description: 3412 kū́rdati 'leaps, jumps' MBh. [gū́rdati, khū́rdatē Dhātup.: prob. ← Drav. (Tam. kuti, Kan. gudi 'to spring') T. Burrow BSOAS xii 375]

Name: kūrpara
Description: 3413 kūrpara m. 'elbow' Suśr., 'knee' lex., °rā- f. 'elbow' lex., kaurpara- 'being at the elbow' Suśr. [See kaphōni-]

Name: *kūrma
Description: 3415 *kūrma² 'roof'. 2. *kaurma-. [Poss. same as kūrmá-¹, kaurma- 'appertaining to a tortoise, *like a tortoise shell'?]

Name: kū́la
Description: 3416 kū́la¹ n. 'declivity' RV., 'shore' ŚBr., 'heap, mound' Car., °aka- m.n. 'bank, shore' lex. [Same as kūla-²?]

Name: kr̩kalāsá
Description: 3418 kr̥kalāsá m. 'chameleon' TS., °aka- m. MBh. MIA. and NIA. attest various forms: 1. *kr̥kkalāsa-. 2. *kr̥kkala-. 3. *kr̥kaṇṭaka-.

Name: kr̩kāṭikā
Description: 3419 kr̥kāṭikā f. 'joint of neck' Suśr., kŕ̥kāṭa- n. AV., °ṭaka- n. lex., kakā́ṭikā- f. 'a part of the skull' AV. [PMWS 29 groups -kāṭ-, prefixed by kr̥-, ka-, with kaṇṭhá- as Mu., and so separates from kr̥ka- 'throat, neck']

Name: kr̩ccʰrá
Description: 3420 kr̥cchrá 'painful, miserable' MBh., n. 'difficulty, trouble, danger' RV. [Derivation from *kr̥psrá- Wackernagel AiGr i 158 and EWA i 257 with lit. is supported by WPah. u < r̥ before p

Name: kr̩tyá
Description: 3428 kr̥tyá 'proper to be done' MBh., kr̥tyā́- f. 'action' AV. [√kr̥¹]

Name: kr̩muká
Description: 3440 kr̥muká m. 'a kind of tree' ŚBr., kramu- m. 'betelnut tree' lex., °ka- m. 'id.' Suśr., 'mulberry, Symplocos racemosa, Cyperus' lex., kēmbuka- n. 'kernel of areca nut' lex., krumuká- m. 'a piece of wood used to catch the sacrificial fire when kindled by friction' TS.

Name: kr̩ṣṭá
Description: 3449 kr̥ṣṭá 'drawn, ploughed', n. 'ploughed land' ŚBr. [Doubtful whether there is identity or connexion with √*kaḍḍh which largely replaced √kr̥ṣ]

Name: kr̩ṣṇá
Description: 3451 kr̥ṣṇá 'dark blue, black' RV., kŕ̥ṣṇaka- 'blackish' Pāṇ. 2. Nom. prop. esp. of the incarnation of Viṣṇu.

Name: kr̩ṣṇamallikā
Description: 3453 kr̥ṣṇamallikā-, °mālukā- f. 'the plant Ocimum sanctum' lex. [kr̥ṣṇá-, mallikā-]

Name: kr̩sará
Description: 3456 kr̥sará-, kr̥ś° m. 'a dish of sesamum and grain, rice and peas and spices' Kauś., kr̥sara- n. MBh., °rā- f. Suśr. [Cf. *khēsārī- ?]

Name: kēkara
Description: 3457 kēkara 'squinting, cross-eyed' Mn. (iii 159 as v.l.), °aka- Cāṇ., kēdara- lex. [Connexion with other words for 'crooked, squinting' suggested by EWA i 264, in rejecting IE. origin with Lat. caecus etc., is doubtful. But if kēkara- is deriv. of *kēka- < IE. *kaiko IEW 519, there is a parallel formation in *ḍēvva- ~ ḍēvvara- and the same semantic range 'one-eyed — blind — squinting' in *śrēḍa-

Name: kētaka
Description: 3462 kētaka m. 'the tree Pandanus odoratissimus' MBh., °kĭ̄- f. Gīt. [← Drav. EWA i 264 with lit.: also cf. Savara keda. In S. it collides with kadala- of Austroas. origin.]

Name: kēndu
Description: 3464 kēndu m. 'a kind of ebony, Diospyros embryopteris', °uka- m. 'D. glutinosa (yielding a sort of tar)' lex. [Cf. tinduka-, tumbara-]

Name: kēmuka
Description: 3465 kēmuka m. 'Costus speciosus' lex., 'Colocasia antiquorum' Bhpr. [Cf. kēvuka- m. Car., kēcuka- m. Suśr., kacu- m., kacvī- f. lex., kēlūṭa- m. Npr., also 'a kind of potherb' Car.: ← Drav. EWA i 266]

Name: kēyūra
Description: 3466 kēyūra m.n. 'bracelet on the upper arm' MBh. [← Drav. (cf. esp. Mal. kayyuṟa 'glove') T. Burrow BSOAS xii 375, EWA i 266]

Name: kēvárta
Description: 3469 kēvárta m. 'fisherman' VS., kaivarta- m. Mn., °aka- m. R. 2. *kēvāṭa-.

Name: kḗśa
Description: 3471 kḗśa m. 'hair of the head' AV. (RV. in cmpd.).

Name: kēśāgra
Description: 3472 kēśāgra n. 'the tip of a hair' ŚāṅkhGr̥. [kḗśa-, ágra-]

Name: kḗśya
Description: 3473 kḗśya 'being in the hair, suitable for the hair' AV. [kḗśa-]

Name: kḗsara
Description: 3474 kḗsara n. 'hair (of brow)' VS., 'hair' ŚBr., 'mane, filament of lotus and other plants' R., 'fibre (of mango)' Suśr.

Name: kaitava
Description: 3477 kaitava n. 'stake in gambling' MBh., 'deceit' R., °aka- n. 'gambling' MBh. [kitavá- m. 'gambler' RV., Pa. kitava- m.]

Name: kṓka
Description: 3481 kṓka m. 'wolf' R., kōkaḍa- m. 'fox' lex. [Perh. in kṓkayātu- m. RV. (EWA i 268 with lit.) and in AV. 'a kind of noxious parasitical animal', cf. same double meaning in N. baũso < vr̥kadaṁśa-]

Name: kōkilá

Name: *kʰēḍ
Description: 3918 *khēḍ 'play'. 2. *khēḍḍ-. 3. *khiḍḍ-¹. 4. *khīl-. 5. *khill-. 6. *khēl-. 7. *khēll-. 8. kēl- or *kēḍ-. [If krī́ḍati, already in RV. (krī́ḷati, °ḷā́-, °ḷí- f., °ḷú-), is of non-Aryan origin (see in last instance A. Master BSOAS xii 363 and F. B. J. Kuiper Festschr. A. Debrunner 242: EWA i 279 with earlier lit.), then these forms may stem from the same source. If krī́ḍati is IE., it has crossed with these, e.g. Pk. kiḍḍaï, killaï ~ kīḍaï. Sk. kḗlati 'trembles' Dhātup., kḗli- f. 'amorous play' Mn., khḗlati 'shakes' R., khēlāyáti 'plays' Bhaṭṭ., khēli- f. 'sport' Gīt. may be connected. kṣvḗlati 'jumps, sports' R., kṣvēli-, °ikā- f. 'play' BhP. ac. to EAW i 296 is sanskritization of khēl-; but, although there is no form in NIA. with c̣h-, or ch-, Gy. eur. and arm. kh-, pal. k- (not x- and ḳ- < Sk. kh-) attest kṣ{v}-. H. helnā 'to play', if < *abhikhēl-, separates khēl- from kṣvēl- or represents a late cmpd. with MIA. kh- < kṣ{v}-]

Cf. kúṇṭhati 'is lame' and the list of 'defective' words s.v. kuṇṭha- with which some of the 'lame' words collide. See also *kōla- ⁴]

Sh. < *khōda- or *khōḍa-, M. < *khōḍa- or khōla-: these represent loans from different Iranian dialects at different stages, e.g. Av. xαοδα-, Psht. xōl EVP 96]

Description: 4832 *ciṣṭa 'message'. [Cf. Av. kaēš-, činasti 'teaches, makes known', Pahl. nām-čišt 'known by name' H. W. Bailey JRAS 1934, 510]

Name: cihna
Description: 4833 cihna n. 'mark, sign' MBh., °aka- n. 'small do.' Kād.

Name: *cihnadʰāra
Description: 4835 *cihnadhāra 'bearing a mark'. [Cf. cihnadhārin- 'making a sign', °dhara- 'bearing a sign' lex.: cihna-, dhā́ra-¹]

Name: cīmara
Description: 4842a cīmara- Add. 14496. [Cf. Shgh. čindōn 'furnace for smelting iron' perh. ← Dardic or Kafiri e.g. Kt. čimə in cmpds. like čim-dur 'saucepan']

Name: cī́ra
Description: 4843 cī́ra n. 'strip (of bark or cloth)' TĀr., °aka- n., °ikā- f. 'announcement in a strip of paper' Kathās. [→ Orm. čīr 'torn' IIFL i 392

Name: cīrī
Description: 4845 cīrī f. 'cricket' Kathās., °rikā- f., °rukā- f. lex. [Onom., cf. cīrīvāka- m. Mn.]

Name: *cukk

Name: *cuccu

[Also cuṇḍáyati, cuṇáti, chōṭayati 'cuts off' Dhātup. Of non-Aryan origin, but scarcely with PMWS 152 conn. with words for 'small' s.v. *chōṭṭa-]

Name: *cutta

Name: *cupp
Description: 4863 *cupp 'strike'. 2. *cōpp-. 3. *cump-. [For list of poss. enlargements of IE. *sqeu- see √sku]

Name: *cubb
Description: 4866 *cubb 'pierce'. 2. *cōbb-. 3. *cōmb-. [For list of poss. enlargements of IE. *sqeu- see √sku]

Name: curī

Name: culu

Name: culla
Description: 4876 culla¹ 'blear-eyed' Pat. [Cf. cilla-¹ 'id.' Vārtt. and *cucca-¹, or poss. shortened from cullākṣa- 'smalleyed' BSH ii 232, see next]

Name: *culla
Description: 4877 *culla² 'small'. [Cf. cūḍa-³ 'small' BHS ii 232 (Pa. cūḷa-), cúṇḍati, cúṇṭati, cuṭṭáyati 'becomes small' Dhātup. Poss. collides with MIA. chulla- < kṣulla- (e.g. in Si.), but derivation of cūḍa-³ < kṣudrá- (EWA i 394) phonet. impossible. PMWS 152 ← Mu. (see *chōṭṭa-), but H. Smith JA 1950, 196 derives from onom. *cu-cu. Belongs with culla-¹ to a 'defective' word-group (see, e.g., *bukka- ⁴) and rhymes with *bulla- < bulvá-, *kulla- < kulvá-, *bhulla-, *lulla-]

Name: cullī
Description: 4879 cullī f. 'fireplace' Mn. [← Drav. EWA i 396 with lit.]

Name: cū́ḍa
Description: 4883 cū́ḍa¹ m. 'protuberance on brick' ŚBr., cōḍa-³ m. TS., cūḍā- f. 'topknot on head' Kālid., cūlikā- f. 'cockscomb'. 2. *cōṇḍa- 3. *cōṭṭa-¹. 4. *cunda-². [← Drav. EWA i 396 with lit. -cūlā- f. 'ceremony of tonsure' (which leaves the topknot, cf. the full name cūḍākaraṇa- n.) is the same word: derivation from kṣurita- (Tedesco JAOS 74, 133, EWA i 397) is phonet. impossible

Name: cūḍāmaṇi
Description: 4885 cūḍāmaṇi m. 'jewel worn on top of head' MBh. [cū́ḍa-¹, maṇí-¹]

Name: cūrṇa

Name: cūlikā
Description: 4896 cūlikā n. 'flour cake fried with ghee' lex.

Name: cēṭa
Description: 4902 cēṭa m. 'slave' Kathās., °ṭī- f. Mn., °ṭaka- m. Bhartr̥., °ṭikā- f. lex., cēḍa-, °ḍaka- m., °ḍī-, °ḍikā- f. lex., cēla- m. MBh. com. [PMWS 99, 152 with *cēlla- (which LM 331 separates) ← Mu. Prob. conn. with 'defective' word *cēṭṭa- (cf. bhāryācēla- 'bad wife' Pat.)]

Name: cḗya
Description: 4909 cḗya 'to be piled' MBh. [Cf. cítya- 'built on a foundation' TS

Name: *cēlla
Description: 4911 *cēlla 'boy'. [LM 331 ← Drav. and separate from cēṭa-: nevertheless ultimately conn. with this and *cēṭṭa-

Description: 4923 cōḍa¹, °aka- m. 'jacket' BHS ii 234, cōla-¹ m. Naiṣ., °aka- m. lex.

Name: *cōḍa
Description: 4924 *cōḍa², cōla-² m. 'name of a people on the Coromandel coast' MBh.

Name: *cōṇṭa
Description: 4925 *cōṇṭa 'beak'. 2. cōṭa-. 3. *ṭōñca-. 4. *ṭōcca-. [For list of similar forms see tuṇḍa- and cañcu-]

Name: *cōddati
Description: 4929 *cōddati 'copulates'. [Perh. same as cṓdati 'incites' RV. with expressive doubling

Name: cōdya
Description: 4930 cōdya 'to be incited', n. 'raising questions' MBh., 'astonishment' Śiś. [Cf. Pa. cujjati 'is questioned' < *cudyatē

Name: cōraka

Name: cauḍá

Description: 4940 cyāvana in cmpds. 'causing to fall' MBh., n. 'expulsion' Hariv. [√cyu]

Description: 4948 cyṓtati 'flows, trickles, oozes, causes to stream forth' Bhaṭṭ. 2. *cyutati, cf. aor. acyutat Vop. [√cyut: cyutá- X ścṓtati?]

Name: cʰagalá
Description: 4963 chagalá m. 'goat' TS., °laka- m. lex., °likā- f. Divyāv. 2. *chagalla-. 3. *chagara-. 4. *chaggala-. [chaga-]

Name: cʰattraparṇa
Description: 4974 chattraparṇa m. 'the tree Alstonia scholaris' lex. 2. saptaparṇa- m. MBh., n. 'its flower' ŚārṅgP., °aka- m. Car.

Name: *cʰapp
Description: 4994 *chapp 'press, cover, hide'. 2. *chipp-. [Cf. *capp- and *cipp- and *chupp-; further chimpikā- f. 'dyer', Pk. chiṁpaya- m. 'cloth-printer']

Name: *cʰambʰ
Description: 4995 *CHAMBH 'be firm'. [< IE. *sqembh- ~ skabhnā́ti 'makes firm' as in Av. fra-scimbana- ~ fra-skəmba-]

Name: cʰárdati
Description: 4998 chárdati Dhātup., chardáyati 'causes to flow over' ŚBr., 'vomits' MBh. 2. *chr̥ndati, chr̥ṇátti 'utters, leaves' TĀr., 'vomits' BhP. [Basic meaning is 'eject' (cf. MIrish sceirdim 'spit out') seen above and in ā́cchr̥ṇatti 'overflows' VS., TS., ŚBr. Semantic development 'eject-leave-vomit' in both directions is widely paralleled in IA. (ujjhati 'emits, leaves', utkṣipta- 'ejected, dismissed, vomited', uttarati 'comes out, leaves, vomits', Pa. vihāmi = niṭṭhubhāmi, G. nākhvũ, s.v. naṅkṣyati, 'to throw, leave, vomit'; Pa. vanta- 'vomited, renounced', vāmayati > G. vāmvū̃ 'to throw overboard, leave'). NIA. tends to keep MIA. chadd- (< chárdati) and chaṇḍ- (< *chr̥ndati) as 'vomit', chaḍḍ- (< chárdati) as 'leave', but not exclusively. Derivation of Pk. chaḍḍēi < tyakta- Tedesco OrLit 1932 col. 527 phonet. impossible and semant. unnecessary

Name: cʰal
Description: 5000 CHAL 'stumble, deceive'. [Connexion with √skhal, rejected by EWA i 405, is supported by Pk. chalia- 'tripped up' and *vicchalati 'stumbles']

Description: 5043 chidrá 'torn asunder' RV., 'having holes, pierced' KātyŚr., 'leaky' MBh., n. 'slit, cleft, hole' VS. [~ *chilla-¹

Name: cʰilihiṇḍa
Description: 5050 chilihiṇḍa m. 'a partic. kind of creeper' Bhpr.

Description: 5051 *chilla¹ 'torn, cut'. 2. 'hole'. [< *chidla- ~ chidrá- 'torn' RV., n. 'slit, hole' VS. and to be separated from, though influenced by, *chilla-²

Name: *cʰilla
Description: 5052 *chilla² 'skin, rind'. [Perh. of similar non-Aryan origin as challi- and *chōll- and to be separated from verbs 'to cut, peel' s.v. *chilla-¹]

Name: cʰuccʰundari
Description: 5053 chucchundari m. 'musk-rat' Yājñ., chucchū̆ndara- m. Suśr. [cucundarī- f., cuñcu- m., śuṇḍi-mūṣikā- f., gandha-śuṇḍinī- f. lex.; chucchu- m. 'a kind of animal' VarBr̥S. Variant forms of Sk. and NIA. support Drav. origin DED 2190]

Name: cʰup
Description: 5054 CHUP 'touch'. [Derivation by P. Tedesco Or. Lit. 1932, 534 < sśr̥p- metath. of spr̥ś- receives some support from the Pk. variants chuvaï, chivaï, chavēi. But more prob. it is a deriv. (with generalized ch-) of *sqeup- in OEng. sceofan, scufan and Khot. (S. Konow, Saka Studies 181) sku- 'to touch', skuta 'touch' if < *squp-, *squpti-

Name: *cʰupp
Description: 5058 *chupp 'cover, hide'. 2. *chōpp-. [For list of poss. enlargements of IE. *sqeu- see √sku; but cf. *chapp- and *chipp-]

Name: cʰurayati
Description: 5060 churayati 'strews' Kād. 2. chōrayati 'removes, throws away, abandons' BHSk. [NiDoc. and Sh. attest ch-, but Phal. c̣h- < kṣ- supports Tedesco's assumption of *kṣur- < *skur- ~ {s}kr̥̄- JAOS 73, 78

Name: cʰēka
Description: 5061 chēka 'clever, shrewd' lex. [Deriv. by H. Berger Zwei Probleme der mittel-indischen Lautlehre 70 < *śaikva- ~ śikvá- 'skilful' AV., śíkvan- RV., śíkvas- 'able' RV. (not otherwise preserved in MIA. or NIA., with chēka- already in Pa.), though phonet. possible, is very doubtful]

Description: 5067 chēdayati 'causes to cut off' Mn., 'cuts off' ŚāṅkhŚr. [√chid]

Name: *cʰōṭṭa
Description: 5071 *chōṭṭa 'small'. [→ Ir. Zebaki čuṭ 'small' Rep¹ 79. Cf. Pk. chōḍi- f. 'small' (< *chōṭa- ?): for other poss. connections in IA. see *culla-²]

Name: *cʰōll
Description: 5073 *chōll 'to peel, skin'. [← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 141, but cf. also challi- and *chilla-²]

Name: jagʰána
Description: 5077 jaghána m.n. 'hinder part, hip and loins, mons veneris' RV.

Description: 5078 jágat 'moving, living' RV., n. 'men and animals' RV., 'the world' ŚBr. 2. jágatī- f. 'female animal' RV. [√gam]

Description: 5082 jáṅghā f. 'shank (ankle to knee)' RV., ratha-jaṅghā- f. 'part of a chariot' lex.

Name: *jatugʰara
Description: 5094 *jatughara 'house plastered with lac and other combustible materials for burning people alive in'. [Cf. jatugr̥ha- n. MBh

Description: 5095 *jatta 'hair'. 2. *jatra-. 3. *jacca-. [For list of poss. connected words see jáṭā-]

Description: 5102 janáyati 'causes to be born' AV., 'begets' ŚBr. [jánati 'begets' RV

Description: 5105 janítra n. 'origin, birthplace' RV., 'procreative matter' VS., pl. 'parents' AitBr. 2. *jantra- [√jan]

Name: jāŋgala
Description: 5177 jāṅgala 'arid, sparingly grown with trees' Mn., jaṅ- gala- adj. and m. 'desert region' lex. 2. '*pertaining to a desert region'. [Variant in S. jhaṅgu m. 'jungle' ~ Pk. jaṅgā- f. 'pasture land' supports non-Aryan origin PMWS 140. Except in Or. it appears everywhere as a substantive in the form proper to the EP. and WH. area viz. jaṅgala- with ā shortened and not subsequently re-established.]

Name: ḍī
Description: 5554 ḌĪ 'fly'. [Replacement of √dī¹ (RV.) by ḍī- in Epic from MBh. onwards is attributed by Bloch IA 57 and BSOS v 4 to contamination with dru-, drā- 'run'. (Cf. uddrāvá- m. 'going upwards' Pāṇ., *uddrāti in Kt. vudra- 'to fly', &c.). Mayrhofer EWA i 460 prefers influence of cmpd. *niẓ-ḍī- (cf. *nīḍāti beside *nirdāti) doubted by J.Wackernagel KZ 67, 161 owing to infrequent occurrence of this cmpd. The forms most frequent and widespread in MIA. and NIA. are from uḍḍī-, which is perh. for *ūḍī- (cf. Pa. niḍḍāyati beside *nīḍāti) < *uẓḍī- < *udz-dī-]

Name: *dāṁṣṭra
Description: 6250 *dāṁṣṭra 'fang, tusk, beard'. [dáṁṣṭra- n. 'tusk, fang' RV., daṁṣṭrā- f. Pāṇ. MBh.; daṁṣṭrikā- f. 'tusk, beard' lex.; dāḍhā- f. 'tusk' lex., dāḍhikā- f. 'beard' Mn., dāḍaka- m. 'tooth' lex. Semant. development 'fang — tusk — beard' is possible (Rivet BSL 83, 143). But MIA. dāṭhā- < daṁṣṭrā- is phonet. difficult. On the other hand *dāṁṣṭra- (with vr̥ddhi-formation meaning 'pertaining to or collection of fangs' (cf. A. dār below) > 'fang', cf. Wackernagel AiGr ii 2, 130 and 132) would in MIA. become NWPk. *dāṭṭha- (in S. P. WPah. below), central daṁṭha-, daṭṭha-, amg. dāṭha-, dāḍha- (with simplification of consonant-group after orig. IA. long vowel), spread of which at the cost of daṭṭha- was favoured by clash of the latter with daṭṭha- < daṣṭa- and dr̥ṣṭá-. Possibility of further Drav. (J. Bloch BSOS v 741) or Mu. (PMWS 63) influence cannot be excluded

Kāś. 4. dhvasta- 'fallen, destroyed' R., 'scattered, covered' MBh. 5. dhvaṁsayati 'scatters, destroys' TBr., 'violates (a woman)' Kathās. 6. *dhvāsayati. 7. *dhvāsa-. 8. *dhvāsana-. [Forms of S. with ḍr- (and poss. of L. P. with ḍh- which may however owe their retroflex to anal. pp. ḍhaṭṭha-) are prob. < MIA. dhas- with unexpl. 'intrusive' r, rather than < √dhras 'glean, throw up', Pa. dhasati (caus. dhāsēti) 'gleans' Saddanīti Dhātumālā 1645. Forms of S. L. P. with ḍ{r}- may be due to dissimilation with following -h- (< -s-) or ṭṭh (which replaced tth). In L. P. ḍhah, ḍah, ḍha may be variant spellings for ḍ followed by a vowel with low-rising-low tone. L. dassaṇ can be for dhassaṇ after ḍahaṇ; but d- forms appear also in N. OAw. and H. Are these loans from NW or has another wordgroup (*draśati, *draṣṭa-, &c.) collided with dhváṁsati &c.

Name: pādú
Description: 8075 pādú m. 'foot (?)' RV. 10, 27, 24. [It is difficult to ascribe the persistent occurrence of u and v in the word for 'foot' and many derivatives only to incorporation of a final -u resulting from pādō nom. sg. of pā́da-. On the other hand pādú- (cf. *padu-), though occurring only once in RV. prob. as 'foot' and once in MānGr̥. as 'place', does give pā́dukā- 'shoe' known to Pāṇini and pāduka- 'little foot' in Pali. Nevertheless it remains doubtful whether all or indeed any of the NIA. words listed below descend from pādú- rather than pā́da-

Name: pā́dukā
Description: 8076 pā́dukā f. 'shoe, slipper' MBh., pādū́- f. lex. [Cf. pādū̆kr̥t- 'shoemaker' Rājat

(cf. prāsyati 'lays a wager' TāṇḍBr. and prāsa-). It does not appear in any language differentiating pr- from p- or -s- from -ś-. Moreover the meaning 'lump of metal' in N. H. M. may indicate a different origin]

Description: 8143 *pikāla 'day'. [For ápi in an expression of time cf. apiśarvarám 'early in the morning' RV

'bunch of grass' Gobh., °la- n. lex., piñjulá- n. PārGr̥., piñjūlī- f. Kauś., (with darbhá-) °lá- n. MaitrS., piñjīlá- n., puñjīla- n. TS

Description: 8154 picchā f. 'scum of boiled rice' Pāṇ., 'slimy saliva' Car., 'gum of Bombax heptaphyllum' lex. [Cf. *piccikā-, piccaṭa-

'basket, bag', °ṭī- f., °ṭaka- m. lex. 3. *pēṭṭa-¹. 4. *pēṭṭāra-. 5. *pōtta-⁴. 6. *pōttha-³ [Non-Aryan, though PMWS 145 denies identity with *pēṭṭa- 'belly'. Derivation < *pr̥ṣṭa- 'woven' (P. 'any fleshy swelling, esp. calf of leg' Yājñ. (cf. piṇḍilá- 'having large calves' lex. and → Psht. paṇḍaī 'calf of leg' EVP 57). [For 'lump' see also piḍaka-, *pēṇḍa-, *pēṇḍha-, *pēḍa-, *pēḍha-, *pēnda-, *pēntha, *puṇḍa-, *pōdda-, *pōnda-. This variety of phonetic form suggests non-Aryan (← Mu. PMWS 142, 162; ← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1946, 23) rather than IE. origin EWA ii 275. P. Thieme's derivation < *piṁṣṭa- (ZDMG 93, 133) is phonetically unacceptable]

Description: 8181 pittá n. 'bile' AV. [~ pīta-²: cf. pittala- 1 and 2 ~ pītala-¹ the NIA. forms of which show some inconsistencies. Prob. with PMWS 92 ← Mu. rather than with T. Burrow BSOAS xi 345, xii 385 ← Drav. See EWA ii 292]

Name: pítriya

Description: 8189 *pitriyajāni 'wife of one of father's family'. [pítriya-, jāni-]

Description: 8195 *pidda 'a small bird'. [Cf. pidvá- m. 'some kind of animal' VS.?]

Name: pipīlá
Description: 8201 pipīlá m. 'ant' RV., °laka- m. 'large black ant' ChUp., pipī́likā- f. 'small red ant' AV., pīlaka- m. 'ant' lex. 2. *piphīla-. 3. *pippīla-. 4. *pipphīla-. 5. *pippīḍa-. 6. *pilīla-. [Variety of MIA. and NIA. forms for 'ant' may be due partly to its (unknown) nonAryan origin (EWA ii 285), partly to contamination with kīṭá- and kŕ̥mi-, but mainly to some sort of taboo for a noxious insect. Although there appear to be six main types, not all NIA. forms can be grouped exactly under them]

Name: píppakā
Description: 8204 píppakā f. 'a species of bird' VS., pippīkā- f. VarBr̥S.

'berry' AV., 'peppercorn, Piper longum' R., pippali- f. Āpast. [Prob. of nonAryan origin EWA ii 285: cf. piplu- from a similar source?]

Description: 8207 pippalanagara m. 'name of a town' LM 368. [píppala, nagará-]

Name: *pilla
Description: 8214 *pilla 'small, child, young of animal', pillika- m. 'chicken' Mānas. [← Drav. Tam. piḷḷai DED 3449, LM 368]

Name: *pivr̩ddʰa
Description: 8215 *pivr̥ddha 'grown'. [Cf. abhivr̥ddha- MBh. (abhí in later Sk. often replaces ápi)

Description: 8237 pīnasa-, v.l. pin°, apīnasa- m. 'cold in the nose' Suśr. 2. *pināsa-. [pi ~ ápi, nás-¹: cf. apikakṣá- m. 'region of the armpits' RV., apikarṇá- n. 'do. of the ears' RV. Other more generally accepted derivations in EWA ii 293]

Derivation fr. *pr̥ñja- ~ pr̥ṇákti 'mixes, gives lavishly' RV. (ND 372 a 33) is very doubtful; so also connection with Mu. (PMWS 147). Cf. also pañji- and piñjā- which, even if not orig. connected, have to some extent collided with *pañja- in NIA.]

Name: puṭa

But with *pōṭṭa-¹ prob. non-Aryan (and poss. conn. with 'hollow' words having initial pō- s.v. *pōka-): ← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 111 or ← Mu. PMWS 148?]

Name: puṭakínī

[Formed from puṭaka-¹ (s.v. puṭa-) as 'with cup-shaped flower' or poss., like padminī- 'lotus plant' from padma-, from puṭaka-² 'lotus' lex. containing a *puṭa- ~ *puṇḍa- 'lotus' (sanskritized as puṇḍra- and in puṇḍari-) like pāṭala- 'pallid' (MW.) ~ pāṇḍú- with which they are perh. connected (J. C. W.)]

Name: puṇḍárīka

Name: puṇḍra
Description: 8259 puṇḍra¹ '*pale', m. '(white) lotus flower, (red variety of) sugarcane' lex. 2. pauṇḍra- m. 'straw-coloured sugarcane' Suśr. [Perh. hypersk. for puṇḍa- ('sectarian mark' lex.) beside puṇḍari- ~ pāṇḍú-, pāṇḍa- beside pāṇḍura-, pāṇḍara- ~ pāṭā́- ('a plant' AV.) beside pāṭalā̆- (for poss. connection with which see puṭakínī-) J. C. W.]

Name: puṇḍra
Description: 8260 puṇḍra² m. 'name of a people' AitBr., °aka- m. Mn. [Orig. 'light-skinned' and same as puṇḍra-¹? Cf. pāṇḍú-, pāṇḍa- ~ Pāṇḍu-, Pāṇḍa- (J. C. W.)]

Name: *putta
Description: 8264 *putta² 'insect', puttikā- f. 'white ant' Mn. (Sanskritized as putra-² m. 'small animal' Car., putraka-² m. 'id.' Suśr., 'grasshopper' lex.). 2. *puttala-², puttalikā-² f. Poss. there was an alternation *pr̥thuvī ~ *pr̥thavyāḥ like vásvī ~ vasavyàm, while pr̥thivī́- is a phonet. conditioned variant like púruṣa- beside *pūrṣa-, *puriṣa- and prátūrti- beside tīrṇá- (J. C. W.)

Hence hardly, against EWA ii 373, to prá+ √sthā in a sense 'prominent', and if conn. pr̥ṣṭhá- 'back' as ablaut variant, the sense 'ridge' of pr̥ṣṭhyā-, Germ. Description: 9020 prōṣṭhī f. 'the fish Cyprinus pausius' Bhpr., prōṣṭhikā- f. 'C. sophore' lex.

Name: prauḍʰa
Description: 9021 prauḍha (*pravuḍha-) 'full of' MBh., 'strong, full-grown, skilful' (prauḍhā- 'experienced mistress') Kāv. 2. prōḍha- Apte (prōḍham Pāṇ.gaṇa?). 3. *pravuḍḍha-. [< *prabr̥{ḍ}ḍha- (cf. páribr̥ḍha- 'strong' ŚBr.: *br̥ḍḍha- poss. in *buḍḍha-²) X právr̥ddha- and further infl. by non-Aryan *pravaḍra- (and vīḷú- 'firm' RV.?)

Name: plakṣá
Description: 9022 plakṣá m. 'Ficus infectoria' AV., 'F. religiosa, Thesperia populneoides' lex., prakṣá- (in etymological exegesis) TS. 2. plā́kṣa- 'belonging to F. infectoria' TS., m. 'its fruit' lex. 3. parkaṭī- f., °ṭin- m. 'F. infectoria' Hit. 4. *parkuṭī-. [The theory (EWA ii 221 with lit.) that parkaṭī- is sanskritization of a MIA. *pakkha-ḍa- < prakṣá- would unite all the NIA. words, but does not account for the absence of aspiration in B. Or. Bhoj. H. M. On the other hand parka-ṭī- is poss. a genuine ablaut variant: IE. *perkṷ-u- in *parku-ṭī- (replaced by parkaṭī- with commoner ending?), Lat. quercus 'oak': *prekṷ-s- in prakṣá-: *pr̥kṷ- in OHG. forha 'pine' IEW 822 (J. C. W.). In this case the aspiration of the H. P. M. words < parkaṭī- might be due to collision with *pakkha- < prakṣá-]

Name: *plavantī
Description: 9025 *plavantī 'waterfowl'. [Pres. part.: cf. plavá- m. 'a kind of aquatic bird' VS

Name: plāvayati
Description: 9027 plāvayati 'causes to float, inundates' KātyŚr. 2. *plavayati. 3. plāvita- 'flooded' MBh., plavita- n. 'swimming' Lalit. [√plu]

Name: plīhán
Description: 9028 plīhán (later plī́han-) m. 'spleen' AV., plīhā- f. lex., plihan- m. Yājñ. 2. *prīhan-. 3. *prahaka-. 4. *splīhan-. [See tila-³ and plúṣi- Add.]

Name: plúṣi
Description: 9029 plúṣi m. 'a partic. noxious insect, (prob.) flea' RV. 2. *pruṣi- 3. *pruci-. 4. *pricu-. 5. *priṣu-. 6. *praṣu- (or *prāṣu-: X prāśú- 'very quick' RV.??). [Variety of forms due to alteration, throu h taboo, of the name of a noxious insect, as in other IE. languages EWA ii 386 with lit

Name: plúṣyatē
Description: 9030 plúṣyatē 'is burnt, is scorched' Suśr., plúṣyati Dhātup. 2. pluṣṭa- 'burnt' R̥tus. [√pluṣ]

Name: plōta
Description: 9031 plōta m. or n. (?) 'cloth, bandage' Suśr. [Cf. plōti- f. 'thread' Divyāv.; prōta- n. 'woven cloth' lex

Name: *plōtra
Description: 9032 *plōtra 'boat'. [pōta-³ m. 'boat' MBh. is MIA. (amg.?) < *plōtra- (EWA ii 346 < *plavata-), pōtāra- m. or n. BHSk. < *plōtr̥-

Name: *pʰakk
Description: 9035 *phakk² 'deceive'. 2. phakkikā- f. 'proposition' Naiṣ., '(in logic) statement to be refuted, sophism, fraud' lex. [Cf. phakkati 'propounds a statement to be refuted' Dhātup., 'acts wrongly' lex

Name: pʰakka
Description: 9037 phakka m. 'cripple' lex. 2. *phikka- 'defective'. [Cf. *phaṇṭa-, *phatta- (*phadda-, *phutta-), *phucca-, *phissa-, *baggha-, list s.v. *bukka- ⁴, and phalgú-³]

Name: *pʰaṭ
Description: 9038 *phaṭ¹ 'sudden movement'. 2. *phaṭṭ-¹. [Cf. pháṭ interj. 'crack!' AV. -spháṭati 'breaks, tears' Dhātup. prob. hyper-sk. for ph-]

Name: *pʰaṭ
Description: 9039 *phaṭ² 'cheat'. 2. *phaṭṭ-². [Cf. phaṭā 'a cheat' lex. (← NIA. cf. B. below?) and similar meanings s.v. *phakk-²; sphaṇṭayati, sphiṇ°, sphuṇ° 'mocks' Dhātup.]

Name: pʰaṭa
Description: 9040 phaṭa n. 'expanded hood of snake' MBh. 2. *phēṭṭa-². [Cf. phuṭa- m., °ṭā- f., sphuṭa- m. lex., °ṭā- f. Pañcat. (Pk. phuḍā- f.), sphaṭa- m., °ṭā- f., sphōṭā- f. lex. and phaṇa-¹. Conn. words in Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 386]

Name: pʰaṇa
Description: 9042 phaṇa¹ m. 'expanded hood of snake (esp. of cobra)' MBh. 2. *phēṇa-². [Cf. phaṭa-, *phēṭṭa-² and *phaṇati²

Name: *pʰaṇati
Description: 9045 *phaṇati² 'swells, rises, boils'. [Cf. phaṇá-², phḗna-, phēṇa- 'froth'; phaṇa-¹, *phēṇa-², phēna-², phaṭa- 'expanded hood', phāṇḍin- 'name of serpent demon' lex.; perh. also phāṇayati², phāṇṭá- s.v. phāṇita-; PMWS 163 associates phā̆ṇḍa- 'belly' with phaṭa-

Name: pʰála
Description: 9051 phála¹ n. 'fruit' RV., '*grain' (in suphálā ep. of furrow RV.), 'seed of a fruit' Amar., 'spot on dice' MBh. [Cf. Tam. paṛam 'ripe fruit', Tel. paṇḍu 'to ripen', &c. DED 3299 (EWA ii 394). Perh. conn. phulla- and with other onom. 'expand, burst' words beginning with ph-

Name: pʰala
Description: 9052 phala² n. 'point of arrow' Kauś., 'blade of knife' MBh. 2. *phara-¹. [i.e. 'splitting' ~ phala-³ 'what is split'

Name: pʰala
Description: 9053 phala³ n. 'gaming board' MBh., phálaka-¹ n. 'board, lath, bench' ŚBr., phalahaka- n. 'board' Kathās. 2. *phara-². [Poss. same as phalaka-², phara-³

Name: pʰalaka
Description: 9054 phalaka² m.n. 'shield' MBh., phala-⁴ lex. 2. phara-³ n. lex., °aka- m. BHSk., sphara-, °aka- m. lex. [phalaka-² and phara-³ are hardly to be separated (despite EWA ii 392 f.), and are cognate with or ← Ir. spara- 'shield' and poss. identical with phalaka-¹, phala-³]

Name: pʰálati
Description: 9058 phálati² intr. 'splits, bursts' MBh. 2. phālayati tr. Gr. 3. phālita- 'expanded' MBh. [√phal]

Name: pʰalēndrā
Description: 9061 phalēndrā f. 'a species of rose-apple tree Eugenia jambolana' Bhpr. [phála-, índra-]

Name: pʰalgú
Description: 9062 phalgú¹ 'reddish, red' TS., f. 'red powder thrown at Holi festival' W., 'spring season' lex.

Name: pʰalgú
Description: 9064 phalgú³ 'small, pithless' VS., phalgvà- 'weak (of voice)' RV. [Poss. connexions in Drav. or Mu. EWA ii 396

Name: pʰálguna
Description: 9065 phálguna 'reddish' TS., 'born under the asterism phálgunī' AV., 'the month February-March' lex. [phalgú-¹]

Name: pʰāṇita
Description: 9070 phāṇita m.n. 'inspissated juice of sugarcane and other plants' Āpast., phāṇi- f. 'molasses, meal mixed with curds' lex. [Pp. of phāṇayati² 'skims' Lāṭy. (caus. of *phaṇati²?); cf. phaṇá- m. 'scum, froth' TBr., phāṇṭá- 'filtered' Ṛgvidh., n. 'first particle of butter in churning' ŚBr

Name: pʰā́la
Description: 9072 phā́la¹ m. 'ploughshare' RV., 'mattock' R. [Cf. phala-⁵ n. 'ploughshare' lex.: prob. conn. phálati². Poss. < *spāla- ~ Ir. *spāra- in Pers. supār, Sar. spur (EVP 68). If so, it may have been influenced by Mu. or Drav. to account for early ph- (cmpds. also show -ph-, not -pph-): EWA ii 397 with lit

Name: pʰālguná
Description: 9075 phālguná 'relating to the asterism phálgunī' ŚBr., m. 'the month February-March' Mn. [phalgú-¹]

Name: *pʰirati
Description: 9078 *phirati intr. 'moves, wanders, turns'. 2. *phērayati 'makes moves &c.' 3. *phēra- 'turn, turning'. [Cf. *pharati 'moves, turns' (with phálati³, phḗlati 'goes' Dhātup.). Poss. phar- and phir- are MIA. < *spar-, *spir- and belong to √spr̥ for which the basic meaning 'convey' (~ √pr̥) would account for the uses 'rescue (from: abl.)', 'help (towards: dat.)', 'attain, win' (cf. *sparati). With this Ir. *spar- (usu. attributed to Sk. sphuráti: Bartholomae AirWb 1613 for Av. spar- 'tread, hasten', Horn NPE 155) may be cognate in some of its meanings, e.g. Pers. sipardan 'to travel' (J. C. W.)]

Name: pʰuppʰusa
Description: 9090 phupphusa m. 'lungs' Suśr., phuphusa- n. ŚārṅgS., pupphusa- m. lex. [MIA. and NIA. show a, i or u in first two syllables, with or without a suffix -sa-, -ḍa-, -ra-. In P. Or. H. a similar word means 'swollen'. Prob. an onom. (or at least partially onom.) word connected with the sound of blowing or puffing (see phūt, *phūtka- and cf. phupphukāraka- 'panting' lex. EWA ii 398, pupphula- lex.) and with words for 'swelling' cf. prapyasá- AV. and puppuṭa- m. 'swelling of the gums and palate' Suśr. EWA ii 307

Name: pʰulla
Description: 9092 phulla 'expanded, blown (of flowers)' MBh., 'inflated (of cheeks)' Bālar., 'open' (in su-phulla- R.), n. 'fullblown flower' KālP. [NIA. shows basic mng. 'expanded, swollen' rather than 'split, burst' assumed in BR

Name: *pʰuss
Description: 9098 *phuss¹ 'be loose'. [Cf. *phass- on the one hand, and aspirated forms of *pusati on the other]

Name: *pʰēṭṭa
Description: 9107 *phēṭṭa¹ 'strip of cloth'. 2. *phēṇṭa-. [Cf. phuṭṭaka- n. 'a kind of cloth' BHSk., °ṭikā- f. Kathās.; paṭṭa-²]

Name: pʰēnikā
Description: 9110 phēnikā f. 'ground rice boiled in water' Bhpr., °naka- m., °nakā-, °nī- f. lex. [phḗna- ?]

Name: pʰēru
Description: 9112 phēru m. 'jackal' BhP., °rava- m. Mālatīm. 2. phēruṇḍa-, °raṇḍa- m. lex. 3. *phēu-. [Onom. cf. phēṭ-kāra-, phēt-k° m. 'howling' and bhēraṇḍa{ka}- m. 'jackal' BHS ii 412, Pa. bhēraṇḍaka- m.; Pk. bhēruṁḍa- m. 'leopard']

Name: baka
Description: 9115 baka- m. 'the bird Ardea nivea' Mn. [Prob. onom. in origin: hence retention of -kk-, -k-, -g- in MIA. and NIA. forms (as also in Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 387): see EWA ii 400 and W. Wüst IL Turner Jubilee Vol. i 336, 347]

Name: bakula
Description: 9116 bakula m. 'the tree Mimusops elengi', n. 'its flower' MBh. 2. vakula- m.n. MBh. 3. makula-¹, makura-¹ m. lex. [Prob. of same non-Aryan origin as Drav. words for this tree, e.g. Kan. pagaḍe, Tel. pogaḍa DED 3148

Name: *baggʰa
Description: 9120 *baggha 'defective'. [Cf. phakka- and other 'defective' words with initial b- s.vv. baṇḍá-, *bukka- ⁴]

Name: baṭu
Description: 9121 baṭu m. 'boy (esp. a young Brahman), term applied contemptuously to an adult' MBh., baṭuka- m. Kathās. [PMWS 99 of Mu. origin: prob. one of a group of 'defective' words, cf. *baḍu- s.v. baṇḍá- and *bēṭṭa-

Name: baḍiśa
Description: 9123 baḍiśa m.n. 'hook, fish-hook' MBh., baliśa-, bariśa-, vaḍiśa-, valiśa- lex., bilíśa- m.n. Suparṇ. [Of nonAryan, perh. Mu. (PMWS 94) origin]

Name: baṇḍá
Description: 9124 baṇḍá 'maimed (in hands, feet or tail)' AV., 'impotent' ŚrS.com. 2. *baṇḍha-. 3. *baḍu- (cf. baṭu-). 4. *baḍḍu-. 5. *baḍḍhu-. 6. *bāḍa-. 7. *bāṇṭa-. [Scarcely with P. Tedesco JAOS 65, 86 < vr̥ddha- 'cut', but one of a series of words with initial labial expressing a defect of body, mind or character, whether of Mu. (PMWS 95) or Drav. origin (T. Burrow BSOAS xii 387): cf. paṇḍá-, *phaṇṭa-, *bhaṇḍu-, vaṇṭa-². Of these at least vaṇṭa-² is poss. an IA. deformation of Indo-ir. *vanta- in Khot. vanda 'short', Bal. gwand, Par. γanȫ́kȫ IIFL i 256 (cf. kuṇṭha- ~ Pers. kund) associated with similar Mu. or Drav. words

Name: bádara
Description: 9125 bádara n. 'fruit of the jujube tree (Zizyphus jujuba)' VS., m. 'the tree' lex., badarī- f. 'the tree' ŚāṅkhŚr., °rikā- f. 'the fruit' Hit.

Name: bandī
Description: 9135 bandī f. 'captive slave-girl' Bhaṭṭ., bandin- m. 'captive' BhP. [Formed with f. suffix -ī- from *banda- ← MPers. bandaγ 'slave-girl' P. Thieme ZDMG 91, 88]

Name: bandʰá
Description: 9136 bandhá m. 'bond' RV., 'damming' MārkP., 'custody' Mn., 'deposit, pledge' Rājat., bandhaka- m. 'dam' lex. [√bandh]

Name: bándʰana
Description: 9140 bándhana 'tying' RV., n. 'bond, tether' ŚBr., 'prison' Mn., 'embanking' MBh. [√bandh]

Name: bandʰita
Description: 9142 bandhita 'caused to be bound, imprisoned for debt' Pāṇ.com. [√bandh]

Name: bandʰura
Description: 9145 bandhura¹ 'bent, rounded, beautiful' Kālid., 'deaf, injurious', m. 'vulva', °rā- f. 'harlot' lex. ['Defective' word: cf. *bhaṇḍu- and similar forms s.v. baṇḍá-

Name: bandʰūli
Description: 9146 bandhūli m. 'the flowering plant Pentapetes phoenicea', bandhu-² m. lex., bandhū́ka- m. Suśr., bandhula-², bandhura-² m. lex., bandhujīva- m. 'the plant', n. 'the flower' Suśr.

Name: *bappuḍa
Description: 9147 *bappuḍa 'wretched'. [Orig. an exclamation like the nursery words bāppa-, *bābba-]

Name: babbūla
Description: 9148 babbūla m. 'Acacia arabica' ŚārṅgP. 2. *babbhūla-. 3. *barvula-. [Other forms: babbula-, barbura- Subh., varvūra-, vavvōla- lex., vavūla- Madanav.]

Name: babʰrú
Description: 9149 babhrú 'reddish brown' RV., babhruká- 'brownish' ŚBr. (babhruśá- Pāṇ.gaṇa, babhluśá- VS.). 2. As name of an animal bábhruka- m. 'ichneumon' VS., babhru- m. MBh.

Name: bárkara
Description: 9153 bárkara m. 'kid, lamb' ĀpŚr., 'goat' lex., varkaraka- m. Yaśastil. [Cf. *barka-]

Name: *bardʰa
Description: 9156 *bardha 'shield'. [IE. *bherdho- (WP ii 163) in Anglo-Saxon bord 'shield' NTS ii 247 with (?)]

Name: barbara
Description: 9158 barbara² 'curly (of hair)' Kāṭh., barbarī- f. 'curly hair', °rīka- n. lex., barbarin- 'curly-haired' Pañcad.

Name: barbā
Description: 9159 barbā f. 'a species of Ocimum' lex. 2. barbarī- f. 'id.' Bhpr., barbara-³ or varvara- m. 'Clerodendrum siphonantus, Cleone pentaphylla, Unguis odoratus', barbarīka- n. lex.

Name: balā́kā
Description: 9168 balā́kā f. 'crane' VS., balāka- m. Gaut., balākikā- f. 'a small kind of crane' lex.

Name: balātkāra
Description: 9169 balātkāra m. 'violence' Kālid. [Sanskritization of MIA. balakkāra- (~ Pa. Pk. balakāra- m. 'violence') with -kk- after *balakkita- (sanskritized as balātkr̥ta- 'overpowered' MBh.) < balakr̥ta- (through *balakrita-) 'done by force' Mn

Name: balí
Description: 9171 balí m. 'tribute, offering' RV. [Cf. baliman- (in cmpd.) 'strength' ChUp., balyá- 'strengthening' Pāṇ? EWA ii 420 accepts 'Volksreligion' origin of balí-, but in RV. it is not an 'Art der Opferspende' but an offering conceived as a national tribute; the common factor of the Vedic and popular usages is 'offering of nourishment', hence perh. conn. bála- (J. C. W.)]

Name: balikarman
Description: 9172 balikarman n. 'offering oblations to all creatures' Gr̥S. [balí-, kárman-¹]

Name: balivárda
Description: 9176 balivárda (balīv° ŚBr.) m. 'ox, bull' TBr., balivanda- m. Kāṭh., barivarda- m. lex. [Poss. a cmpd. of balín- (cf. *balilla-) and a non-Aryan word for 'ox' (cf. esp. Nahālī baddī and poss. IA. forms like Sik. pāḍō 'bull < *pāḍḍa-: EWA ii 419 with lit.)]

Name: balihārá
Description: 9178a †balihārá- m. 'offer of tribute' AV., 'offer of oblation' Gr̥S. [Cf. balihŕ̥t- (RV.), °haraṇa- (Gr̥S.), balibhr̥t- (MBh.), balikr̥t- (AitBr.) 'offering tribute': balí-, hāra-¹]

Name: bálbaja
Description: 9179 bálbaja m. 'Eleusine indica (a coarse grass not liked by cattle)' TS., balbaja-stukā́- RV.

Name: baṣkáya
Description: 9181 baṣkáya ep. of vatsá- RV. i 164, 5: (Oldenberg) 'grown up', (Sāyaṇa) 'one year old'. 2. baṣkayiṇī-, °yaṇī- f. 'cow with a young calf' lex. [Cf. báṣkiha- VS., vá° MaitrS. 'having calved long since (?)'

Name: bahukāra
Description: 9188 bahukāra 'effecting much' VS. [bahukara- Pāṇ., m. 'sweeper' lex. (derisory hon. term? Cf. H. mehtar 'id.': see vardhana-²), bahukarā-, °rī- f. 'broom' lex

Name: bahutitʰá
Description: 9189 bahutithá 'manifold, many, much', °tham 'much, greatly' MBh. [Not cmpd. with títhi- (despite EWA i 501 with lit.). Numeral suffix -tha- (in katithá-: káti, katipayatha-: katipaya-) with *bahuti- cf. bahútaya- 'manifold' TS. Late katititha- after bahutithá wrongly divided (J. C. W.)

Name: bahutva
Description: 9190 bahutva n. 'abundance' MBh. [Development as an adjective is attested by Ko. mhop < MIA. *bahuppa-. But Pk. bahutta- was influenced as an adjective by pahutta- < prábhūta- (as bahūa- for bahua- by pahūa-)

Name: bahurūpá
Description: 9193a bahurūpá- 'variegated' VS., n. 'place-name in Kashmir' Rājat. [bahú-, rūpá-]

Name: bahulā
Description: 9195 bahulā f. pl. 'the Pleiades' VarBr̥S., °likā- f. pl. lex. [bahulá-]

Name: bahuvāra
Description: 9197 bahuvāra m. 'the tree Cordia myxa' Bhpr., °aka- m. Kull. [bahú-, vā́ra-¹?]

Name: bākula
Description: 9199 bākula 'pertaining to the tree Mimusops elengi' Suśr., n. 'its fruit' lex. [bakula-]

Name: bāṇá
Description: 9203 bāṇá (bā́ṇa- AV.) m. 'reed-shaft, arrow' RV. 2. vāṇá-¹ m. 'arrow, pipe', vāṇī́- f. 'reed' RV. [Cf. *vāṇa-²

Name: bāndʰavá
Description: 9208 bāndhavá m. 'kinsman (esp. maternal)' Mn., bāndhavī- f. 'female relative' Kathās. [bándhu-¹]

Name: *bāru
Description: 9213 *bāru 'betel leaf'. [← Austro-as. J. Przyluski BSL xxiv 257: cf. tāmbūlá-]

Name: bālá
Description: 9216 bālá 'young' Gr̥S., 'foolish' Mn., m. 'boy (under five years old)' Mn., °aka- adj. and sb. MBh., m. 'fool' lex., bālā- f. 'girl (esp. under sixteen years old)' Mn. [Despite the various etymologies listed in EWA ii 426, it perh. belongs to the 'defective' group s.v. baṇḍá- which proprovides, like other 'defective' groups, several words for 'child', e.g. *bāḍa- in Paš. bāṛā 'boy', bāṛī 'girl', *bāḍḍa- in G. bāḍuvā̃ 'poor simple little children': note esp. the meanings 'ignorant, fool' in Pa. Pk.]

Name: bālaputra
Description: 9220 bālaputra 'having children' MBh., °aka- m. 'a little son' Kathās. [bālá-, putrá-¹]

Name: bāṣpá
Description: 9223 bāṣpá m. 'tear, tears' MBh., 'vapour' R., bāṣpaka- m. 'steam' Suśr. 2. vāṣpá- Uṇ. iii 28. 3. *bhāṣpa-. 4. *bāṣma-. [Derivation from *varṣman- 'rain' (P. Tedesco, Language 22, 184 and accepted doubtfully in EWA ii 427) does not account for ā and early b- (which appears also in K. S. G. M. Si.) nor for the absence of meaning 'rain' in MIA. and NIA. The original form, attested poss. by Kaf. Paš. K. P. Or., may be *bāṣma-]

Name: *bāhurakṣa
Description: 9232 *bāhurakṣa 'protecting the arm'. [Cf. bāhurakṣā- f. 'armour for the upper arm' lex

Name: bī́bʰatsatē
Description: 9234 bī́bhatsatē 'feels aversion for, shrinks from' ŚBr. [bībhatsa- 'disgusting' ŚāṅkhBr., Pa. Pk. bībhaccha-, Pk. bīhaccha-

Name: bíḍāla
Description: 9237 bíḍāla m. 'cat' Mn., biḍālā- f. R., °laka- m. Cat., °likā- f. 'kitten' Subh., bilāla-, birāla- m. 'cat' lex. 2. *billa-.

Name: *biḍḍa
Description: 9238 *biḍḍa 'defective'. 2. *bēṭṭa-. 3. *bēḍa-. 4. *bēḍḍa-. 5. *bēṇḍa-. [Cf. nibiḍa-² 'crook-nosed' Kāś., 'low' Kād. and *bhēḍḍa- and viṭa-: see list s.v. *bukka- ⁴]

Name: bidala
Description: 9239 bidala n.(?) 'a half' (in bidala-saṁhita- 'composed of halves' AitBr., bidala-kārī́- f. 'woman who splits bamboos' VS.), vidala-¹ n. 'split bamboo' Mn. (vēṇu-vidala- Gaut.), 'split pea' Suśr. (masūra-vi° Rājat.). [Despite EWA ii 430 to be separated from vidalati 'rends' R. (vidala-² m. W., °lana- n. Kāv., °lita- Gīt., vidara- m. lex.) to the influence of which, however, it prob. owes its form with v-. Other contaminated forms

Name: bindú

Description: 9245 bíla¹ n. 'cave, hole, pit, opening' RV., billa- n. 'hole, reservoir' lex. 2. vila- n. BhP. 3. *vira-². [Variation of b- and v- and of -l-, -ll-, -r- and (if nibiḍá- 'dense' ~ virala- 'sparse' belongs or if, with basic mng. 'split' conn. viḍa- m. 'piece' W., bila- m.n. BHSk.) -ḍ- supports origin from Drav. word-group DED 4459, T. Burrow BSOAS xii 388. Conn. bilati, bēlayati, vē° 'splits' Dhātup.?]

Name: *bukka
Description: 9263 *bukka⁴ 'defective'. 2. *bugghara-. 3. *buṅka-. 4. *būkkhara-. 5. *bōkka-². 6. *bōkkha-. 7. *bōggha-. 8. *bōṅga-. [Other groups of 'defective' words with initial b-, bh- are *bucca-¹ (*būccara-, *bōcca-, *bōñca-), *buṭṭa-¹ (*buṭṭha-, *buḍḍha-, *buṇṭa-, *buṇṭha-, *būṭa-¹, *bōṭṭa-¹, *bōḍa-, *bōḍḍa-, *bōṇṭha-), *butta- (*buttha-, *buddha-², *buntala-, *bunda-, *bundha-², *bōtta-, *bōttha-, *bōdda-, *bōddha-, *bōntha-, *bōnda-), *bura- (*bōra-¹), *bulla- (*būla-), *bussa- (*būssara-), *bhukkhara- (*bhūkka-, *bhōṅka-), *bhucca- (*bhuccara-, *bhujjara-, *bhōcca-), *bhuṭṭa- (*bhuṭṭha-, *bhuḍa-, *bhuḍḍa-, *bhuṇṭa-, *bhuṇṭha-, *bhuṇḍa-¹, *bhōṭṭa-, *bhōḍa-, *bhōḍḍa-, *bhōṇṭa-, *bhōṇḍa-), *bhutta-² (*bhuttara-, *bhudda-, *bhuntha-, *bhunda-, *bhōtta-, *bhōttha-, *bhōdda-, *bhōntha-, *bhōnthara-, *bhōnda-), *bhōra-, *bhulla- (*bhōla-, *bhōlla-), *bhussa-¹ (*bhussara, *bhōssa-), *bēṅga-, *biḍḍa- (*bēṭṭa-, *bēḍa-, *bēḍḍa-, *bēṇḍa-), *bhēkka-¹ (*bhēṅka-, *bhēṅga-), *bhēḍa-², *bhēdda-, bhēla-² (*bhēlla-¹), *bhēsa- (*bhēsara-)
