Description: 9284 *bubhukṣaka 'hungry'. [For this type of desiderative adjective see Whitney SkGr § 1038

Name: *bōll
Description: 9321 *bōll 'speak'. [bahu-bōllaka- m. 'great talker' Divyāv. L. Schwarzschild JAOS 77, 205 derives Ap. vollaï 'speaks' from Pk. vayaï (< vádati and vákti) ~ vutta- (< uktá-, with o in inf. vottuṁ, fut. vocchami) after type ṇutta- ~ ṇollaï (< *nud-la- ?). If so, early appearance of b- in Pk. and BHSk. (only b- forms are attested in NIA.) may be due to collision with MIA. forms of brávīti in which abnormal sound-change in a word of 'saying' produced bēmi (< brávīmi), pres. part. beṁta-. Borrowing from Drav. word-group of Tam. vakuḷi DED 4256 (J. Bloch BSOS v 742) is very doubtful]

Name: bʰaktí
Description: 9338 bhaktí¹ f. 'possession' RV., 'worship, devotion' ŚvetUp., 'attribute' Nir., 'decoration' Hariv., 'arrangement' lex., '*form, manner'. [In senses 'decoration' and 'manner', bhakti- falls together with bhaṅgĭ̄-, °ga- (in cmpds.) 'ornament' Ragh. Kathās. and bhaṅgi- 'semblance, shape, manner, fashion' Kāv. From this association stems the nasal of Ap. and NIA

Name: bʰakti
Description: 9339 bhakti² f. 'part' AitBr., 'section' Lāṭy., 'analysis' Sāh. (cf. sūtraṁ bhanakti Siddh.). [√bhaj²]

Name: bʰakṣya
Description: 9344 bhakṣya 'eatable', n. 'food' Mn. MBh. [Cf. bhakṣá- m. RV., Pk. bhakkha- m. 'eating'

Name: bʰaga
Description: 9347 bhaga² m. 'vulva' Mn. [Associated with bhága-¹, but orig. belonging to a 'curved, crooked' word-group s.v. bhaṅgi- or more generally 'defective', cf. *bhēgga- ?]

Name: bʰaginī
Description: 9349 bhaginī f. 'sister' Mn., °nikā- f. Kathās. [J. Gonda AO xxi 23 supports derivation from bhaga-² 'vulva' (which, if it belongs to the 'crooked' or 'defective' word-groups of bhaṅgurá- or *vaṅka-², might with a variant *bagha- account for *baghinī- ~ bhaginī-). But EWA ii 460 sees in it more prob. the feminine of bhagín- as an expression of good wish — bhágaḥ kanī́nām of RV. i 163, 8 — to an unwed sister (note that in NIA. bhaginī- is usu. the younger sister). The transference of aspiration from the initial to the interior presents difficulty, unless as a conscious avoidance of similarity with bhaga-² 'vulva'. The argument in AO xxi 30 that no *baghinī- is attested and that therefore the transference could have occurred only at the stage bhaïṇī- is not conclusive that a form *baghinī- never in fact existed between the age of Aśoka and the first emergence of Pk. bahiṇī-. It is significant that in bhāginēya- no such transference occurred. The new bahiṇī- belonged to the Centre, the older bhaïṇī- remaining on the periphery in Dard., S., L., P., some WH. dialects, EA., Or., and Ko

Name: bʰaŋgurá
Description: 9358 bhaṅgurá 'crooked' (in bhaṅgurā́vant- 'having crooked ways' RV.), 'bent, curled' Kathās., m. 'bend in a river' lex. 2. 'fragile, breakable' Kāv. [Like bhaṅgi-, it belongs to a non-Aryan word-group (PMWS 88) for 'crooked, bent' in vaṅka-¹, vaṅkú-, vaṅkara-¹, perh. identical with more general 'defective' words s.v. *vaṅka-², cf. bhaṅgurá- ~ paṅgú-, paṅgula-. Mng. 'breakable' from association with bhaṅga-¹. Also bhaga-² 'vulva' (with poss. variation *bagha-, see bhaginī-) may belong here, either as 'bend, curve' or as general 'defective' word, such as in so many cases provides sexual terms]

Name: bʰájati
Description: 9359 bhájati¹ 'imparts' (bhájatē 'receives, enjoys') RV., 'practises' Mn., 'reveres, loves' MBh. 2. *bhajyati¹. 3. bhājáyati¹ 'imparts' RV., 'causes to enjoy' ŚBr., 'cooks (food)' Vop. [√bhaj¹]

Name: bʰajyátē
Description: 9361 bhajyátē 'is broken' AV. 2. bhagna-¹ 'broken, torn, defeated, lost' MBh., n. 'break of a bone' Suśr. 3. *bhājana-³ 'putting to flight'. [J. Bloch BSL xxxi 62, despite bhanakti 'puts to flight' MW. and Pk. bhaṁjāvia- 'put to flight', dissociates NIA. words meaning 'flee' from √bhañj and associates with IE. *bhegʷ- (Gk. φέβομαι 'I flee', &c., IEW 116) in (diśō)' bhājayat 'drove out' (see 3 below), (diśō) 'bhyabhajatām 'fled' Bhaṭṭ., diśōbhāga- 'fleeing' Pañcat. But in view of parallel semantic development of dīryátē, dīrṇá-, it is not necessary to assume a separate *bhajyati 'flees', pp. *bhagna-² which in any case would have coalesced completely with bhajyátē, bhagna-¹ from √bhañj]

Name: majján
Description: 9712 majján-, gen. maj{j}ñáḥ m. 'marrow, pith' RV., majjā́- f. ŚBr., majjas- n. Suśr. 2. *majjhra-. [The phonetic changes to explain the various forms in MIA. and NIA., summarized with lit. in EWA ii 550, are not entirely satisfactory, being all of an occasional, not regular, character: Pa. -iñj- < -ajj- (whereas normally -ajj- remains), metathesis of aspirate in bhejj- < mijjh- and development of e < i. Survival of an orig. IA. aspirate jjh < IE. zgh (P. Tedesco Lg 19, 18, JAOS 67, 88) has some additional support in Kal. But other agencies may have been at work: taboo, as with 'spleen' and 'liver', or contamination with other words, such as mḗdas- ~ bhejj-, N. mās (< māṁsá-) ~ māsi?]

'dwarfish girl' Gr̥S.). 7. *maḍḍa-. 8. *maṇṭa-. 9. *maṇṭha-. 10. *maṇṭhara-. 11. *maṇḍa-⁴. 12. *māḍa-¹. 13. *māḍha-. 14. *māṇa-. 15. *māṇḍha-. [Cf. other 'defective' word-groups with initial m-: *matthara- (*madda-, *maddha-, *manthara-, manda-, mandara-, *mandhyara-), malvá-, *mēṅga-¹, *mēcca-, *miḍḍa- (*miṇḍha-¹, *mēṭṭa-¹, *mēṇḍa-¹, *mēṇḍha-¹), *mitta- (*middha-, mindā́-, *mindha-, *mindhara-, *mīna-, *mēdda-¹), *mēssa-, mū́ka- (*mūga-, *mukka-², *mukkara-, *mugga-, *muṅga-, *mōkka-, *mōgga-), *muccha- (*mōccha-), *muṭṭa-¹ (*muṭṭha-¹, *muṭṭhara-, *muḍa-, *muḍḍa-, *muḍḍha-¹, *muṇṭa-, *muṇṭara-, muṇḍa-¹, *muṇḍha-, *muṇḍhara-, *mōṭṭa-¹, *mōṭṭha-, *mōṭṭhara-, *mōḍḍa-, *mōṇḍa-), *mutta- (*muttha-¹, *mutthara-¹, *munna-, *mōtthara-¹, *mōdda-¹, *mōddha-), *mussa-

Name: maṭʰa

Name: maḍaka

Name: maṇa

Name: maṇi
Description: 9732 maṇi² m. 'hump of camel' MBh., 'glans penis' Suśr., 'clitoris' lex., 'fleshy excrescence on a goat's neck' VarBr̥S., 'thyroid cartilege (= kaṇṭhamaṇi-), wrist' lex., maṇika- m. 'globular formation of flesh on an animal's shoulder' AitBr., maṇilá- 'having fleshy excrescences (e.g. on the dewlap)' TS. [Semantic development is prob. 'protuberance — Adam's apple — throat, neck', hence connexion with mányā- and (despite EWA ii 557) with maṇí-¹ is unlikely]

Name: maṇḍa
Description: 9737 maṇḍa⁶ 'some sort of framework (?)'. [In nau-maṇḍḗ n. du. 'the two sets of poles rising from the thwarts or the two bamboo covers of a boat (?)' ŚBr. (as illustrated in BPL p. 42); and in BHSk. and Pa. bōdhi-maṇḍa- n. perh. 'thatched cover' rather than 'raised platform' (BHS ii 402). If so, it may belong to maṇḍapá- and maṭha-]

Name: maṇḍapa

Name: máṇḍala
Description: 9742 máṇḍala n. 'disc' ŚBr., 'ball for playing' MBh., 'circle, district' AVPariś., adj. 'circular' VarBr̥S., maṇḍalaka- n. 'disc' Yājñ., °likā- f. 'group' Śiś. 2. *mandala-. 3. *maṇḍa-⁷ (in maṇḍacaravant- 'having a noose' BaudhŚr.?). 4. *manda-. [P. Tedesco's derivation (JAOS 65, 84) from *vr̥tta-la- is phonet. unacceptable. Variation of ṇḍ with nd, if the words in Bshk. Tor. K. for 'thigh' belong, supports non-Aryan origin, for which T. Burrow's proposal (BSOAS xii 389) of Drav. *mŏṇḍale (> Tam. muṭalai 'globe, ball') is attractive]

Name: maṇḍū́ka

Thieme's derivation (ZDMG 93, 135) as MIA. < *mr̥ṁṣṭa- is phonet. unacceptable

Name: maṣati
Description: 9919 maṣati '*rubs, crushes' ('hurts' Dhātup.). [Cf. maṣaṁ (v.l. °ṣiṁ) kārayati 'grinds to powder' ŚāṅkhGr̥., maṣmaṣā́karōti AV., masmasā́- TS. ŚBr., mr̥smr̥sā́° MS. (EWA ii 604 of onom. origin rather than with J. Bloch BSOS v 741 ← Drav., Kan. masagu 'to rub' &c., in DED 3779). K. with -h- indicates earlier -ṣ- or -ś-, which would allow collision with mr̥śáti 'grasps, seizes' AV. (Pa. only in cmpds. āmasati, parimasati) as the origin. Prob. in MIA. onom.(?) maṣ- and maś- (< mr̥śáti) collided, and were further influenced by Drav. forms. The variety of extensions in the NIA. verbs indicates their popular character and possible non-Aryan influences]

(Pischel PkGr 202) may point to a non-Aryan word for 'elephant-driver' which became associated with mahāmātra-: EWA ii 611

Name: mahilā́
Description: 9962 mahilā́ f. 'woman' Hit., °hēlā- Nalac., °hīlā-, mēhilā-, °halā-, °halī- lex. [mēh° forms X late MIA. *mehlā < mahilā- infl. perh. by forms of √mih² (cf. mahilā- 'amorous woman' Bhām., mēhanā- (= mahilā-) lex. How far mahilā́- and l- forms of MIA. and NIA. derive from Aś. mahiḍā- (Lüders PhilInd 559) is not certain. The forms of Bi. Mth. Aw. H. contain either -ḍ- or -l-, but S. with -r- indicates earlier -l-. If < *mahiṣ- in máhiṣī- 'chief wife' (note meaning as 'first wife' in Bi. below) ~ Khot. mijṣe' 'woman' < *mazišī, then -ḍ- of mahiḍā- and -l- of mahilā́- may independently derive from *mahiẓ- (H. W. Bailey BSOAS xiv 433, connecting mahī́lukā- f. 'cow' AV., v.l. mahilōkā- Paipp.). But rather mahīlā- (mahēlā-), *mahīlū- (mahī́lukā-, mahilōkā-), *mahīḍā- (mahiḍā-) are extensions of mahī́- '*female', 'cow' Naigh. lex. (mahī́ gaúḥ RV., mā̆hā- 'cow' lex., māhēyī- MBh.) which X máhiṣī- '*female' (Khot. mijṣe' 'woman'), 'buffalo cow' produce mahilā́-, mahiḍā- 'woman' and *mahīṣa- (Pa. mahīsa-, NWPk. mahēṣa-: see mahiṣá-) 'buffalo', *mahīṣī- (Pa. mahēsī- PTSD s.v. and agga-mahēsī-) 'wife' (J. C. W.)]

Name: *mātr̩tarā
Description: 10022 *mātr̥tarā 'stepmother'. [Cf. RV. mātŕ̥tama- 'very like a mother' RV. and Lat. matertera

Description: 10022a †mātr̥ṣvasēya- m. 'mother's sister's son' R., mātr̥ṣvasēyī- f. 'the daughter' MBh., mātr̥svasēyā- f. MW. [Cf. mātr̥ṣvasrīya- m. Pāṇ., svasrī́ya- 'sister's son' m. T.S., svasrīyā- f.

Name: mā́trā

Description: 10040 mā́na¹ m. 'wish' AitBr., 'pride' KauṣUp., n. 'honour' Mn., 'wounded honour, anger' Kāv. [√man]

Name: mā́na
Description: 10041 mā́na² 'measure, standard' RV., mānaka-² n. 'measure, weight', mānī- f. 'a partic. measure' lex., °nikā- f. 'a partic. weight (= 2 double handfuls)' Siddh., māṇikā- ŚārṅgS. [Cf. *māna-⁵ and maṇika- m. (n. lex.) 'waterpot' Gr̥S., maṇa- m. or n. 'grain measure' Col

Name: *māna
Description: 10044 *māna⁵ 'skin-bag'. [Cf. mr̥nmāna- 'earthen oil vessel (?)' Hem. (poss. sanskritization of maṇa- with mā́na-² q.v.) and Yid. munγο 'inflated sheepskin' IIFL ii 228]

Name: mānaka-
Description: 10045 mānaka-¹, māṇaka- m.n., māna-kanda- m. 'the edible arum (Arum indicum)' lex.

Name: mānavá
Description: 10048 mānavá-, f. °vī́- 'human', m. 'man' RV., māṇavá- m. 'youth, little fellow' Kāty., °vaka- m. Gobh. [-ṇ- early MIA. change or poss. infl. by 'defective' word *māṇa- s.v. group *maṭṭa-

Name: māma
Description: 10055 māma m. 'uncle' Pañcat., °aka- m. lex. [Nursery word: similar words in Drav. DED 3945]

Name: mā́yatē
Description: 10059 mā́yatē mā́ti 'measures' Dhātup. [Cf. mímītē 'measures' RV., 'corresponds in measure, is large enough for' BhP., 'is contained in' Kāv

Description: 10060 māyā́ f. 'supernatural power, skill' RV., 'illusion' ŚBr., 'fraud, compassion' lex.

Description: 10062 māyu m.n. 'gall' lex., māyin- m., māyikā- f., māyāphala- n., māyiph° n. 'gall-nut' lex. [Pers. māzū 'gall-nut' (Laufer 367) prob. lw. in some NIA. forms]

Name: māra
Description: 10063 māra m. 'death' VarBr̥S., 'killing' Rājat., °rī- f. 'killing, pestilence' BhP., °raka- m. 'plague' lex., °rikā- f. BhP. [NIA. words meaning 'striking, blow' are associated with verbal forms < māráyati rather than directly derived < māra-

Description: 10064 māraka at end of cmpds. 'killing' Kathās. (m. 'god of death' Śaṁk.) [√mr̥]

Name: mārga

Description: 10076 mārgaśiras m. 'the month November-December' ŚāṅkhŚr.com., °śira- m. BhP. [mārgaśīrṣá- m. Kauś

Name: mārjāra
Description: 10083 mārjāra² m. 'Plumbago rosea, Terminalia katappa, Agati grandiflora' lex.

Name: *mārtta
Description: 10085 *mārtta 'earthen'. 2. mārttika- 'earthen' MānŚr., n. 'lump of earth' Bhām., m.n. 'earthen pot' Gr̥Śr. [S. L. WPah. poss. < *martta-

Name: mā́rtsna
Description: 10086 mā́rtsna 'finely ground' ŚBr. [mr̥tsná- m. 'powder' Suśr. -masiná- 'finely powdered' lex., masr̥ṇa- 'soft, tender' Kāv. are sanskritized forms of MIA. and not with J. Bloch BSOS v 741 ← Drav. (see maṣati): EWA ii 605 with lit

Name: māláŋga
Description: 10089 māláṅga 'epithet of hornless goat' TS., Kāṭh. = mahākāya- Sāyaṇa. [Cf. mālaka- s.v. *māḍa-²?]

Name: mālava
Description: 10090 mālava m. 'name of a country' AVPariś. 2. mālavīya- 'relating to that country' Kathās.

Name: mālaśrī
Description: 10091 mālaśrī f. 'name of a rāginī', mālavaśrī- f. Saṁgīt.

Name: mā́lā
Description: 10092 mā́lā f. 'wreath, garland' Gr̥S., mālikā- f. lex. [← Drav., Tam. mālai 'wreath' &c. DED 3954, EWA ii 628 with lit. Derivation from *vr̥tman- (P. Tedesco JAOS 67, 87) is phonet. unacceptable]

Name: mālākāra
Description: 10093 mālākāra m. 'garland-maker, gardener' MBh., °rī- f. VarBr̥S. [mā́lā-, kāra-¹]

Name: mālin
Description: 10094 mālin 'garlanded' Āpast., m. 'gardener' Col., mālika- m., mālinī- f. 'his wife' Pañcat. [mā́lā-]

Name: mālya
Description: 10095 mālya n. 'garland' Gr̥Śr. [S. L. P. point to *mālyā- (other NIA. forms being ambiguous in respect of gender) unless with MIA. -ll- < mā́lā- (as Pk. tella- < tailá-): but Or. Aw. distinguish between mā́lā- and mālya-

Name: māṣa
Description: 10098 māṣa² m., °aka- m.n. 'a partic. weight of gold' Mn., 'a copper coin' Kauṭ. [Same as mā́ṣa-¹]

Name: māṣika
Description: 10102 māṣika in cmpds. 'worth so many māṣas' e.g. pañca-māṣika- Mn. [māṣa-²]

Name: māṣya
Description: 10103 māṣya 'fit for beans' Pat., n. 'field of beans' W. [mā́ṣa-¹]

Name: mā́sara
Description: 10106 mā́sara n. 'a mixture of yeast and grapes &c. in water in which rice and millet have been boiled' KātyŚr., 'rice gruel' lex.

Description: 10113 māhiṣa 'of or coming from a buffalo' Pāṇ., māhiṣaka- m. 'buffalo-keeper' lex. [mahiṣá-]

Name: *micc
Description: 10118 *micc 'close the eyes, blink'. [Cf. Khot. nä-mäjs- 'to blink', Bal. mičāč 'eyelids', Russ. migatĭ 'to blink', Kur. mīnxnā 'to close the eyes' DED 3693, and *miṭṭ- 'to close the eyes', Kan. miṭakisa 'to blink' DED 3969; further miṣánt- 'with open eyes' RV., √mīl in sáṁ mīlya 'with closed eyes' RV. A non-Aryan or widespread onom. word, scarcely (like Lat. micāre 'to sparkle', Tam. mĩcu 'to flash') to be assigned to a common IE. root (J. C. W.)]

Name: *mitta
Description: 10122 *mitta 'defective'. 2. middha- n. 'drowsiness' BHS ii 432. 3. mindā́- f. 'bodily defect, blemish' TS. 4. *mindha-. 5. *mindhara-. 6. *mīna-². 7. *mēdda-¹ (X mḗḍhra- (mēṇḍhra- BhP.) n. 'penis' AV. in mēdra- n. 'penis, lower belly' Apte). [Cf. *miḍḍa- and see list s.v. *maṭṭa-

Name: mitʰyācāra
Description: 10131 mithyācāra m. 'improper conduct, wrong treatment' Suśr., 'acting falsely' Bhag. [mithyā́, ācāra-]

Name: mī́lati
Description: 10143 mī́lati intr. 'closes (of eyes)' BhP., mīlayati tr. 'closes (eyes, flowers)' BhP. [sáṁ mī́lya 'with closed eyes' RV

Name: mukuṭa
Description: 10144 mukuṭa m.n. 'tiara, crest, point, head' MBh., makuṭa- Divyāv. [← Drav., Tam. mukaṭu 'top' &c., DED 4002; mauli- m.f. 'diadem, etc.' MBh. is MIA. (cf. EWA ii 694)]

Name: mukula
Description: 10146 mukula n. 'bud' Suśr., makula-² n. lex. 2. mukura-, makura-² n. lex. 3. *bakula-². [Cf. similar interchange of initial in bakula-¹

Name: mukulayati
Description: 10147 mukulayati '*blossoms'. 2. *mukurayati. 3. mukulāyatē. [mukulayati (tr.), °lāyatē (intr.) 'closes (like a bud)' Kāv., °litá- R., °lāyita- Kāv. 'having blossoms', mukurita- 'id.?' Pāṇ.gaṇa

Name: mukuṣṭʰa
Description: 10148 mukuṣṭha-, °aka- m. 'a kind of bean' lex., mukuṣṭa- m. BHSk., makuṣṭa-, °aka- m. 'Phaseolus aconitifolius', mapaṣṭa-, °aka- m. 'a kind of bean, mapuṣṭ{h}aka-, mayu° m. lex. 2. *makusta-. [mudgaṣṭha- m. lex. (with same variation of -k- ~ -dg- as in mukula-) cf. mudgá- and *maṭṭha-³]

Name: *mukka
Description: 10150 *mukka¹ 'blow with fist'. [Prob. ← Drav., Prj. muṭka 'blow with fist', Kur. muṭkā 'fist', DED. 4041]

Name: muktā

Name: muktājāla
Description: 10153 muktājāla n. 'an ornament of pearls' MBh. [muktā-, jā́la-]

Name: *muktāsarikā
Description: 10153a †*muktāsarikā- f. 'string of pearls'. [Cf. muktāsraj- f. lex., mauktikasara- m. Nalac. both ← MIA.

Name: mukʰacandra
Description: 10161 mukhacandra m. 'moon-like circle of face' Bhartr̥. [múkha-, candrá-]

Name: mukʰāgra
Description: 10170 mukhāgra n. 'extremity of a snout or nose, any extremity' lex. [múkha-, ágra-]

Name: múkʰya
Description: 10174 múkhya 'pertaining to face or mouth' AV., 'chief' TS. [múkha-]

Name: mucalinda
Description: 10177 mucalinda-, mucilinda- m. 'the tree Pterospermum suberifolium' lex., muculinda- m. R., nicula- m. 'Barringtonia acutangula' R., nicōla- m. Car. 2. mucukunda- m. 'P. suberifolium' lex.

Name: múñja
Description: 10184 múñja m. 'the grass Saccharum sara or munja' ŚBr., muñjaka- m. VarBr̥S., muñjā- in cmpd. MBh.

Name: muṭáti
Description: 10186 muṭáti '*twists' ('kills, grinds' Dhātup.) 2. mṓṭati (v.ll. mṓḍati, múṇṭati, múṇḍati) Dhātup., mōṭayati 'kills' Mr̥cch., gala-mōṭana- n. 'strangling' Śukas., aṅguli-mōṭana- n. 'snapping of fingers' lex. 3. *mōṭyatē 'is twisted'. 4. *muruṭati, *murōṭati. [Cf. mū́ta- m.n. 'woven basket' TBr., mū̆ṭa-, mōṭa-¹, mūtōḍī (Pa. mū̆tōḷī-, v.l. mū̆ṭōlī- with which compare *murōṭati above) 'basket, bundle' BHSk. ← Drav. (Tam. muṭai 'to plait, braid' DED 4036, mūṭai 'bundle' DED 4134 prob. unconnected with muṭai). Partly (cf. galamōṭana-) collides with muṭáti 'ākṣēpē, pramardanē' Dhātup.← Drav. (Tam. muṭṭu 'to dash against' DED 4041) and poss. infl. by √mr̥d (see múṇṭati). Cf. also *mōṭa-² 'wicker stool' (J. C. W.)

Name: muṇḍa
Description: 10191 muṇḍa¹ 'shaved, bald, lopped' MBh., 'hornless' VarBr̥S., 'blunt' Kathās., m. = °aka- m. 'trunk of lopped tree' lex. [Prob. of Drav. origin (A. Master BSOAS xii 354) with coalescence of two Drav. wordgroups (DED 4199, 4200); less likely Mu. connexions (J. Przyluski BSL xxx 199, PMWS 102). Not with P. Thieme ZDMG 93, 134 < *mr̥ṁṣṭa- nor with P. Tedesco JAOS 65, 82 < vr̥ddha-² 'cut'. In IA. it forms part of 'defective' word-group s.v. *muṭṭa-¹ with all variations characteristic of such groups

Name: mudgá

Name: mudrā́
Description: 10203 mudrā́ f. 'seal, signet-ring' MBh. [Prob. ← Ir. EWA ii 654]

Name: mudʰā
Description: 10205 mudhā 'in vain, to no purpose' MBh. [Scarcely with P. Tedesco JAOS 73, 83 MIA. form of vŕ̥thā. Cf. *mōddha- 'defective' s.v. *mutta- ?]

Name: *munāti
Description: 10206 *munāti¹ 'knows', muṇáti 'pratijñānē (perceives, recognizes?)' Dhātup. [Cf. Pa. Dhātumālā √mun 'ñāṇē'; fut. mōnissaṁ; Vimānavatthu com. munana- n. = paricchindana-; RV. múni- m. 'inspired sage', Br̥ĀrUp. 'viditvā munir bhavati'. (J. C. W.)

Name: *munāti
Description: 10207 *munāti² 'drives'. [Cf. āmīvati 'pushes, presses, TBr., nimī́vantī- f. pres. part. 'pressing down' AV., prámīvati 'pushes on, instigates' ŚBr. TS., kā́mamūta- 'impelled by love' RV

Name: muraŋgī
Description: 10209 muraṅgī-, °ruṅgī- f. 'Moringa pterygosperma'. [← Drav., Tam. muruṅkai etc., DED 4085]

Name: muraja
Description: 10210 muraja m. 'tambourine' MBh., °jā- f. 'large drum' lex. [← Drav., Tam. muracam etc., DED 4076

Name: *murati
Description: 10211 *murati¹ 'crushes, rubs'. 2. *mulati. [Cf. perf. subj. mumurat RV., pass. mūryátē ŚBr., múr- m. 'destroyer' RV

Name: murala
Description: 10213 murala m. 'a kind of fresh water fish' Suśr.

Name: muralī
Description: 10214 muralī f. 'flute, pipe' lex. [← Drav., Tam. muraḷi &c., DED 4076

Name: muṣ
Description: 10216 muṣ in cmpds. 'stealing' MBh., f. 'theft' MW. [muṣīván- m. 'thief' RV

Name: muṣṭigraha
Description: 10221a †muṣṭigraha- m. 'holding with one hand' Harav. [muṣṭí-, gráha-]

Name: músala
Description: 10223 músala m.n. 'pestle' AV., 'club' Mn., musra- n. lex. 2. *muṣala- or *muśala-. [s after u and in NIA. variation of ū with u point to non-Aryan origin (J. Bloch BSOS v 741 ← Drav.: see also maṣati)]

Name: musalī
Description: 10224 musalī f. 'the plants Curculigo orchioides and Salvinia cucullata' lex.

Name: musta
Description: 10226 musta m.n., °tā- f., °taka- m.n. 'the fragrant grass Cyperus rotundus' Suśr., bhadra-musta- m. R̥tus. 2. *mōsta-.

Name: mū́ka
Description: 10231 mū́ka-, mūká- 'dumb' VS., ŚBr. 2. *mūga-. 3. *mukka-². 4. *mukkara-. 5. *mugga-. 6. *muṅga- (cf. *guṅga-). 7. *mōkka-. 8. *mōgga-. [A defective word-group poss. developed, with variations similar to those of other such groups, from mū́ka- which is in any case at least partly onom. (cf. *mūna-, *mōnna- 'silent' s.v. mauná-)

Name: mūḍʰá
Description: 10232 mūḍhá 'stupified' AV., 'stupid' Mn., 'gone astray' R. [mūḍhá- ~ mugdhá- is Indo-ir. (cf. Khot. mūysaṁdai 'foolish' with -ys- < IE. -ĝh- H. W. Bailey TPS 1960, 78, EWA ii 662), but was poss. associated with or gave rise to 'defective' word *muḍḍha-¹ in the group *muṭṭa-

Name: mūta
Description: 10233 mūta m.n. 'basket' TBr., '*bundle', mūtaká- n. 'little basket' ŚBr., mūtōḍī- f. BHSk. 2. mūṭa-, muṭa- m.n. 'basket, bundle' Kāraṇḍ. 3. *muṭṭa-³. 4. *mūṭha-. 5. *muṭṭha-². 6. mōṭa-¹ m. 'bundle' Divyāv. 7. *mōṭṭa-². 8. *mōṭha-¹. [← Drav. cf. Tam. muṭi 'knot, tuft, bundle' &c. DED 4030, Tam. muṭai 'to plait, braid' &c. (see muṭáti), and Tam. mūṭai, mūṭṭai 'sack, bundle' &c. DED 4134

Name: mūrcʰayati
Description: 10241 mūrchayati 'coagulates (milk)' Kauś., 'makes in a solid shape' AitBr., 'strengthens, excites' MBh. [√mūrch]

Name: mū́rti
Description: 10245 mū́rti f. 'any solid body' Up., 'figure' MBh., 'image, idol' Kāv. [√mūrch]

Name: mūrdʰán
Description: 10247 mūrdhán m. 'cranium, head, top, chief, beginning' RV.

Name: mū́la
Description: 10250 mū́la (mū́ra- AV.) n. 'root' RV., mūlaka- 'arising from' MBh., m.n. 'radish' Mn., mūlikā- f. 'root used in magic' Pañcat. 2. *mūḍa-. [Despite early occurrence and proposed connexion with Gk. μω̑λυ (IEW 750), variation of -l/r- ~ -ḍ- supports non-Aryan, perh. Drav., origin: cf. Tam. muḷā, muḷḷaṅki 'radish' &c., DED 4105. Prob. only chance resemblance with L. and Bi. forms of MIA. muḍḍha- < mūrdhán- with meaning of 'root']

Name: *mūlanārāyaṇa
Description: 10252 *mūlanārāyaṇa 'name of a local deity (?)'. [Cf. mū́radēva- m. 'a class of demons' RV., nārāyaṇá-]

Name: mūlavāpa
Description: 10253 mūlavāpa m. 'planter of edible roots' Mn. [mū́la-, vāpa-³]

Name: mū́lā
Description: 10254 mū́lā f., mū́la- m. '17th or 19th lunar mansion' AV.

Name: mūṣa
Description: 10258 mūṣa m., °ṣā- f. 'rat, mouse' Pañcat., mūṣaka- m. Yājñ., muṣ° lex. 2. mū́ṣika- m. 'rat, mouse' Gaut. [mū́ṣ-]

Name: mr̩gá
Description: 10264 mr̥gá m. 'wild animal, deer' RV. 2. mr̥gī- f. 'doe' R. 3. *mr̥gā-.

Name: mr̩ṇā́ti
Description: 10276 mr̥ṇā́ti 'crushes' AV., mr̥ṇáti RV., 'threshes' ŚBr. 2. Pp. mūrṇá-¹ AV. 3. *mr̥ṇṇa-. [*mr̥ṇṇa- from pres. stem (or < *mr̥dna-, cf. mr̥ditá- 'pressed down, squeezed' AV.: √mr̥d)

Name: mŕ̩ṇāla
Description: 10277 mŕ̥ṇāla n.m. 'edible lotus root' MBh., mr̥ṇālī- f. 'lotus' MBh., °lin- m. lex., °linī- f. Kālid., nom. sg. mulālī́ m. or f. 'id.?' AV.

Name: mr̩tá
Description: 10278 mr̥tá 'dead' RV., n. 'death' MBh., °aka- n. KātyŚr.com. [Pp. of mriyátē and máratē

Name: mr̩tamātr̩ka
Description: 10280 mr̥tamātr̥ka 'one whose mother is dead' Kathās. [mr̥tá-, mātŕ̥-]

Name: mr̩távatsā
Description: 10281 mr̥távatsā f. 'woman whose offspring or new-born child dies' AV., mr̥tavatsikā- f. lex. [mr̥tá-, vatsá-¹]

Name: mŕ̩ttikā
Description: 10286 mŕ̥ttikā f. 'earth, clay' VS. [*mr̥tti- in Pk. and some cmpds

Name: mr̩ddʰá
Description: 10294 mr̥ddhá 'forsaken' MaitrS. [márdhati 'neglects' RV. 'wets' Dhātup. (< '*softens'?) — The words of L. P., if derived from this, support an orig. meaning 'crush' for √mr̥dh: see EWA ii 595]

Name: mr̩dvīkā
Description: 10296 mr̥dvīkā f. 'vine, bunch of grapes' Suśr. [J. Charpentier's proposal (AO vii 191) of a hyper-sanskritism for *madvīkā- ← Ir. *maδvī- in Bal. mavīč 'raisins' leaves Pa. Pk. -u- unexpl.]

Name: mŕ̩ṣā

(S. with j- attests earlier y-). Relationship with √yu¹ or √yuj is obscure. Direct derivation (P. Tedesco OrLit 1932 col. 530) of *juḍa- < yuta- or *juṭṭa- < yuktá- is phonet. difficult. Poss. the series started with MIA. *yuṭṭa- which replaced yutta- and from which *yuṭati, *yōṭayati, &c. were analogically created (cf. truṭyati). Forms in H. M. with -ḷ- and -l- (< earlier -ḍ- or -l-) suggest non-Aryan origin or influence, or may be due to collision with yugala-

Description: 11058 lipi f. 'writing' Kāv., 'painting, drawing' lex. [← OPers. dipi (in Aś.shah. man. dipi-) X likháti (and limpáti in limpi- f. 'writing' Pañcar., cf. lipikara- m. 'plasterer' R.)]

Name: liptá
Description: 11059 liptá¹ (riptá- RV.) 'smeared' AV., 'sticking to' ŚBr., liptaka- 'smeared', m. 'poisoned arrow' lex. [√lip]

Name: *lipta
Description: 11060 *lipta² 'written'. [Formed from lipi- or, with EGS 151, same as liptá-¹]

Name: *liśati
Description: 11067 *liśati 'tears off' (ví liśatē 'is injured' TS.). 2. liśyatē 'is lessened, becomes small' Dhātup. 3. liṣṭa- 'lessened, decayed' lex. [~ *riśyatē, riṣṭa-¹

Name: *līra
Description: 11071 *līra 'defective'. 2. *lēra-. 3. *lēlla-¹. [Cf. *lēlla-² and the rhyming cīra-: see list s.v. *lakka-¹]

Name: *lukka
Description: 11072 *lukka¹ 'defective'. 2. *lugga- (~ *rugga-). 3. *luṅka-. 4. *luṅkha-. 5. *luṅga-. 6. *luṅgara-. 7. *lōkka-. [Direct derivation from MIA. (Pk.) lukka- 'broken' (anal. replacement of lutta- < lupta-) or lugga- 'id.' (~ rugga- < rugṇá-) is doubtful: most 'defective' word-groups provide words for 'rag, cloth'

Name: *luṭṭa
Description: 11076 *luṭṭa¹ 'defective'. 2. *luṭṭha-. 3. *luḍa- (~ *ruḍa-). 4. *luḍḍa-. 5. *luṇṭa- (~ *ruṇṭa-; cf. luṇṭāka- m. 'crow' lex.). 6. luṇṭhaka- m. 'robber' Hcar. (cf. *luṭṭati). 7. *luṇḍa- (~ ruṇḍa-). 8. *luṇḍara-. 9. *lōṭṭa-¹. 10. *lōṭṭha-. 11. *lōṇṭha-. [Cf. *laṭṭa-¹, *liṭṭa-¹, *lutta-: see list s.v. *lakka-¹

Name: *luṭṭa
Description: 11077 *luṭṭa² 'lump'. 2. *luḍa-². 3. luṇḍikā- f. 'ball, mass, excrement' lex. 4. *lōṭṭa-.² [Into this series, paralleled by *liṭṭa-³ and others s.v. *lakka-², would fit Pk. loṭṭha- < lōṣṭá- TS. which has similar variations of root vowel and ending in lōṣṭu- lex., lēṣṭu-, nēṣṭu- MBh

Name: *luṭṭati
Description: 11078 *luṭṭati 'plunders'. 2. *lūṭati. 3. lúṇṭati HPariś., luṇṭáyati, rúṇṭati Dhātup. 4. *luṭhati² (cf. lúṇṭhayati Rājat.). [Derivation of Pk. luṭṭa- from lupta-, proposed by P. Tedesco OrLit 1932, 532, is very doubtful. Poss. connected with 'defective' group s.v. *luṭṭa-¹ (cf. esp. luṇṭhaka-)

Name: luṭʰáti
Description: 11079 luṭháti¹ 'rolls, wallows' Dhātup. 2. *luṭhyati. 3. lōṭhayati 'sets in motion' BhP., lṓṭhati, rṓṭhati 'knocks down' Dhātup. [√luṭh]

Name: luḍáti
Description: 11080 luḍáti 'stirs', nuḍáti 'strikes' Dhātup., lulita- 'crushed, shaken' MBh. 2. *luḍyati 'is moved, swings'. 3. *luṇḍati 'rolls' (luṇḍī-kr̥ta- 'rolled up together' lex.). 4. lōḍayati 'agitates' MBh., lōlayati R., lṓḍati Dhātup., lōlati Śiś. 5. lōḍyatē 'is set in motion' MBh. [√luḍ]

Name: lúpyatē
Description: 11083 lúpyatē 'is lost, is removed' TS. (apalupyátē 'perishes' AV., lupyamāna- 'bewildered' MaitrUp.). 2. lumpáti 'destroys' Hariv., 'steals' BhP., 'elides' RVPrāt. 3. lupta- 'robbed of, lacking, lost, destroyed' MBh. 4. lōpayati 'neglects, infringes' MBh., 'eliminates' R. 5. *lōpyate 'disappears' (cf. lṓpya- 'concealed' VS.com. [√lup]

Name: *lumba
Description: 11088 *lumba² 'lump'. 2. *lumbara-. 3. *lōppa- (lōptrī- f. 'lump of dough' Bhpr. sanskritization of MIA. *loppaḍī- ?). [See list s.v. *lakka-²

Name: lūtā
Description: 11093 lūtā f. 'spider' Mn., 'a cutaneous disease (said to be caused by the exudation of spiders)' Rājat. 2. *lūttā-.

Name: lūṣáyati
Description: 11098 lūṣáyati¹ 'steals' Vop. (lṓṣati Dhātup.). 2. *lūṣṭa- 'stolen'. [T. Burrow JRAS 1956, 198 connects with IE. leu-s- (IEW 682); but poss. *luṭṭati X mūṣati

Name: lēkʰana
Description: 11103 lēkhana 'scraping' Suśr., n. 'act of scraping' Car., 'instrument for scraping' Kauś., lēkhanī- f. 'instrument for writing' MBh. [√likh]

Name: lēkʰaśālika
Description: 11106 lēkhaśālika m. 'pupil in a writing school' Camp. [lēkhaśālā-]

Name: lēkʰya
Description: 11108 lēkhya 'to be written' Yājñ., n. 'writing' MBh., 'document' Yājñ. [√likh]

Name: lēlya
Description: 11115 lēlya 'trembling' Vop. [lēlā́- f. 'quivering' ŚBr., lēlāyatē 'moves to and fro' MaitrS

Name: *lēlla
Description: 11116 *lēlla² 'lamb, kid'. [Cf. lēlya-: or poss. same as *lēlla-¹ with mng. 'small']

Name: lōká
Description: 11119 lōká¹ m. 'free space, world' RV., 'space, territory', ŚBr., 'people' Mn.

Name: lṓkatē
Description: 11122 lṓkatē 'sees' Dhātup. (lulōkē Bhaṭṭ). 2. lōkáyati 'shines' Dhātup. ('sees' R.) [Cf. lṓcatē 'sees', lōcáyati 'shines' Dhātup. which could also be source of MIA. and NIA. words below: but forms with lōk- (esp. cmpds.) are much more widely attested in literature than those with lōc-

Name: lōkanātʰa
Description: 11123 lōkanātha m. 'a name of Viṣṇu' MBh. [lōká-¹, nāthá-]

Name: *lōkiya
Description: 11125 *lōkiya-, lōkyà- 'pertaining to this or the next world' (M. A. Mehendale BSOAS xxv 600) ŚBr. [Cf. laukyá- AV., laúkika- ŚrS

Name: lōgá
Description: 11127 lōgá m. 'clod of earth' RV. [See list s.v. *lakka-². - Cf. 'defective' word-group s.v. *lukka-¹]

Name: lōdʰra
Description: 11139 lōdhra m. 'the tree Symplocos racemosa (red bark of which is used for dyeing)' MBh., °aka- m. lex. 2. rōdhra- '*red', m. 'S. racemosa' Kāv. [*rudh- ?]

Name: lōpāka
Description: 11140 lōpāka m. 'a kind of jackal' Suśr., lōpākikā- f. lex. 2. *rōpākya-. [Cf. rū́pakā- 'fox or jackal' AV

Name: lōptr̩
Description: 11144 lōptr̥ m. '*robber' (dharmasya l° MBh.). [Cf. lṓpā- f. 'a kind of bird' TS., lōpāyikā- f. lex

Name: *lōbʰa
Description: 11147a *lōbha-² 'agitation' in a-lōbha- m. 'the not going astray (of ratha-)' AitBr. [√lubh²]

Name: lōbʰyatē
Description: 11152 lōbhyatē 'is enticed' Kālid. [Pass. of lōbhayati 'entices' (from which Pk. pass. lōbhijjaṁta-)

Name: lōmaṭaka
Description: 11153 lōmaṭaka m. 'fox' Śīl. 2. *lōmaka- or *lūmaka-. 3. *lōmpaṭa-. [Poss. contaminations of *lōpi- with lṓman- and lūma-]

Name: lṓman
Description: 11154 lṓman n. 'hair on body of animals or men' RV. [~ rṓman-]

Name: lōṣṭá

Name: lōhá
Description: 11158 lōhá 'red, copper-coloured' ŚrS., 'made of copper' ŚBr., m.n. 'copper' VS., 'iron' MBh. [*rudh-]

Name: lōhakāra
Description: 11159 lōhakāra m. 'iron-worker', °rī- f., °raka- m. lex., lauhakāra- m. Hit. [lōhá-, kāra-¹]

Name: lṓhita
Description: 11165 lṓhita 'red' AV., n. 'any red substance' ŚBr., 'blood' VS. [< rṓhita-

Description: 11166 lōhitaka 'reddish' Āpast., n. 'calx of brass, bell-metal' lex. [lṓhita-]

Name: lōhī
Description: 11170 lōhī f. 'any object made of iron' Kāv., 'pot' Divyāv., lōhikā- f. 'large shallow wooden bowl bound with iron', lauhā- f. 'iron pot' lex. [lōhá-]

Name: laulāha
Description: 11172 laulāha m. 'name of a place' Stein RājatTrans ii 487.

Name: laúha
Description: 11172a laúha- 'made of copper or iron' Gr̥Śr., 'red' MBh., n. 'iron, metal' Bhaṭṭ. [lōhá-]

Name: lauhabʰāṇḍa
Description: 11173 lauhabhāṇḍa n. 'iron pot, iron mortar' lex. [laúha-, bhāṇḍa-¹]

Name: vaṁśīya
Description: 11181 vaṁśīya '*pertaining to bamboo' ('belonging to a family' BhP.) = vaṁśika- W. [vaṁśá-]

Name: váṁśya
Description: 11182 váṁśya m. 'crossbeam' BhP. 2. *vaṁśiya-. [→ Par. wē 'roof beam', Psht. bainš, Waz. wēša IIFL i 296

Name: vakrá
Description: 11185 vakrá 'crooked, curved' AV. [Cf. poss. non-Aryan vaṅkú-, vaṅká- which were associated with vakrá-

Name: vaŋka
Description: 11191 vaṅka¹ '*bent, crooked', m. 'bend of a river' lex. [Like vaṅkú-, belongs to or has been infl. by a prob. non-Aryan word-group for 'bent, crooked' (S. K. Chatterji JGIS iii 49, PMWS 87) or with more general 'defective' meaning s.v. *vaṅka-² ~ vyaṅga-. Variants with bh- and p- s.vv. bhaṅgi- (cf. bhaṅgurá- ~ vaṅkú-, vaṅkara-) and paṅgú-. No doubt both vaṅka-¹ and vaṅkú- were pop. associated with vakrá- (as bhaṅgurá- with bhaṅga-¹)]

Name: vaŋga
Description: 11197 vaṅga⁴ m. 'name of a people' MBh., vaṅgī́ya- adj. Pāṇ.gaṇa.

Name: vacā
Description: 11201 vacā f. 'a kind of aromatic root (Acorus calamus?)' Hcar.

Name: *vacī
Description: 11202 *vacī 'statement'. [In vaci-bhēdāt KātyŚr. ac. to com. but this contains *vacin- ~ MIA. vaca- as in Aś. (J. C. W.)- vácas-]

Name: *vajjaraṭṭʰa
Description: 11203 *vajjaraṭṭha 'name of a tree'. [Cf. vajrāsthi- f. 'seed of Asteracantha longifolia' Apte ('the tree' MW), vajra- m., vajraśr̥ṅkhal{ik}ā-, vajrāsthiśr̥ṅkhalā- f. 'A. longifolia' lex., vajradruma- m. lex., vajravr̥kṣa- m. Suśr. 'name of various trees' (in all of which vajra- due to pop. or learned etym.); *vañja-, vañjula-]

Description: 11208 váñcati 'moves (with a stick), crawls' AV., 'travels' Bhaṭṭ., vañcayati 'moves (with a stick)' ŚvetUp., 'escapes from' MBh., °tē 'deceives' MBh. 2. vacyátē 'flies, is poured forth' RV. [√vañc]

Name: *vañja
Description: 11209 *vañja or *vañjha- 'oak'. [NTS ii 266 compares vanaja- m. 'name of various trees' (semant. cf. Av. vanā- 'tree' > Par. γan 'oak' EVP 87), which is, however, perh. learned formation for *vañj{h}a-

Name: vañjula
Description: 11210 vañjula m. 'name of various trees and plants including Jonesia asoka and Calamus rotang' MBh., °laka- m. BhP., °likā- f. lex.

Name: vaṭa
Description: 11213 vaṭa³ m., °aka- m.n. 'small lump' ŚārṅgS., 'round cake of pulse fried in oil' Suśr., vaṭikā- f. 'small lump' Pañcat., °ṭakā- f. Dhūrtan.

Name: vaḍabʰi
Description: 11220 vaḍabhi f. 'ridge of roof' R., valabhĭ̄- f. MBh. 2. valīka- n. 'projecting thatch, reed' Kauś., valika- m.n. 'edge of thatched roof' W. [Cf. vala-]

Name: *vaḍrapʰala
Description: 11228 *vaḍraphala 'name of a tree'. [Cf. mahāphala- m. 'Aegle marmelos', °lā- f. 'a kind of colocynth, the big jujube, a citron tree' lex

Name: vaṇṭa
Description: 11236 vaṇṭa² 'tailless' Gaut., 'unmarried, dwarf' lex. 2. vaṇṭha-² 'crippled, unmarried, dwarf' lex. 3. *vaṇḍa-. 4. vaṇḍara- m. 'eunuch' lex. 5. *vaṇḍha-. 6. *vaṭha- (váṭhati 'is fat' Dhātup.). 7. vaṭhará- 'dull, stupid' Hcat. (vaṭara- 'wicked, unsteady' lex.). 8. *vaṭṭha- (perh. sanskritized as baṣṭa- 'fool' for which EWA ii 422 rightly rejects Johansson's (KZ 36, 371) derivation < *bel-s-to-). 9. *vantha-. [Group of 'defective' words to which *vaṅka-² and prob. vandhya- belong: see baṇḍá-]

Name: vatsá
Description: 11239 vatsá¹ m. 'calf, child' RV., voc. as term of endearment MBh., vatsā- f., ŚāṅkhŚr., vatsaka- m. 'little calf' Mn., vatsikā- f. 'heifer' Yājñ. [Orig. 'yearling' and same as vatsa-²]

Name: vatsatará
Description: 11241 vatsatará m. 'young bull or goat before weaning or copulation', °rī́- f. TS. [vatsá-¹]

Name: vatsará
Description: 11242 vatsará m. '5th or 6th year in a cycle of 5 or 6 years' TS., 'year' Mn. (n. MaitrUp. etc.). [vatsa-²]

Name: vadāla
Description: 11247 vadāla-, °aka- m. 'a kind of Silurius or sheat fish' lex.

Description: 11250 vadhū́ f. 'bride, young wife' RV., 'son's wife' HPariś., vadhukā- f. lex.

Name: vadʰūvára
Description: 11253 vadhūvára n. sg. or m. pl. 'bride and groom' HPariś. [vadhū́-, vará-²]

Name: vána
Description: 11258 vána¹ n. (once m. R.) 'single tree' RV., 'forest, timber' RV. 2. vanikā- f. 'grove' MBh.

Name: vánati
Description: 11260 vánati, vanṓti 'desires, gains, makes ready' RV. 2. *vanvati or pass. *vanyatē. [√van]

Name: vanarājī
Description: 11265 vanarājī f. 'row of trees, long track of forest' MBh. [vána-¹, rā́ji-]

Name: vanavāsa
Description: 11265a †vanavāsa- 'dwelling in the forest' R., vanavāsin- m. 'anchorite' Mn. [vána-¹, vāsá-²]

Name: vanēcara
Description: 11269 vanēcara-, vanacara- m. 'forest-dweller, forest animal' MBh., °rī- f. BhP. [vána-¹, cará-¹]

Name: vandā
Description: 11272 vandā f. 'the parasitical plant Epidendrum tesselatum', vandāka- m., °kā-, °kī- f. 'Vanda roxburghii' lex. [Cf. vándana-² n. 'a parasitical plant' AV.]

Description: 11275 vandhya 'barren, sterile' Mn. [Perh. belongs to 'defective' group s.v. vaṇṭa-²]

Name: ványa
Description: 11277 ványa 'growing in a forest' AV., n. 'anything grown in a wood' MBh., vānya- Baudh. [vána-¹]

Name: vanyā́

Name: *vanva
Description: 11279 *vanva 'desiring'. [Cf. vanṓti, pres. part. vanvánt- RV., vanú- m. 'enemy, friend' RV

Name: *vapana
Description: 11283 *vapana¹ 'weaving'. [Cf. vapanī- f. 'weaver's instrument, weaver's shop' Apte, vápati 'weaves' Dhātup

Name: vapā́
Description: 11287 vapā́¹ f. 'caul, omentum' VS., 'mucous secretion of bones, marrow, fat' lex. [Cf. vapā́vant- 'having an omentum' RV.]

Name: *vaptra
Description: 11289 *vaptra 'sowing, seed land'. [Cf. vaptr̥- m. 'sower' Mn., uptrima- 'sown, cultivated' Pāṇ.com

Name: vápra
Description: 11291 vápra m.n. 'mound, rampart' MBh., 'sown field' Dharmaś., vaprā- f. 'garden bed'. [√vap²]

Name: vamrá
Description: 11296 vamrá m. 'ant', °aká- m. 'small ant' RV., vamrī- f. lex. [Cf. valmī-]

Name: váyas
Description: 11305 váyas² n. 'enjoyment, energy, prime of life, age' RV. [√vī]

Name: vayasyà
Description: 11306 vayasyà 'of the same age', m. 'comrade' MBh., °yaka- m. Kathās., °yā- f. 'woman's confidante' Mr̥cch. [váyas-²]

Name: vára
Description: 11308 vára¹ m. (n. MBh.) 'choice, boon' RV., adj. 'choicest' ŚrS. 2. váram 'better than' RV. [√vr̥²]

Name: vará
Description: 11309 vará² m. 'suitor, bridegroom, husband' RV., varaka- m. ŚāṅkhGr̥. [√vr̥²]

Name: varaka
Description: 11310 varaka¹ m. 'cloak', n. 'cloth, cover of a boat' lex. [√vr̥¹]

Name: varaka
Description: 11311 varaka² m. 'Phaseolus trilobus, a kind of rice' lex. [Cf. varaṭa-¹, varvaṭa-]

Name: varaṭa-
Description: 11313 varaṭa-¹, baraṭa- m. 'seed of safflower' Gr̥hyas., varaṭā- f. lex. [Cf. varaka-², varvaṭa- ?]

Name: varaṇá
Description: 11314 varaṇá¹ m. 'the tree Crataeva roxburghii' AV. (BR), varāṇa-, varuṇa- m. Hariv.

Name: varaṇḍa
Description: 11317 varaṇḍa m. 'mass, heap of grass' lex., °ka- m. 'small mound of earth' KātyŚr.com., 'wall' lex. [→ Pers. barāmda → K. brā̃d m. 'front-doorstep' (or < *dvarānta-), N. baramdā, barandā 'raised platform before house'. Scarcely to be separated, with LM 402, from veranda, cf. HJ 964]

Name: varayātrā
Description: 11322 varayātrā f. 'procession of suitor or bridegroom' lex. [vará-², yā́trā-]

Name: varā
Description: 11323 varā f. 'Asparagus racemosus and other plants' lex. [Cf. varī-]

Name: varāhamūla
Description: 11326 varāhamūla n. 'name of a place in Kashmir' Rājat. [varāhá-, mū́la- ?]

Name: varī

Name: *varītr̩ṇa
Description: 11329 *varītr̥ṇa 'straw of a kind of grain'. [varī-, tŕ̥ṇa-]

Name: várṇa
Description: 11338 várṇa¹ m. 'appearance, colour, class' RV., 'good colouring' Mn., varṇaka- m.n. 'model, specimen' Kathās., 'pigment' AitĀr., °ṇikā- f. 'id.' lex., 'dress of actor' Mālatīm.

Name: varṇa

Name: *vartapānīya
Description: 11355 *vartapānīya 'stone and water' (used for cleaning after defecation). [*varta-³, pānī́ya-]

Name: vartalōha
Description: 11357 vartalōha n. 'a kind of brass (i.e. *cup metal?)' lex. [*varta-² associated with lōhá- by pop. etym.?]

Name: várti

Apte, bahēṭaka- m. lex. [vibhī́daka- was affected by the names of the other two constituents of the triphala-, viz. harītaka- and āmalaka-: thus vibhī́taka- after the former (in its turn replaced by harīṭaka- after vibhīṭaka-), while after the second vibhēdaka- or *vibhēḍaka- was replaced by *vibhēlaka- (or MIA. -l- < -ḍ-). Initial v- was assimilated to b- by the following -bh- (cf. a similar assimilation in vihvala-) and so appears in Pk. and all NIA. forms except M

Name: vīṭā
Description: 12045 vīṭā f. 'small piece of stick shaped like a barley-corn and struck in the game of tipcat' MBh., 'a kind of metal ball held in the mouth in penance', vīṭaka- n. 'a roll of betel and areca nut' Pañcad., vīṭikā- f. 'id.' Daś., 'knot of a garment' lex., vīṭī- f. 'the betel plant' lex. [This belongs to a group of words characterized phonet. by (1) initial v, b or zero, (2) ĭ̄ or ē or ū̆ or ō, (3) a single or double retroflex or dental stop, voiced or unvoiced, with or without nasal; and semant. by a general meaning of 'something round or rolled' and more particularly as (1) 'a drop', (2) 'a lump', (3) 'a pad or mat', (4) 'something wrapped or wrapping', (5) 'a round stalk, stem, stick, handle': any of these meanings being liable to occur in any of the phonetic forms. Austro-as. connexions have been proposed for some by Kuiper PMWS 32. See also vīṭī-, viṭápa-, vŕ̥nta-¹, bindú-, índu-, iṇḍvà, uṇḍuka-]

'animal living in holes' Suśr., 'cat' VS., vr̥śadatī- 'ep. of cat' AV., viṣadaṁṣṭrā- f. 'plant used as antidote to snake-bite' lex. (similarly śŕ̥ṅgika- m. (lex.), śārṅgaviṣa- n. (Yājñ.) 'a vegetable poison' ~ viṣaśr̥ṅgin-, vr̥ṣasr̥kkin- m. 'wasp' lex.), vŕ̥ścika- m. 'scorpion, various insects'. Perh. vr̥ṣadaṁśa- (vr̥kadaṁśa-, mr̥gadaṁśa-) 'parasite' by pop. etym. from vr̥śa- 'id.' (~ vŕ̥ścika- ?). Semant. for 'parasite ~ dog' cf. kōká- and vr̥ṣadaṁśa- above (J. C. W.)

[Meaning and initial v- are confirmed by Av. vərət̰ka-, Pers. gurda 'kidney'. vr̥kkā- 'heart' is X non-Aryan bukka- 'intestines (heart, liver, lungs, &c.)' which in its turn in NW. (Tor. K. L. WPah.) and M. gained mng. 'kidney' (com. on Amarakośa ii 6, 64 s.v. bukkāgramāṁsa- appears to refer to kidneys confused with heart and liver). RV. vr̥kkḗ (Padap. vr̥kkáḥ) 'in belly' is poss. a hyper-vedic substitution for bukka- (J. C. W.)

[There has been collison (cf. RV. vr̥ktvī́ replaced by AV. vr̥ṣṭvā́) of √vr̥k (RV. vr̥kṇá-¹: Av. varč- 'drag') with √vraśc in vŕ̥kṣatē and with √vr̥ś (vr̥śa-, vr̥ṣa- in vr̥ṣadaṁśa- s.v. vr̥kadaṁśa-, vŕ̥śyati 'chooses' ~ várkatē 'accepts' Dhātup. (J. C. W.)

(as well as those already mentioned) may be from an old *vērā- ~ vḗlā- rather than all be loans from the East Hindi-Bihari area

Name: vēśa

Name: *śrēḍa

Poss. *śriḍa- (< *śr̥ta-² rather than *śīrta-) X *trēḍḍa-. But other 'defective' words have rhyme-forms beginning with ś-, e.g. kuṇṭha- ~ śuṇṭha-]

Name: śvāvídʰ
Description: 12766 śvāvídh m. 'porcupine' AV. 2. *śuvāvidh-. 3. sēdhā- f. Yājñ. 4. *sēḍhā-. [sēdhā- is prob. with T. Burrow BSOAS xii 141 ← Drav., Tam. ey, Tel. ēdu, &c. DED 2283 (and not with Lüders PhilInd 177 < *śvavidh-). The retroflex in śvāviḍh- (nom. °viṭ, °viḍ) of some MSS. of Āpastamba and most of Baudhāyana and in *sēḍhā- also suggests non-Aryan origin. But if sēdhā- was replaced through pop. etym. by śvāvidh-, the antiquity of the latter is attested by its occurrence in AV., by the ċ- of Dm. and s- of Kt. and Pr. and by śuv- ~ śv- in *śuvāvidh-

Name: śvāśurá
Description: 12767 śvāśurá m. '*father-in-law's son, i.e. wife's or husband's brother' (P. Thieme ZDMG 106, 153, Turner BSOAS xxiii 106) later replaced by śvaśuryà- leaving śvāśura- as 'dependent (son, pupil?) of father-in-law's grandson (śvāśuri-), and later 2. 'pertaining to a father-in-law' Kathās. [śváśura-]

Name: ṣáṣ
Etyma: PIE *\*swéḱs*.\nThe discrepancy between Sanskrit *ṣ-* and NIA *cʰ-*, Dardic *ṣ-* is explained by Lubotsky (2000) as different levellings of original Indo-Aryan *\*ṣváṭ*, with *-v-* dropped in Sanskrit in analogy with the ordinal form [*ṣaṣṭí*](/parameters/12804), while it is retained in MIA to deliver the NIA forms (and in Dardic rounds the following vowel).

[sṓ < sá u; *sē, the extension of which does not exactly agree with that of -ē < -aḥ, is < *sá ī or is MIA. < RV. sḗd (sá íd) Pischel GrPk 299 or sḗm (sá īm). Forms in Kaf. and Dard. G. Morgenstierne IL v 361 ff.]

(EWA i 313 with lit.) is supported by Aś.gir. sachāya = shah. saṁkhaya, the development of kś > khy and cch being parallel with that of kṣ > kkh and c̣c̣h (NW.), cch (SW.)

Name: sájati
Description: 13085 sájati 'is attached, embraces' Dhātup. (ásakta aor. 'adhered to' TBr., ā́sajāmi 'place in' RV.). 2. *sājayati. 3. sañjayati 'attaches to' Bhag., 'couples' Mn. 4. sajyátē (sajjatē MBh.) intr. 'hangs on' ŚBr., 'is occupied with' MBh. 5. saktá- 'clinging to' AV. [Kaf. Dard. K. and WPah. presuppose MIA. *ṣā̆{y}-, *ṣajj- (*ṣacc-), *ṣatta-. These may derive from √sañj with ṣ- replacing s- in the simplex after cmpds. with ati (AV.), vyati (TBr.), anu (ŚBr.), abhi (MBh.), ni (RV.), pari (MBh.), prati, vi (TS.), adhivi (MBh.), abhivi (BhP.). Dhp. has ṣaǵa- ~ saṅgá- Brough Dhp 101. Cf. similar replacement of dental by retroflex in √sthā, √stambh. T. Burrow's (BSOAS xii 650) assumption of a √*sraj ~ √*sañj is unlikely and unnecessary. All NIA. words under 1 and 2 (except Kho. šoyek in which š- can derive only from ś- or ṣ-, since śr- is preserved) phonet. and semant. equally well (1) < śráyati in Si. sayanavā, (2) < śrāyayati (IIFL iii 3, 170, Buddruss Woṭ 125, Burrow KharDoc 14). But this would not account for their association with intr. or pass. stem *ṣajj- or *ṣacc-, and pp. and pret. *ṣatta-. Possibly śráyati and *ṣajati coalesced in NIA. as a pres. st. for which only *ṣajj- (replaced anal. by *ṣacc-) and *ṣatta- served as pass

[sa-², jyā́-. — But prob. both in specialized use with bow and arrow and in more general mng. 'ready' (MBh.), 'equipment, dress, &c.' (NIA.) conn. with √sañj, i.e. sajya- '*what is put on' > 'ready (of equipment)' > 'ready', cf. āsakta- 'donned' R., prasajyā- f. 'application' Pat., K. sanz infl. by sañjayati &c. (J. C. W.) — In mng. 'fresh' see also sadyás, sadyōja-.]

Name: síkatā
Description: 13386 síkatā f. 'grain of sand', (usu. pl.) 'sand, gravel' VS., sigatā- f. Kap. [Collective formation from sika- in śvēta-sika-druka- 'scattering white sand' TĀr. 1. 12. 3 A. Sharma in Bhārata-kaumudī 873. Kaf. and some Dard. forms attest IA. ś- corresponding to Ir. θ- and s- (OPers. θikā-, Bal. six, Psht. šəga, &c. EVP 73) and support E. Benveniste BSL xxx 60 in assumption that s- forms of Sk. and other Dard. languages and WPah. (which distinguish ś and s) are loans from or influenced by Iranian. Variations in Kaf. and Dard. of -g- ~ -k- and -l- ~ -t- may be due to borrowings within that group or to later Ir. influences or they may, in part at least, be due to suffix. variation like that of síkatā- ~ *sikatī- (in sikatyà- VS.) ~ siktā- lex. ~ *sikyā-]

'(bowl) for collecting the scooped footprint of the soma-cow' ŚrS. (Caland-Henry Agniṣṭoma p. 38) conceived of by pop. etym. as containing pad-haraṇa- (J. C. W.)
